This is a very challenging 70km ultra-trail Marathon with plenty of climbs and descents and gain of over 3,000m. It will take runners through all of the landscapes that the Nature Reserve has to offer.Racers will start running with strong headlamps into the darkness and soon the long first climb up to Bo Dieu village will begin. This is a very serious and steep climb which it is not possible to run up. Runners must conserve their energy here! At the top the route turns downhill onto a descent into the river valley.As the sun rises runners will race into the picturesque village of Ban Hieu. This fairytale settlement features traditional stilt houses which dot the hillside and a turquoise river with rapids and waterfalls which cascades down to the valley floor.After reaching the top of the climb you will enjoy sweeping views of the valley before descending back down to link up with the 42km route. Following the small village of Ban Nua a rolling section on a quiet, concrete route includes plenty of climbing as you head deeper into the nature reserve with thick jungle on either side.Having passed by Ban Cao Hoong village the route arrives at the tiny settlement of Ban Kit. From here on the race goes truly remote.Next you will head onto small off-road trails climbing to up to Thanh Cong village and then a tough jungle section follows with some narrow, technical trail and a climb we like to call ‘The Spike’.Before reaching Kho Muong you will be rewarded with an utterly spectacular view of a valley ringed with incredibly steep, jungled limestone mountains. During the end of May, the colours of the rice fields are beautiful, so the knockout views from the lookout point will make all but the most fiercely competitive stop for a photo opportunity.The descent down to the valley here is very technical and will require care. Once down in the valley a flat section of beautiful trail leads through the picturesque village of Kho Muong from where you will face a long final climb before a short hilly tarmac section.After descending back down into the Nature Reserve on ‘wonder trails’ you will reach another small settlement and from here you are on the finishing stretch of trail through a breathtaking valley. After crossing some bamboo and wood bridges you will be on the home run to the Ban Hang Race Village where a well deserved meal and the finish party await.

New for 2019, the 55km offers an ultra distance route of extreme beauty. It cuts out some of the toughest parts of our longest route, but make no mistake – this is still a very challenging ultra!Racers will start running with strong headlamps into the darkness and soon the long first climb up to Bo Dieu village will begin. This is a very serious and steep climb which it is not possible to run up. Runners must conserve their energy here! At the top the route turns downhill onto a descent into the river valley.As the sun rises runners will race into the picturesque village of Ban Hieu. This fairytale settlement features traditional stilt houses which dot the hillside and a turquoise river with rapids and waterfalls which cascades down to the valley floor.After reaching the top of the climb you will enjoy sweeping views of the valley before descending back down and running through a broad rice-filled valley which will be a magical gold colour at the height of harvest season.After a climb into the Nature Reserve you will face a tough jungle section with some narrow, technical trail and a very steep climb we like to call ‘The Spike’.Before reaching Kho Muong you will be rewarded with an utterly spectacular view of a valley ringed with incredibly steep, jungled limestone mountains. During the end of May, the colours of the rice fields are beautiful, so the knockout views from the lookout point will make all but the most fiercely competitive stop for a photo opportunity.The descent down to the valley here is very technical and will require care. Once down in the valley a flat section of beautiful trail leads through the picturesque village of Kho Muong from where you will face a long final climb before a short hilly tarmac section.After descending back down into the Nature Reserve on ‘wonder trails’ you will reach another small settlement and from here you are on the finishing stretch of trail through a breathtaking valley. After crossing some bamboo and wood bridges you will be on the home run to the Ban Hang Race Village where a well deserved meal and the finish party await.

Soon after the start you will be racing along dirt trails past small villages with mountains and golden rice fields all around.Following the small village of Ban Nua a rolling section on a quiet, concrete route includes plenty of climbing as you head deeper into the nature reserve with thick jungle on either side.Having passed by Ban Cao Hoong village the route arrives at the tiny settlement of Ban Kit. From here on the race goes truly remote.You will head onto small off-road trails climbing to up to Thanh Cong village and then a tough jungle section follows with some narrow, technical trail.Before reaching Kho Muong you will be rewarded with an utterly spectacular view of a valley ringed with incredibly steep, jungled limestone mountains. During the end of May, the colours of the rice fields are at their very best, so the knockout views from the lookout point will make all but the most fiercely competitive stop for a photo opportunity.The descent down to the valley here is very technical and will require care. Once down in the valley a flat section of beautiful trail leads through the picturesque village of Kho Muong from where you will face a long final climb before a short hilly tarmac section.After descending back down into the Nature Reserve you will reach another small settlement and from here you are on the finishing stretch of trail through a breathtaking valley. After crossing some bamboo and wood bridges you will be on the home run to the Ban Hang Race Village where a well deserved meal and the finish party await.

The race starts in a broad valley where golden rice fields are surrounded by mountains. Running on dirt trail you will pass numerous pretty villages heading deeper into the Nature Reserve on a section with some challenging climbs, then the trail links back up with the 70km and 42km route.Before reaching the stunning Kho Muong village racers will be rewarded with an utterly spectacular view of a valley ringed with incredibly steep, jungled limestone mountains. During the end of May, the colours of the rice fields are at their very best, so the knockout views from the lookout point of vibrant rice paddies and jungle-clad mountains will make all but the most fiercely competitive stop for a photo opportunity. Weâll also have a photographer here some of the time so be sure to look at your trail running best here!The descent down to the valley here is very technical and will require care. Once down in the valley a flat section of beautiful trail leads through the picturesque village of Kho Muong from where you will face a long final climb before a short hilly tarmac section. After descending the finishing stretch of trail crosses some bamboo and wood bridges and brings you to Ban Hang Race Village where a well deserved meal and the finish party await.

200km    –     6 stagesYou have already run through the desert!? You have already run through the jungle!? You have already run in the mountains!? You have already run in the snow!?But you have never run in the happiest country on earth!Bhutan is the only country in the world that measures the progress of society in terms of “Gross National Happiness”.Join us and experience the charm and magic of one of the world’s most secret countries.Experience an amazing landscape, run through evergreen prime forest, pass amazing monasteries and immerse yourself in traditional Buddhist culture.Start the race at the terrific situated Punakha Dzong, definitely the most beautiful dzong in Bhutan.Run through rural villages and cross three 3500m passes.Stay in farmhouses more than a century old, or in the small cells of the young monks in a monastery at 3500m.Finish the race at the most spectacular and mystic monastery on earth, hanging in the cliffs at an altitude of 3000m with an outstanding view to the Paro valley, the Taktshang Goemba, also known as "The Tiger’s Nest".Be part of this experience by participating in this international running event in Bhutan. We offer you a full board stage race that will leave you with deepest satisfaction.

Event: Gt6 Trail Running & Walk Trail - Apuan Alps Italy 2019
Description:
Il GT dal Mare alla Vetta è un evento volto alla promozione del territorio della provincia di Massa Carrara e dello sport in natura valorizzando le risorse turistiche, gastronomiche e naturalistiche del Comune di Carrara.Evento unico nel suo genere, con i suoi 32 km e 2200 metri di dislivello positivo ti lascerai alle spalle il mare per raggiungere, in breve tempo, la vetta del Monte Sagro (Alpi Apuane) a 1753 metri di altitudine e ammirare un panorama mozzafiato.Dell’evento fanno parte una gara agonistica di Trail Running in semi-autonomia e una camminata libera non competitiva in autonomia. Vengono organizzate senza scopo di lucro dai volontari dell’A.S.D. Grande Trekking in collaborazione con il Club Alpino Italiano sezione di Carrara, le Associazioni Locali e le persone che credono in questi valori.
Description in English
The GT from Mare to the Vetta is an event aimed at promoting the territory of the province of Massa Carrara and sport in nature, enhancing the tourist, gastronomic and natural resources of the Municipality of Carrara.One of its kind, with its 32 km and 2200 meters of positive altitude, you will leave behind the sea to reach, at short notice, the summit of Mount Sagra (Apuane Alps) at 1753 meters above sea level and admire a breathtaking panorama.The event is part of a semi-autonomous Trail Running racing race and a free, non-competitive walk in autonomy. They are organized non-profit-making by volunteers from the A.S.D. GrandeTrekking in collaboration with the Club Alpino Italiano section of Carrara, Local Associations and people who believe in these values.
Entry Fee:
Il costo per l’iscrizione alla GT TRAIL Running è:

    € 22 fino al 15/01/2019
    € 30 fino al 20/04/2019
    € 35 fino al 20/05/2019
    *SOCIO C.A.I. (Club Alpino Italiano) € 22

Description: The Pen Llyn Coastal & Trail Marathon is a must for those who love the outdoors. An Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, Blue Flagged Beaches and views that will distract your fatigue. We can guarantee these are races you will remember long after the finishing line.

La 41km si corre sull’antica via del Sale Appenninica utilizzata in passato dai mercanti che dalla Liguria portavano olio e spezie verso la Pianura e verso il nord.Su sentieri puliti e ben tracciati, tra faggi e castagni, attraversando immensi pascoli erbosi su di un percorso in linea come in un lungo viaggio. Dalla Piazza Colombo di Bettola, risalendo per un tratto il torrente Olza, si raggiunge il passo del Cerro, luogo di partenza della non competitiva “Lunga Marcia”, si prosegue poi fino all’abitato di Montosero per arrivare sugli stupendi prati del Monte Osero e poi scendere al Passo della Cappelletta. Un tratto di asfalto di 3 km, l’unico dell’intero trail , ci porterà alla lunga salita del Monte Aserei e poi sui pascoli alti in località Fontana del Faggio. Scesi all’abitato di Ciregna  un’ultima breve salita in singletrack ai Groppi di Lavezzera  per arrivare al Passo del Mercatello.  Qualche km di relax attraversando boschi e pinete da favola fino alla prima vera salita della gara che porta al  Monte Carevolo, a quota 1520 m, con splendida visuale sull’intera valle. Da qui al Monte Crociglia, per un doveroso saluto all’Angelone, il passo è breve, poi si scende verso la Vecchia Dogana punto di arrivo della gara.
Description in English
On clean and well-traced paths, among beech and chestnut trees, crossing immense grassy pastures on a path in line as in a long journey.From Piazza Colombo di Bettola, going up the Olza stream for a while, you reach the Cerro pass, the starting point of the non-competitive "Lunga Marcia", then continue up to the village of Montosero to reach the beautiful meadows of Monte Osero. then go down to Passo della Cappelletta. A 3 km stretch of asphalt, the only one of the entire trail, will lead us to the long ascent of Monte Aserei and then to the high pastures in Fontana del Faggio. I went down to the town of Ciregna a last short ascent in singletrack to Groppi di Lavezzera to get to the Pass of Mercatello. A few kilometers of relaxation through woods and fairytale pine forests until the first real ascent of the race that leads to Monte Carevolo, at an altitude of 1520 m, with a splendid view over the entire valley. From here to Monte Crociglia, for a dutiful greeting to the Angelone, the step is short, then we descend towards the Old Customs point of arrival of the race.
Entry Fee:
Fino al 30/04: EURO 35.00
Dal 01/05 al 23/05: EURO 40.00
IL GIORNO DELLA GARA: EURO 50.00 escluso servizio navetta
SERVIZIO NAVETTA per il ritorno da Selva a Bettola:+ EURO 10.00

Description:
La Skyrace dei Crinali una vera e propria skyrace.  Per chi ama il “Fast&Light”. Per chi vuole forti emozioni. Dal primo all’ultimo chilometro. Senza un attimo di respiro. Si corre su crinali aspri e rocciosi, tra laghetti alpini e faggete millenarie, toccando le cime più affascinanti dell’Alta Val Nure. Crociglia, Bue, Nero, Maggiorasca, Lago Nero, Valle Tribolata, Ciapa Liscia, Groppo Rosso, Dente delle Ali. Tutto in 25 km. Tutto in 1680 mt di dislivello positivo (senza dimenticarsi di quello negativo).
Description in English
The Skyrace of the Crinali a real skyrace. For those who love "Fast & Light". For those who want strong emotions. From the first to the last kilometer. Without a moment of breath. It runs on rugged and rocky ridges, between alpine lakes and millenarian beech forests, touching the most fascinating peaks of the Alta Val Nure. Crociglia, Bue, Nero, Maggiorasca, Lago Nero, Valle Tribolata, Ciapa Liscia, Groppo Rosso, Dente delle Ali. All in 25 km. All in 1680 meters of positive difference in height (without forgetting the negative one).
Entry Fee:
€25 fino al 31/12/18
€30 dal 01/01/19 al 30/04
€35 dal 01/05 al 23/05
€45 sul posto il giorno della gara
€5 di sconto dal 01/01/19 per i tesserati fisky 2019

Description:
Courir dans le vignoble classé au Patrimoine Mondial de l'Unesco, profiter d'un paysage somptueux et partager un moment sportif et convivial. C'est le programme du trail de Saint Emilion.
Description in English
Running in the vineyard part of the world heritage of UNESCO, enjoying of the exceptional landscape and sharing a great event in sport and friendship. This is the program our Saint Emilion's trail !

Courir dans le vignoble classé au Patrimoine Mondial de l'Unesco, profiter d'un paysage somptueux et partager un moment sportif et convivial. C'est le programme du trail de Saint Emilion.
Description in English
Running in the vineyard part of the world heritage of UNESCO, enjoying of the exceptional landscape and sharing a great event in sport and friendship. This is the program our Saint Emilion's trail !
Montagne et D+
Entry Fee: 27,5euros. 17,5 euros si vous apportez à manger.

Description: This fantastic running event enjoys its first year at the superb Dhunikhal BHOWALIGAON(Nainital) our second running destination after successfully organized "Ultra Warrior - Rishikesh Edition" running event.Nainital is famous for its beautiful lake side, surrounded by beautiful green mountain, perfect destination for summer vacation along with this running event.Dhunikhal BHOWALLGAON(Nainital) a quaint village at 6,300 feet above sea level is a small village set amidst an Oak and Rhododendron Forest only 15 kilometers from Nainital. The drive takes only 20 minutes to get there. The entire drive is through the forested area of Cheena Peak Range via Snow View Point and Kilbury the main habitats for excellent birding. One can see a variety of Himalayan species along the way such as lammergeyer, Himalayan griffon, blue-winged minla, spotted & slaty-backed forktail, Rufus-bellied woodpecker, rufous-bellied niltava, khalij pheasant, variety of thrushes etc. Almost 150 bird species have been recorded at Dhunikhal BHOWALLGAON and surrounding areas.We are giving our runners a yet another chance to admire and enjoy the run in between the Oak trees and Jungle trails at one of the most beautiful destination of Uttarakhand in totally different way.If you are looking for that next adventure a "Mountain Run Challenge" or just need to keep your training on Jungle Trail Track, this is a very beautiful course along with "Dhunikhal BHOWALLGAON(Nainital) " and in between the "Naini Mountain". This could be your next great experience along with weekend family fun or going for some glory.It's the Mountain Run Challenge of 10km, 25km and 50km category you choose.Route location : Dhunikhal BHOWALLGAON(Nainital)Sunday 26th May - Race Day Schedule50km Flag-Off Time : 5:30AM Cut off 9.0 Hours25km Flag-Off Time : 6:30AM Cut off 4.5 Hours10km Flag-Off Time : 7:00AM Cut off 2.5 Hours**Runners will get T-shirt,Ecertificate & Hydration support in between route.**There will be no timing Chip**post run one meal for all participants.Cll any query at 8112859985 (10 am to 5 pm)
Un nouveau parcours de 50km dans Lavaux, qui fait partie du patrimoine de l'UNESCO, avec des points de vues magnifiques sur les Alpes et le lac LĂŠman

Bienvenue dans les entrailles de la Terre avec « L’Expérience Grande Traversée Volcanic » allias « XGTV ». Une expérience unique pour un fabuleux voyage volcanique à travers le plus grand parc naturel régional de France métropolitaine : Le Parc Naturel Régional des Volcans d’Auvergne, inscrit au Patrimoine Mondial de l’UNESCO. L’Expérience Grande Traversée Volcanic® est l’une des épreuves proposées dans le cadre de la Volvic Volcanique Expérience VVX®, organisée par l’Association Aventure en Terre Volcanique et majoritairement sponsorisée par la Marque Volvic®.Son concept original et ses spécificités hors normes la distinguent d’autres courses. L'esprit de l’Expérience Grande Traversée Volcanic® repose sur l'engagement mental, l'esprit d'équipe et d'aventure, ainsi que sur les valeurs sportives et la pratique de la moyenne montagne.Cette épreuve d'ultra endurance emmène les concurrents sur une longue traversée des Volcans d’Auvergne de 220 km et 7500  D+, traversant les plus emblématiques GR de 5 territoires : les Monts Dômes, les Monts Dore, le Massif du Cézallier, le Massif du Cantal et le Plateau de l’Artense. Cette course Aventure où les participants seront seulement munis d’une trace GPX road book et suivront à 95% le balisage des GR (rouge / blanc) nécessite un bon sens de l'orientation sur et hors sentiers. Le tracé permet de découvrir la richesse et la diversité des différents territoires de l’ensemble du Parc Naturel Régional des Volcans d’Auvergne. L’Expérience Grande Traversée Volcanic® se réalise en équipe de 2 participants indissociables et solidaires, avec un classement final. Les équipes évoluent dans un milieu montagnard parfois rude et exigeant d’où la nécessité d’avoir un bon niveau technique, physique et mental.
Description in English
Welcome to the bowels of the Earth with "The Great Volcanic Crossing Experience" allias "XGTV".A unique experience for a fabulous volcanic journey through the largest regional natural park in metropolitan France: The Regional Natural Park of the Auvergne Volcanoes, listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.The Volcanic® Great Crossing Experience is one of the events offered as part of the Volvicic Volvic Experience VVX®, organized by Volcanic Land Adventure Association and mostly sponsored by the Volvic® Brand.Its original concept and its unconventional specificities distinguish it from other races. The spirit of the Volcanic® Great Crossing Experience is based on mental commitment, team spirit and adventure, as well as sports values ​​and the practice of the middle mountain.This ultra-endurance race takes competitors on a long crossing of the Auvergne Volcanoes of 220 km and 7500 D +, crossing the most emblematic GR of 5 territories: the Monts Dômes, the Monts Dore, the Massif du Cézallier, the Massif du Cantal and the Plateau de l'Artense. This Adventure race where participants will only have a GPX road book mark and will follow 95% markup of GR (red / white) requires a good sense of direction on and off trails. The route allows to discover the richness and the diversity of the different territories of the whole Regional Natural Park of the Volcanoes of Auvergne.The Grand Traversée Volcanic® Experience is realized in a team of 2 indissociable and solidarity participants, with a final ranking. Teams evolve in a mountain environment sometimes rough and demanding from where the need to have a good technical level, physical and mental.

Race: Ultra Trail Expérience - Chaîne Des Puys - Faille De Limagne
Description:
Trail au cœur des volcans d’Auvergne qui s’adresse aux coureurs aguerris, proposé également en formule relais duo et trio. Dessinée tout autour de la Chaîne des Puys, cette course propose une découverte inédite de ce territoire d’exception grâce à un tracé plutôt équilibré et l’ascension de plusieurs puys. Parmi ceux-là un passage au sommet du mythique Puy de Dôme (altitude 1465m) est prévu pour le lever de soleil. Et pour cette deuxième édition de la VVX, le parcours réservera quelques belles surprises…
Description in English
Trail in the heart of Auvergne volcanoes, aimed at seasoned riders, also offered as a duo and trio relay formula. Drawn all around the Chaîne des Puys, this race offers an unprecedented discovery of this exceptional territory thanks to a rather balanced layout and the ascent of several puys. Among these, a visit to the summit of the mythical Puy de Dôme (altitude 1465m) is planned for the sunrise. And for this second edition of the VVX, the course will reserve some nice surprises ...

Trail qui s’adresse aux coureurs initiés, proposant un tracé dessiné sur la partie nord du Parc Naturel Régional des Volcans d’Auvergne, tout autour de l’impluvium de Volvic, zone naturelle protégée qui donne naissance à l’eau minérale du même nom. Cette course offre de superbes vues sur la Chaîne des Puys qui s’étend sur plus de 30km vers le sud, entre faille de Limagne, vallons encaissés, et plateau des Dômes.
Description in English
Trail for beginners, offering a route drawn on the northern part of the Auvergne Volcanoes Regional Nature Park, all around the Volvic impluvium, protected natural area that gives birth to the mineral water of the same name . This race offers superb views of the Chaîne des Puys stretching more than 30km to the south, between the Limagne Fault, valleys, and Plateau des Dômes.

Nouvelle course proposée pour cette deuxième édition de la VVX qui vous fera parcourir une partie du trail Expérience Chaîne des Puys  afin d’y découvrir certains volcans emblématiques du nord de la Chaîne des Puys, comme le Puy de la Nugère, le Puy de Jumes et le Puy de la Coquille. Ce trail vous promet également une vue exceptionnelle depuis le Puy des Gouttes
Description in English
New race proposed for this second edition of the VVX that will take you through some of the Chaîne des Puys experience trail to discover some iconic volcanoes from the north of the Chaîne des Puys, such as Puy de la Nugère, Puy de Jumes and the Puy de la Coquille. This trail also promises an exceptional view from Puy des Gouttes

Trail court et accessible, au dénivelé limité, empruntant un tracé nature dessiné entre Volvic et ses villages environnants. Cette course qui offre plusieurs panoramas d’exception sur la Chaîne des Puys est également dessinée au cœur d’une zone privilégiée en matière d’extraction de la célèbre pierre de Volvic et propose ainsi des passages inédits aux abords de plusieurs carrières emblématiques du territoire.Accessible à partir de 16 ans et plus
Description in English
Trail short and accessible, with limited height difference, taking a natural route drawn between Volvic and its surrounding villages. This race offers several exceptional panoramas on the Chaîne des Puys is also drawn in the heart of a privileged area in terms of extraction of the famous stone Volvic and offers new passages in the vicinity of several iconic quarries of the territory.Accessible from 16 years and over

Description:
Caminos en piedra, paisajes exóticos,salida desde Jordán en el cañon del Chicamocha, el gran ascenso y la llegada en Barichara el pueblito mas lindo de Colombia hacen la combinación perfecta para la media maratón.
Description in English
Temperatures between 12 and 42 degrees Celsius, several vertical kilometers, trails in stone, varied flora and fauna, spectacular landscapes, a high difficulty of the route, contrasts of vegetation, weather and altitude, historic and colonial towns and more, you will find it in the seventh Edition of CHICAMOCHA CANYO RACE.

Caminos en piedra, paisajes exóticos,salida desde Jordán en el cañon del Chicamocha, el gran ascenso y la llegada en Barichara el pueblito mas lindo de Colombia hacen la combinación perfecta para la media maratón.

Beau, technique, rapide et exigeant. 100% nature, 200% plaisir.Parcours à travers les paysages splendides de Haute Provence avec ascension de la montagne de Lure. Direction le sommet par le barrage de la Laye et la montée des Ybourgues. Panoramas splendides sur le plateau du rocher d’Ongles avant d’atteindre les champs de Lavande de Lardiers. Vous êtes au pied de la montagne de Lure ; direction le Contras … jusqu’aux Antennes en passant par la Baisse Malecort. La vue à 360° est époustouflante, le Ventoux, les massifs du Dévoluy et des Ecrins, le Verdon et la Sainte Victoire. La descente à travers la forêt jusqu’à Saint-Etienne-les-Orgues est un délice. A ce moment, il vous reste 2 bosses à enchaîner : la montée vers Fontienne et celle des Mourres. Au cœur des champignons de pierre, la citadelle s’offre à vous…droit devant. Il vous reste 3 km de descente…avant de rejoindre l’arrivée au coeur du village de Forcalquier.

Beau, technique, rapide et exigeant. 100% nature, 200% plaisir.Parcours à travers les paysages splendides de Haute Provence ! Au départ de Saint-Etienne-les-Orgues, le tracé rejoint celui de l’Ultra de Lure à la Bergerie du Gros Chêne. Vous êtes au pied de la montagne de Lure ; direction le Contras … jusqu’au refuge de Lure, la Sauvagine, en passant par la Baisse de Malcort. La vue à 360° est époustouflante, le Ventoux, les massifs du Dévoluy et des Ecrins, le Verdon et la Sainte Victoire. La descente à travers la forêt vous permettra de passer par l’abbaye de Notre Dame de Lure, avant de rejoindre Saint-Etienne les Orgues. A ce moment, il vous reste 2 bosses à enchaîner : la montée vers Fontienne et celle des Mourres. Au cœur des champignons de pierre, la citadelle s’offre à vous…droit devant. Il vous reste 3 km de descente…avant de rejoindre l’arrivée au cœur du village de Forcalquier.

Beau, technique, rapide, exigeant, 100% nature, 200% plaisir.Parcours à travers les paysages splendides de Haute Provence. Le début du parcours est commun avec l’Ultra de Lure. Puis après le ravitaillement au cœur du village de Limans, il faudra traverser la Laye pour rejoindre le Clos de Melly et le tracé du Trail des Mourres jusqu’à Forcalquier.

Beau, technique, rapide, exigeant, 100% nature, 200% plaisir.Parcours de nuit en équipe de 2 pour découvrir les sensations du Trail à la frontale. Le début du parcours est commun avec le THP solidaire. Puis après le ravitaillement au cœur du site des Mourres, vous rejoignez le Clos de Melly jusqu'à Fontienne avant d'attaquer la dernière montée des Truqyes et son décor de western pour rejoindre le site emblématique des Mourres. Géants calcaires témoins de la présence de la mer il y a quelques millions d'année. Ensuite droit devant, le coeur de Forcalquier vous attend pour une arrivée dans le village trail running du THP.

Segunda carrera en antigüedad de las Islas Canarias. Recorrido con una belleza proporcionalmente a  su dureza por uno de los pueblos más bonitos de España, Tejeda. Trail en estado puro sólo para aquellas personas que tengan kilómetros en sus piernas.
Description in English
Second race in antiquity of the Canary Islands. Tour with a beauty proportional to its hardness by one of the most beautiful villages in Spain, Tejeda. Trail in pure state only for those people who have kilometers on their

Distancia media de la Circular de Tejeda, una carrera de larga distancia condensada en sólo 25 km que no da tregua a los corredores. Vistas y paisajes espectaculares en uno de los pueblos más bonitos de España, Tejeda.¿Te animas a probar?
Description in English
Medium distance of  Circular de Tejeda, a long distance race condensed in only 25 km that gives no respite to the runners. Views and spectacular passages in one of the most beautiful villages in Spain, Tejeda. Do you want to try?

Distancia corta de la Circular de Tejeda, pero no te equivoques, la dureza y el sufrimiento no te los quita nadie en los 12 km. Parajes y lugares espectaculares en uno de los pueblos más bonitos de España. ¿Quieres probar?

Percurso de 20km em total autonomia, na região do Morro Tapera com 90% de single-tracks e 10% de estrada de terra. Com subidas e descidas íngrimes e técnicas proporcionando aos participantes a possibilidade de aprimorarem sua técnica e testarem sua performance em uma corrida 100% trail. 
Description in English
Competition in a 20km itinerary in total autonomy, in the Morro Tapera region with 90% of single tracks and 10% of dirt road. With steep climbs and descents and techniques giving participants the possibility to improve their technique and test their performance in a 100% trail run.

Percurso que se desenvolve por trilhas técnicas e bem demarcadas, onde, em virtude da alta dificuldade técnica, existe a dificuldade do desenvolvimento do trote e da corrida nas subidas e descidas. Devendo os atletas terem muita atenção para evitarem acidentes.  
Description in English
This course is developed by technical and well-marked trails, where, due to the technical difficulty, there is the difficulty of running and jogging on ascents and descents. Athletes should be very careful to avoid accidents.

Percurso que se desenvolve por trilhas técnicas e bem demarcadas, onde, em virtude da alta dificuldade técnica, existe a dificuldade do desenvolvimento do trote e da corrida nas subidas e descidas. Devendo os atletas terem muita atenção para evitarem acidentes.
Description in English
This course is developed by technical and well-marked trails, where, due to the technical difficulty, there is the difficulty of running and jogging on ascents and descents. Athletes should be very careful to avoid accidents.

Volta circular completa a la Vall de Ribes de 100Km i 6.926m de desnivell positiu i 6.926m de desnivell negatiu que permet coronar els cims més representatius de la vall. Entre daltres bastions de pas cal destacar la Covil, Puigmal, Eina, Noufonts, Noucreus, Torreneules, Balandrau i el Taga.Es tracta duna cursa exigent que posa a prova la resistència física i mental dels corredors que han de córrer la major part del temps al voltant de la cota 2.000m.Lalçada mitja de la prova és de 1.871m i sassoleix la cota màxima al cim del Puigmal (2.910m).
Description in English
Complete circular route in the Vall de Ribes of 100Km with a positive height difference of 6.296m and 6.296m negative, crowning the valleys most representative peaks: Covil, Puigmal, Eina, Noufonts, Noucreus, Torreneules, Balandrau and Taga..This is a demanding race that tests the runners physical and mental stamina on a trail that for the most part is at an altitude of over 2.000m.The average height of the race is 1.871m and the highest point is at the peak of Puigmal (2.910m).
Entry Fee:

Del 01/01/19 al 15/04/19: 100€
Del 16/04/19 al 30/04/19: 125€

Assegurança d'anul.lació: 10€
Ecogot: 2€, per a la reposició de líquids en els avituallaments.

Description:
Cursa circular de 76Km i 5.497m de desnivell positiu i 5.497m de desnivell negatiu que amb sortida i arribada a Ribes de Freser permet coronar els bastions més alts de la Vall de Ribes, el Puigmal, Eina, Noufonts, Noucreus, Torreneules, Balandrau i el Taga.Es tracta duna cursa ideal pels que volen iniciar-se a les proves de llarga distància o vulguin provar-se abans de fer la prova reina.Lalçada mitja de la prova és de 2.057m i sassoleix la cota màxima al cim del Puigmal (2.910m).
Description in English
A circular race of 76Km with a positive and negative height difference of 5.497m and starting and finishing at Ribes de Freser. This is a trail that takes the runners to the highest peaks of the Vall de Ribes, the Puigmal, Eina, Noufonts, Noucreus, Torreneules, Balandrau and Taga.It is an ideal race for those wanting to start out on long distance trails or wishing to test themselves before the main event.The most part of the race is at an altitude of over 2.000m with an average height of 2.057m and the highest point is at the peak of Puigmal (2.910m).
Entry Fee:
Fins al 31/12/2018: 68€
Del 01/01/19 al 15/04/19: 80€
Del 16/04/19 al 30/04/19: 100€

Assegurança d'anul.lació: 10€
Ecogot: 2€, per a la reposició de líquids en els avituallaments.

Description:
Cursa circular de 50Km i 2.825m de desnivell positiu i 2.825m de desnivell negatiu que amb sortida i arribada a Ribes de Freser permet coronar un dels bastions més emblemàtics de la Vall de Ribes, el Torreneules.Tot i no tenir el quilometratge clàssic d'una marató, per lorografia del terreny, aquesta prova serà la marató dels SkyRaces.Lalçada mitja de la prova és de 1.844m i sassoleix la cota màxima al cim del Balandrau (2.585m).
Description in English
A circular race of 50Km with a positive and negative height difference of 2.825m and starting and finishing at Ribes de Freser that allow to crown permite coronar one of the most emblematic peaks of the Vall de Ribes, Torreneules.Although this trail does not have the classical distance of a marathon, the layout makes it the marathon of the SkyRaces.The average height of the race is 1.844m and with the highest point at the peak of Balandrau (2.585m).
Entry Fee:

Description:
Euskal Herria Mendi Erronka (EHME) distantzia luzekomendi lasterketa bat da, Ultra Trail bat, baina oinarrianaldarrikapena ere baduen lasterketa da, euskalmendizaletasunaren nortasuna, mendi lasterketa,lurraldetasuna, ofizialtasuna, Plazaola natur gunea etaeuskara sustatzea helburu du.Lasterketa honek 67 km eta 7.200 metroko gainbehera du,eta Leitzan hasi eta bukatzen da, Araitz-Betelu, Larraun etaLekunberritik pasatu ondoren. Herri horiek mendizinguratuta daude eta kirol izaera errotua dute.La EH MENDI ERRONKA es una carrera monte a travésde larga distancia. Una “ultratrail”, aunque en esencia,en nuestro caso, se trata de una prueba que encierrauna reivindicación, potenciar el montañismo euskaldun,las carreras de montaña, nuestra identidad nacional, asicomo el euskera y el entorno natural del Plazaola.EHME es una carrera por montaña de 67 kms Y de 7200mde desnivel acumulado, con salida y llegada en el corazónde Euskal Herria, Leitza. Transcurre por Araitz-Betelu,Larraun y Lekunberri. Pueblos impregnados de bellasmontañas y famosos por su cultura deportiva.
Description in English
The EH MENDI ERRONKA is a race throughlong distance An "ultratrail", although in essence,in our case, it is a test that enclosesa vindication, to promote the euskaldun mountaineering,mountain races, our national identity,like the Basque language and the natural environment of the Plazaola.EHME is a mountain race of 67 kms and 7200mof accumulated altitude, with departure and arrival in the heartof Euskal Herria, Leitza. It runs through Araitz-Betelu,Larraun and Lekunberri. Peoples impregnated with beautifulmountains and famous for their sport culture.

Description: This race is 100% trail with the exception of a few road crossings. A lot of the course is ran on the Ice Age Trail.

The trail begins at the La Ferme Reservoir wall and proceeds along the dam bank and vegetable gardens for 3km before climbing slowly at frst then more rapidly, up the Corps de Garde mountain, giving wonderful views of all Mauritius, until arriving at the summit. Then, the path plunges rapidly down over hyper-technical paths, not for the faint-hearted!, back down to the La Ferme lake, going along the emuddy edge and then climbing the pass between the Corps de Garde mountain and the Montagne St-Pierre through forest, then passing 4km oaver flat canefields, time to recover, then down the pass again, round the base of the St-Pierre mountain, then up to its summit at 550m, down through technical paths and round the base, through the Bambous village and back to the starting point.

La distance mythique du marathon dans un village de 900 habitants !A 2 pas des terrils, découvrez les prémices des collines d'Artois. Noyé dans une campagne verdoyante à côté de Bruay et Olhain, notre petit village de La Comté vous réserve bien des surprises avec ses châteaux, son moulin et son église du XV siècle. Nos parcours sillonnent bois, sous-bois, champs. Ils longent cours d'eau, sentiers pierreux, crêtes... Et cerise sur le gâteau, vous ne manquerez pas de dénivelé ! Du haut de ses 189 mètres, le Mont de la Comté (réputé pour son spot de parapente) rigole déjà de vous voir grimacer ! Mais quelle récompense ensuite d'admirer ces magnifiques paysages et de croiser tout au long du parcours vaches, lapins, lièvres, faisans et, pour les plus chanceux, nos biches et chevreuils !Le Trail des Hobbits à La Comté, c'est aussi entrer dans la légende du célèbre roman "Le Seigneur des Anneaux" de JRR Tolkien. Venez défier les Hobbits avec leurs pieds poilus et décrochez votre précieux à l'arrivée dans une ambiance festive avec de nombreuses animations.

The race is based in the village of Naseby which is famous for the battle in 1645The race follows a 35 mile loop taking in some of the most interesting country houses and historical sites in England includes Naseby, Althorp (home of the Spencerfamily), Cottesbrooke, evidently the house Jane Austen used as the basis for Mansfield Park as well some stunning countryside.

Description: Qui a dit que le Beaujolais était plat ?Le 1er  juin prochain, venez découvrir l’un des 3 beaux parcours trail (37km/1500D+  ; 18km / 670D+ ; 8,8km / 320D+) cheminant entre vignes et forêts, aux difficultés bien dosées et pourquoi pas, engranger 1 ou 2 points ITRA sur le 18 ou le 36km, épreuves qualificatives pour l’UTMB®.Faire découvrir de beaux points de vue et de nouveaux chemins, partager l’ambiance bon enfant de ce petit village beaujolais, voilà la mission que s’est fixée l’organisation.Et pour profiter au mieux de cette journée, buvette et jambon à la broche vous seront proposés en fin de parcours… pour prolonger le plaisir, tout simplement ! Un vrai retour aux sources…Points forts : beauté des paysages, beaux points de vues sur les Alpes, la vallée de la Saône et celle de l’Azergues. Accueil très très très chaleureux d’un petit village
Entry Fee:
23€ jusqu'à fin mars
25€ jusqu'à fin avril
28€ jusqu'au jeudi 30 mai minuit

La Travesía Integral de los Montes Aquilianos es una prueba pedestre,la salida y la meta están situadas en la Plaza del Ayuntamiento de Ponferrada y su trazado discurre por el valle del río Oza, Montes de Valdueza, Peñalba de Santiago y el cordal de los Montes Aquilianos, alcanzando en la Silla de la Yegua los 2135 m de altitud.	Para realizarla pueden escogerse dos itinerarios diferentes “A” o “B”, aunque con dos tramos comunes que van desde Ponferrada a Montes de Valdueza y desde Ferradillo a Ponferrada. El itinerario “B” o “la corta”, es muy asequible para personas con una preparación física mediana; basta con ser un caminante habitual para realizar este recorrido sin grandes complicaciones. Su longitud es de unos 45 km y no se suben las pendientes más fuertes ni el cordal montañoso, el desnivel acumulado, igual tanto subiendo como bajando, por ser la salida y meta el mismo punto, es de 1687 m . El recorrido “A” o “la larga”, aparte de los tramos comunes, tiene uno propio desde Montes de Valdueza, pasando por Peñalba y el cordal aquiliano, hasta Ferradillo, el recorrido total, con una longitud aproximada de 60 km y un desnivel acumulado de 2947 m tiene tramos de pendiente muy fuerte y para hacerlo hay que tener una buena preparación física y mental.	En función de la dureza de los tramos y de la preparación, se puede hacer andando o corriendo, los itinerarios están totalmente balizados con estacas o marcas en rocas, árboles o muros y la organización sitúa varios puntos de avituallamiento y control, en los que los participantes pueden proveerse de frutas, pastelitos, frutos secos, bocadillos, agua y otras bebidas.
Description in English
The Integral Crossing of the Aquilianos Mountains is a pedestrian test, the exit and the goal are located in the Town Hall Square of Ponferrada and its route runs through the valley of the Oza River, Montes de Valdueza, Peñalba de Santiago and the mountain range of the Montes Aquilianos, reaching in the Chair of the Mare the 2135 ms of altitude.To do it, you can choose two different itineraries "A" or "B", although with two common sections that go from Ponferrada to Montes de Valdueza and from Ferradillo to Ponferrada. The "B" or "the short" itinerary is very affordable for people with a medium physical preparation; It is enough to be a habitual walker to make this journey without great complications. Its length is about 45 km and do not climb the steepest slopes or the mountainous mountain range, the accumulated unevenness, equal both up and down, for being the exit and goal the same point, is 1687 m.
Entry Fee:
Hasta el día 31 de marzo del 2019:
Socios del C. D. Rutas del Bierzo: 20 €
No socios: 30 €
Desde el 1 de abril hasta el 30 de abril de 2019:
Socios del C. D. Rutas del Bierzo: 25 €
No socios: 35 €

Теперь не нужно ехать далеко от Москвы, чтобы попробовать настоящий трейл, получить удовольствие от бега по естественному рельефу и зарядиться позитивом трейлраннинг-сообщества! Мы предлагаем вам интересную и непростую трассу БлизКо от метро. Трассу, позволяющую убежать от суеты большого города и побыть наедине с собой и природой.BliZko Trail – это соревнование по трейлраннингу в Салтыковском лесопарке, расположенном в десяти минутах от метро Новокосино. Район забега – междуречье Руднёвки и Чечёры (притоков речки Пехорки, впадающей в Москву-реку). Трасса проходит большей частью по старым лесным тропам. На территории лесопарка в Руднёвку впадают многочисленные ручьи, в том числе Банная и Никольская Канавы, через которые будут организованы броды для полноценного ощущения настоящего трейла. Кроме того, в Салтыковке сохранились четыре пруда из живописного каскада тринадцати прудов, созданного еще в 18 веке. Вдоль двух самых красивых, Жёлтого и Тарелочкина, проходит трасса, а на берегу Тарелочкина пруда разместится основной пункт питания.Blizko Trail – никаких парковых аллей и искусственных дорожек, только естественные тропы, грунтовые дороги и настоящий лес в получасе от центра города.
Description in English
For everyone who does not want to go far away from Moscow but still wish to enjoy running on the natural terrain and charge themselves with the spirit of the trail-running community! We offer you an exciting and not that easy Blizko-Trail just near one of Moscow East subway stations. The route allows you to get away from the hustle and bustle of the big city and enjoy the forest within just 40 min subway trip from the city center.BliZko Trail is hold in the Saltykovsky Forest Park, ten minutes walk from Novokosino subway station. The Forest Park is located in between Rudnyovka and Chechera rivers (tributaries of Pekhorka river, tributary of Moscow river). There is a number of streamlets flowing into Rudnyovka, and fords will be arranged over two of them - Bannaya and Nikolskaya Ditches.Just four ponds have survived out of 18th century beautiful 13-pond cascade, and our trail-runners will run along two of them, picturesque Yellow and Tarelochkin ponds. Main refreshment point will be located on the bank of Tarelochkin pond.Saltykovsky is more of a forest than a park, thus most of the route runs along old forest paths. No park alleys, no gravel paths, just natural trails, dirt roads and the real forest feel.

Теперь не нужно ехать далеко от Москвы, чтобы попробовать настоящий трейл, получить удовольствие от бега по естественному рельефу и зарядиться позитивом трейлраннинг-сообщества! Мы предлагаем вам интересную и непростую трассу БлизКо от метро. Трассу, позволяющую убежать от суеты большого  города и побыть наедине с собой и природой.BliZko Trail – это соревнование по трейлраннингу в Салтыковском лесопарке, расположенном в десяти минутах от метро Новокосино. Район забега – междуречье Руднёвки и Чечёры (притоков речки Пехорки, впадающей в Москву-реку). Трасса проходит большей частью по старым лесным тропам. На территории лесопарка в Руднёвку впадают многочисленные ручьи, в том числе Банная и Никольская Канавы, через которые будут организованы броды для полноценного ощущения настоящего трейла. Кроме того, в Салтыковке сохранились четыре пруда из живописного каскада тринадцати прудов, созданного еще в 18 веке. Вдоль двух самых красивых, Жёлтого и Тарелочкина, проходит трасса, а на берегу Тарелочкина пруда разместится основной пункт питания.Blizko Trail – никаких парковых аллей и искусственных дорожек, только естественные тропы, грунтовые дороги и настоящий лес в получасе от центра города.

Description:
’Ohm, l’unité de mesure de la résistance a l’effort symbolise parfaitement ce trail dont le parcours proposé regorge de difficultés comme, pour ne citer que cet exemple, un dénivelé de 1850m D+ sur le parcours de 35km, ce qui est un record en Belgique. Vous alternerez passages techniques, single tracks, passages roulants, montées et descentes.Cependant, ce qui fait surtout l’attrait de cette épreuve est son parcours. Un parcours magnifique qui emmène les trailers à travers des réserves naturelles, des sentiers comparables à ceux que l’on trouve dans les montagnes en France et leur fait ainsi découvrir les splendides coins sauvages de la région d’Aywaille comme La terriblement belle vallée du Ninglinspo, variée dans tous les sens du terme, ludique et corsée… Un régal tout comme les autres lieux traversés: la Haie des Gattes, les Fonds de Quarreux et d’autres lieux enchanteurs. Veritable trail aussi dur que magnifique, L’Ohm trail vous fera souffrir ave le sourire !
Description in English
The Ohm, measurement unit of effort resistance perfectly symbolizes this trail which is full of difficulties, to cite just a fex examples: an elevation of 1950m D on the 35km race, which is a record in Belgium. You will also alternate technical passages, single tracks, crossings, mounts and descents.However, what makes the attractiveness of this event is his track. A beautiful course that takes the trailers through nature reserves, trails that are comparable to those found in the mountains in France and its path will make you discover the splendid wild region of Aywaille as the terribly beautiful valley of Ninglinspo, varied in every sense of the term, playful and spicy... A treat just like the other places passed through: the hedge Gattes, the Quarreux Fund and other enchanting places.True trail as hard as beautiful, the Ohm trail will make you suffer with a smile!

Description:
ΔΙΕΘΝΕΙΣ ΑΓΩΝΕΣ ΨΗΛΟΡΕΙΤΗΤρέξε στα βήματα του Δία
Description in English
The race start point is Nida’s plateau, the highest plateau in Crete (average altitude, 1400 m.) The name comes from the articulation of the words "stin Ida", meaning "at Ida", where Ida is the second name of Psiloritis mountain. The view of the plateau and the feeling that’s created from all the infertile summits around you, trying to reach up the sky, makes right inside you the reason why the spirit of the cretan man transmuted to a deity, why Zeus connected his name with that area…Nida of myths.Nearby, there’s a sculpture made of stone called "the rebel of Peace", stands for reminding the resistance of the villages around. (Place for warming up)A few meters higher, there’s a dirt road passing by Ideon Antron, a cavern with a great archeological interest. Zeus’s crying, the noise of the shields that Kourites were whacking according to the myth, Amalthia’s horn of plenty (cornucopia) and so many other legends for that place, brought up generations of pilgrims from all over Greece. That cave was already a cult site (sanctuary) by the end of the 4th millennium BC and continued being one with distinctive prosperity periods during the Late Minoan, the Geometric and the Roman years; all the offerings that were found there proved that.The marking of the European path E4 leads us after 2.5 km by an uphill couloir with a southwest route to a location called Akolita, a minor plateau, crossroad for most of the paths that lead to the summit of Psilorits. There we can see a lot of mitata, small stone lodgings with a characteristic architecture (protect shepherds from cold temperatures or rain, storage of milk and cheese)From Akolita, we continue uphill to meet a second couloir, leaving behind us a col called "sela tou Digeni" (Digenis’ saddle) and the summit called "Mavri Korfi" (Black summit)The wildness of the landscape offers serenity to the soul in a strange way and the view is already really special while we traverse Agathias (2424 m ) from the north side and after that, we finally have a visual contact with the summit, Timios Stavros (Rood), our fist target. When we get to the top, we can see the little church, dedicated to The Holy Rood and to Apostles Peter and Paul, built on 1900 AD, also very famous for the holy cross, that anyone who wishes could stop to see.The view from up there is literally breathtaking, since we can see almost the whole island: from the west side the impressive White Mountains (also called Madares by the locals), to the east is Dikti (Lassithi mountains), to the south the biggest plain of Crete, Messara and the cordillera of Asterousia Mountains by the Libyan Sea and to the north the city of Heraklion and Rethymnon by the Cretan Sea.From this point starts the descent, always following the marking E4 trail until we reach Kalogrades, another plateau with dense undergrowth right opposite to Kedros mnt (1777 m) and the fascinating sight of the Paximadia islets placed in the Libyan sea and even western Gavdos Island and Gavdopoula islet, the southest point of Europe. After Kalogrades, at Toumpotos Prinos location (1500 m altitude) we meet the shelter of the mountaineering club of Rethymno, which was built on 1984 and has availability for 30 beds. There’s one tree there, a great holm oak (that’s what prinos means) which pleasurably predispose for Pardi, a wood which starts some meters lower. From that point, the path stops and a dirt road of 13 km leads us to Kouroutes, our final destination. Just 3 km from the shelter there is a small cave, which its entrance is not clearly visible, due to roadwork that took place the past few years, but once, it was an entrance to a cave with stalactites and stalagmites. Mountains of Crete abound of caves; apart from that it’s known that Crete has the most caves in Greece and the deepest cave chasm in Europe.After that we enter Pardi, the impressive holm oak woodland of Psiloritis with so old trees perfectly harmonized to the landscape. The final destination is approaching; after we pass Mesoskouro and 2.5 km before the termination point, at a location called Lakoudia, we start see the houses and the olive trees of people that live in Kouroutes

六甲山の最高に美しい景色と最高に素晴らしい眺望、そして最高に走れるトレイル、緑眩しい六甲山を駆け抜けて下さい。ゴールは摩耶山頂聖地掬星台。ランナーのゴールを掬星台からの絶景が待っています。
Description in English
Mount Rokko has the breathtaking scenery and the runner friendly trails. Just enjoy greenery Mt. Rokko! Finish line is Kikuseidai on the top of Mt. Maya. The spectacular view from there is waiting for your finish!

Description:
Trail sui sentieri delle montagne della Val di Susa all'ombra della Sacra di San Michele, monumento simbolo del Piemonte.
Description in English
Run on the mountain trails of the Val di Susa around of the Sacra di San Michele, a thousand-year-old monastery symbol of Piedmont.

Trail sui sentieri delle montagne della Val di Susa all'ombra della Sacra di San Michele, monumento simbolo del Piemonte.
Description in English
Run on the mountain trails of the Val di Susa around of the Sacra di San Michele, a thousand-year-old monastery symbol of Piedmont.

El Gran Trail Aldeas do Courel está concebido como el Trail de larga distancia de referencia en Galicia. Además de ser la primera prueba de este tipo en dicha comunidad, aspira a ser el buque insignia del circuito GMTA.Además de por su distancia y desnivel acumulado, que ha merecido en ocasiones anteriores ser valorada con 3 puntos clasificatorios para el UTMB, merece la pena por discurrir por una selección de los mejores paisajes de la Serra do Courel, buena parte de ellos encuadrados dentro de la Red Natura 2000 por su alto valor natural.
Description in English
The Gran Trail Aldeas do Courel is conceived as the long distance reference trail in Galicia. In addition to being the first test of its kind in this community, it aspires to be the flagship of the GMTA circuit.In addition to its distance and cumulative altitude, which has deserved in previous occasions to be rated with 3 qualifying points for the UTMB, it is worth to pass by a selection of the best landscapes of the Serra do Courel, a good part of them framed within the Natura 2000 Network for its high natural value.

Race: V Mini Trail Aldeas Do Courel
Entry Fee:
15 € hasta el 13 de mayo de 2018 
20 € desde el 14 de mayo de 2018 hasta el 20 de mayo de 2018

Description: Un parcours fortement retravaillé cette année. Pour donner le tournis aux concurrents et aux spectateurs on change de sens ! Après deux kilomètres de « mise en route » on repasse non loin du départ pour le plus grand plaisir des spectateurs. Ensuite, c’est une belle balade de 18 km en rive gauche de la Mayenne. De chemins creux en sous-bois forestiers le parcours offre de beaux panoramas et quelques moments de bravoure…Pour le ravito de mi-course, retour sur le village May’Eco Trail ; l’occasion d’échanger avec les proches, de se changer, de faire une sieste, … La deuxième boucle emprunte le parcours du 24 km sur les communes de Changé et Saint Germain le Fouilloux. Points d’orgues de cette partie : le tour du magnifique vallon de la Morinière et la traversée du domaine de Fouilloux et son château perché. Le retour vers Saint Jean se fera entre nos deux rivières. Une dernière traversée de rivière et un p’tit coup de rein vous ramènent vers l’arrivée au village May’Eco Trail.

Ce parcours est à la hauteur des attentes de tout traileur : de beaux panoramas, des lieux d’ordinaire inaccessibles, quelques bonnes « patates », et 80% de sentiers.Direction Saint Germain le Fouilloux ! Un beau sentier vous amènera à notre nouveauté pour 2019 : un crochet dans le magnifique vallon de la Morinière. Le retour vers le village de Saint Germain annonce le ravito de mi-parcours. On quitte très vite le village pour rejoindre les méandres de l’Ernée. Moment rare, la traversée du domaine de Fouilloux et son château perché. Le retour vers Saint Jean se fera entre nos deux rivières. Une dernière traversée et un p’tit coup de rein vous ramènent vers l’arrivée au village May’EcoTrail.

Un parcours pour les gourmands ! Toutes les douceurs du trail sont concentrées dans ce parcours 100% St Jeannais : après les premiers kilomètres communs à toutes les courses, place à l’Ernée ! Après avoir longé les berges de cette superbe rivière, une première traversée à pieds secs sur les fameux pas japonais de Quifeu. Magie des méandres, on retrouve les bords de la rivière 2km plus loin. Un beau monotrace, parfois technique, vous ramènera vers le village. A force de lui tourner autour il faudra bien se mouiller les pieds et traverser l’Ernée pour rejoindre l’arrivée au village May’Eco Trail.

Suite au beau succès de cette nouveauté 2018 et aux commentaires très positifs des participants, le tracé restera identique pour cette édition 2019.Le parcours emprunte le début du parcours de l’Appétit Trail mais bifurque aux Marollières pour longer l’Ernée et revenir vers le village May’Eco Trail. Au menu, toutes les composantes du trail avec des chemins, des ruisseaux, quelques petites côtes, tout en restant accessible à tous.

Event: Trail D'ecouves Et Du Pays D'alencon 2019
Race: Trail D'ecouves Et Du Pays D'alencon
Description:
Trail sur parcours entièrement forestier au sein du magnfique massif d'Ecouves. Valloné à souhait, situé sur les contreforts du massif Armoricain, il est le plus important massif forestier de l'Ouest de la France.
Description in English
Trail on a wholly forested course within the magnficent massif of Ecouves. Hilly to wish, located on the foothills of the Armorican massif, it is the most important forest massif of the West of France.

Event: Viii Gran Trail Aldeas Do Courel 2019
Description:
El Gran Trail Aldeas do Courel está concebido como el Trail de larga distancia de referencia en Galicia. Además de ser la primera prueba de este tipo en dicha comunidad, aspira a ser el buque insignia del circuito GMTA.Además de por su distancia y desnivel acumulado, que ha merecido en ocasiones anteriores ser valorada con 3 puntos clasificatorios para el UTMB, merece la pena por discurrir por una selección de los mejores paisajes de la Serra do Courel, buena parte de ellos encuadrados dentro de la Red Natura 2000 por su alto valor natural.Por razones de seguridad se exige un mínimo material obligatorio, que es el siguiente:* Mochila de agua o porta bidones, con capacidad al menos para 1 litro de liquido.* Manta de supervivencia.* Silbato* Cortavientos* Teléfono móvil, con batería cargada* Frontal, con pilas de repuesto
Description in English
The Gran Trail Aldeas do Courel is conceived as the long distance reference trail in Galicia. In addition to being the first test of its kind in this community, it aspires to be the flagship of the GMTA circuit.In addition to its distance and cumulative altitude, which has deserved in previous occasions to be rated with 3 qualifying points for the UTMB, it is worth to pass by a selection of the best landscapes of the Serra do Courel, a good part of them framed within the Natura 2000 Network for its high natural value.For security reasons, a minimum mandatory material is required, which is as follows:* Water backpack or drums holder, with capacity for at least 1 liter of liquid.* Survival blanket* Whistle* Windbreaker* Mobile phone, with charged battery* Front light, with spare batteries

The Arctic Triple – Lofoten Ultra-Trail® is the race that truly takes a grab on the entire group of Lofoten islands, the world most beautiful archipelago in the world. Lofoten Ultra-Trail will take place in week 22 every year. The tracks pass through an amazing scenery of mountain ridges, white beaches, green hills and grey cliffs – almost the entire time with the ocean in view or just meters from your feet.

Epreuve phare du week-end, la Transju’trail 72 km « emprunte » des parties du tracé de La Transju’, mais en sens inverse. Au programme : des panoramas imprenables sur les Monts Jura, le lac Léman et le canton de Genève, le massif du Mont-Blanc et Les Montagnes du Jura, mais aussi des passages inoubliables comme l’ascension du tremplin de saut à ski de Chaux-Neuve ou le sommet de la Dôle…
Description in English
La Transju’trail 72km is the main race of the week-end. During the race you’ll benefit from beautiful and magical panoramas on Jura mountains, Léman lake, Mont Blanc summit as well as unforgettable moments on the ski jump of Chaux-Neuve or the climb to the Dôle summit… Join us for an incredible moment!

Une distance plus courte mais tout aussi exigeante. Au programme : des panoramas imprenables sur les Monts Jura, le lac Léman et le canton de Genève, le massif du Mont-Blanc et Les Montagnes du Jura, mais aussi des passages inoubliables comme la montée vers le sommet de la Dôle…
Description in English
A shorter distance than 72km but difficulties are also present. During the race you’ll benefit from beautiful and magical panoramas on Jura mountains, Léman lake, Mont Blanc summit as well as unforgettable moments as the climb to the Dôle summit… Join us for an incredible moment!

Une distance plus courte pour celles et ceux qui souhaitent découvrir le trail. Au programme : des panoramas imprenables sur les Monts Jura, le lac Léman et le canton de Genève, le massif du Mont-Blanc et Les Montagnes du Jura, mais aussi des passages inoubliables comme la montée vers le sommet de la Dôle…
Description in English
A shorter distance for those wanting discover a trail running race. During the race you’ll benefit from beautiful and magical panoramas on Jura mountains, Léman lake, Mont Blanc summit as well as unforgettable moments as the climb to the Dôle summit… Join us for an incredible moment!

Un trail de 23km pour ceux qui souhaitent du dénivelé. Autour de Morez, vous passerez par plusieurs belvédères pour terminer de nuit à la frontale. Difficulté et sensations garanties dans une ambiance conviviale et déchainée. 
Description in English
A 23km race for those looking for climbs. Around the Morez city, you’ll go through several panoramic viewpoints and you’ll finish the race with your headlamp. Join us for difficulty, sensation and friendly atmosphere!

Parcours de 10km au départ des Rousses, en boucle, qui permettra à chacun de découvrir les joies du trail sur une distance plus courte et de découvrir les paysages grandioses des Montagnes du Jura.
Description in English
A 10km race starting from Les Rousses, which will allow you to discover the trail running on a shorter distance and to discover the beautiful landscapes of the Jura Mountains.

La prueba reina de la Cajamar Tenerife Bluetrail 2019, la Ultra, ofrece la posibilidad de cruzar la Isla partiendo desde cota cero hasta los 3.555 metros, altura máxima que se alcanza en el ascenso a El Teide. Sus 102 kilómetros de longitud transcurrirán en un 70% por sendero, en un 17% por pista y en un 13% por asfalto. El tiempo máximo de finalización de esta modalidad será de 24 horas. La salida de esta prueba será a las 23:30 horas del 7 de junio, desde la Playa Fañabé, ubicada en Adeje, y discurrirá posteriormente por La Quinta, Ifonche, Vilaflor de Chasna, Degollada de Guajara, Roques de García, Pico Viejo, La Rambleta, Montaña Blanca, Lomo Hurtado, Recibo Quemado, Ladera de Tigaiga, Chanajiga, Tigaiga, El Asomadero, El Mirador de La Corona, Mirador de San Pedro y Rambla de Castro. La última parada será en el Puerto de la Cruz, donde estará ubicada la meta para todas las pruebas. 
Description in English
The star race of the Cajamar Tenerife Bluetrail 2019 allows runners to cross the island, departing from sea level and reaching 3,550 m above sea level, the maximum that can be reached when ascending Teide's peak. It is 101,5 km long, and the race is distributed into paths (70%), tracks (17) and asphalt (13%). The maximum time for completion will be 24 hours.This race will start on June 7, 23:30, departing from Playa Fañabé, Adeje, and passing through La Quinta, Ifonche, Vilaflor de Chasna, Degollada de Guajara, Roques de García, Pico Viejo, La Rambleta, Montaña Blanca, Lomo Hurtado, Recibo Quemado, Ladera de Tigaiga, Chanajiga, Tigaiga, El Asomadero, El Mirador de La Corona, Mirador de San Pedro and Rambla de Castro. The last stop will be in Puerto de la Cruz, where the finish line for all the races will be located.

La Trail de 67 kilómetros iniciará su camino a las 6:00 horas del 8 de junio de 2019, en la calle de Santa Catalina de Vilaflor. Su trayecto incluirá un 55 % de sendero, un 32% de pista y un 13% de asfalto. La carrera partirá desde 1.387 metros de altura y alcanzará los 2.520 en su punto más alto. El desnivel acumulado de esta modalidad será de 7.886 metros. Su tiempo máximo de finalización será de 14 horas. La ruta incluirá puntos como Degollada de Guajara, Siete Cañadas, Volcanes de Arenas Negras, El Portillo, Degollada del Cedro, Ladera de Tigaiga, Chanajiga, El Asomadero, El Lance, Mirador de San Pedro o Rambla de Castro, terminando en el Puerto de la Cruz. 
Description in English
This 66 km trail will start at 6:00am, June 8th, in Vilaflor (Santa Catalina St.). Departing from 1,387 m above sea level and reaching 2,520 m at its highest point, this race will be comprised by paths (55%), tracks (32%) and asphalt (13%). The total elevation gain for this race is 7,886 m. The maximum time for completion will be 14 hours.

La Maratón de 43 kilómetros tendrá lugar el 8 de junio, desde las 9:00 horas. En este 2019 contará con un 50% de sendero, un 29% de pista y un 21% de asfalto.  Desde su salida en Pista de Mamio (Aguamansa, La Orotava, los participantes de esta prueba visitarán la Caldera de Aguamansa, Anaga Chasna, Pista Los Picachos, Pista PK 29, Piedra de Los Pastores, Ladera de Tigaiga, Chanjiga, Tigaiga, El Asomadero, El Lance, Mirador de San Pedro, Rambla de Castro y, finalmente, Puerto de la Cruz.
Description in English
The third edition of this 43 km marathon will be held on June 8(9:00 am). This race will be comprised by paths (50%), tracks (29%) and asphalt (21%).Departing from Pista de Mamio (Aguamansa, la Orotava), the participants of this race will pass through the following areas: Caldera de Aguamansa, Anaga Chasna, Pista Los Picachos, Pista PK 29, Piedra de Los Pastores, Ladera de Tigaiga, Chanjiga, Tigaiga, El Asomadero, El Lance, Mirador de San Pedro, Rambla de Castro and, finally, Puerto de la Cruz.

La Media de 20 kilómetros también partirá desde las 8:00 horas del sábado 8 de junio. Su punto de inicio será la plaza de San Agustín de Los Realejos y sus corredores tendrán 4 horas para completar el recorrido. El trayecto contará con un 32% de sendero, un 18% de pista y un 50% de asfalto. Tras tomar la salida, sus participantes transcurrirán por El Asomadero, La Corona, Mirador de San Pedro, Rambla de Castro y, al igual que el resto de modalidades, Puerto de la Cruz como objetivo final. El desnivel acumulado será de 2.794 metros y se alcanzará la altitud máxima de 1.092 metros. 
Description in English
This 20 km race (half-marathon) will also start on June 9 at 8 am. It will depart from Plaza de San Agustín, los Realejos, and the runners will have 4 hours to get to the finish line. This race will be comprised by paths (32%), tracks (18%) and asphalt (50%).Participants will pass through the areas of El Asomadero, La Corona, Mirador de San Pedro, Rambla de Castro and finally, Puerto de La Cruz, where the finish line will be located. The total elevation gain for this race is 2,794 m. The maximum height reached will be 1,092 m above sea level.
Ultrabug is a 100km 3-day, fully supported ultramarathon through the winding mountain footpaths, mineral water streams and remote culture rich villages in the Carpathian mountains, Romania.

Berga Trail Sky Marathon una autèntica cursa de muntanya que et portarà a recórrer indrets de gran bellesa amb un terreny exigent. Des de Berga, capital de la comarca del Berguedà, Catalunya, iniciarem un recorregut que ens portarà a la Serra d'Ensija passant pels Rasos de Peguera i descendint per a Serra de Queralt. Gaudirem com animals!

Berga Trail Sky Race, una autèntica cursa de muntanya que et portarà a recórrer indrets de gran bellesa amb un terreny exigent. Des de Berga, capital de la comarca del Berguedà, Catalunya, iniciarem un recorregut que ens portarà al mirador   de la Figuerassa, seguint fins als Rasos de Peguera i descendint per a Serra de Queralt. Gaudirem com animals!

THE SDW100 IS A 100 MILE FOOT RACE TAKING IN THE ENTIRE SOUTH DOWNS WAY NATIONAL TRAIL. THE SOUTH DOWNS BOAST STUNNING ROLLING HILLS, ANCIENT FORTS, PICTURESQUE VILLAGES AND EXPANSIVE VIEWS ACROSS SOUTHERN ENGLAND. 8th Annual.

Terénní běh na 66,6 km přes hory, doly, hrady a vody tajemnou krajinou Kokořínska a Máchova kraje.
Description in English
Devil's race for 66,6 km - trail over hills and valleys, castles and waters in the mysterious landscape of the Kokořín and the Macha region.

Terénní běh přes hory, doly, hrady a vody tajemnou přírodou Máchova kraje a okolí Ralska.
Description in English
Devil's race for 33,3 km - trail over hills and valleys, castles and waters in the mysterious landscape of the Macha region and Ralsko region.

Descubriendo Paraguaná Trail se desarrolla en el entorno natural de Santa Ana de Paraguaná (Google Maps --> https://goo.gl/maps/6nNUAuGbGyH2), un ecosistema xerófilo peninsular con exigentes transiciones al cruzar cerros y sabanas. Correras entre los paisajes más hermosos de Venezuela. En algunas partes del recorrido los vientos pueden superar los 50 km/h, la temperatura puede fluctuar entre los 20 y 40°C. 
Description in English
Descubriendo Paraguana Trail is a race in the natural surroundings of Santa Ana de Paraguana (Google Maps --> https://goo.gl/maps/6nNUAuGbGyH2), a xerophytic ecosystem with demanding transitions while crossing mountains and plains. You will run in some of the most beautiful landscapes of Venezuela. Wind velocity in some zones could be 50 km/h or more and temperature may fluctuate between 20 y 40°C.

Descubriendo Paraguaná Trail se desarrolla en el entorno natural de Santa Ana de Paraguaná (Google Maps --> https://goo.gl/maps/6nNUAuGbGyH2), un ecosistema xerófilo peninsular con exigentes transiciones al cruzar cerros y sabanas. Correras entre los paisajes más hermosos de Venezuela. En algunas partes del recorrido los vientos pueden superar los 50 km/h, la temperatura puede fluctuar entre los 20 y 40°C. 
Description in English

You will run in some of the most beautiful landscapes of Venezuela. Wind velocity in some zones could be 50 km/h or more and temperature may fluctuate between 20 y 40°C.

Descubriendo Paraguaná Trail se desarrolla en el entorno natural de Santa Ana de Paraguaná (Google Maps --> https://goo.gl/maps/6nNUAuGbGyH2), un ecosistema xerófilo peninsular con exigentes transiciones al cruzar cerros y sabanas.
