UN RECORRIDO BAJO LAS ESTRELLAS.   Este evento es resultado de la pasión del Club Deportivo Veredas Atauro que apuesta firmemente por impulsar este deporte en el hermoso municipio de Mogán, pasando además por los deportes acuáticos hasta los más extremos de Montaña.   Encontrarás un motón de propuestas para disfrutar de tus vacaciones al máximo, vive una experiencia diferente !!!- PSICOBLOC MOGAN, campeonato de escalada de velocidad.- Actividades Náuticas Costa Mogán, PADDLE SURF y KAYAK.   La prueba de la MARATON TRAIÑA TRAIL tiene como salida el pueblo de Veneguera hacia Arguineguín pasando por parajes naturales dentro del Parque Rural del Nublo y el Monumento Natural de Tauro. A tener en cuenta la subida vertical de Los Laderones, paisajes bonitos como el Pinar de Tauro. Podrás encontrar también una variedad de tramos técnicos como Las Lajas de Medina, Caseríos de Tauro y Paso El Jabonero, llegando por los caminos predefinidos hasta la costa.Habrá cuatros recorridos:– Traíña 42km con un desnivel positivo 2121m. y 8 horas y media para cierre de carrera ( habrá cierres parciales en los ptos de control ). La salida de dicha carrera será a las 17:30.Habrá un corte km 26 con 5:30 horas.– Traíña 24 km con un desnivel positivo 1293 m y 5 horas para cierre de carrera ( habrá cierres parciales en los ptos de control ).– Traíña 14 km con un desnivel positivo 693 m y 4 horas para cierre de carrera.– Traíña 8 km con un desnivel positivo 360m y 3 horas y media para cierre de carrera.
Description in English
A JOURNEY UNDER THE STARS.   This event is the result of the passion of the Club Deportivo Veredas Atauro, which is firmly committed to promoting this sport in the beautiful municipality of Mogán, also going through water sports to the most extreme mountains.   You will find a lot of proposals to enjoy your holidays to the fullest, live a different experience!- PSICOBLOC MOGAN, speed climbing championship.- Costa Mogán, PADDLE SURF and KAYAK Nautical Activities.  The test of the MARATON TRAIÑA TRAIL leaves the town of Veneguera towards Arguineguín, passing through natural landscapes within the Nublo Rural Park and the Tauro Natural Monument. To take into account the vertical rise of Los Laderones, beautiful landscapes such as the Puro de Tauro. You can also find a variety of technical sections such as Las Lajas de Medina, Caserios de Tauro and Paso El Jabonero, arriving by the predefined roads to the coast.There will be four tours:- Traíña 42km with a positive difference of 2121m. and 8 and a half hours to close the race (there will be partial closures in the control points). The start of that race will be at 17: 30. There will be a 26 km cut with 5:30 hours.- Traíña 24 km with a positive height difference of 1293 m and 5 hours for the closing of the race (there will be partial closures in the control points).- Traíña 14 km with a positive height difference 693 m and 4 hours for race closing.- Traíña 8 km with a 360m positive slope and 3 and a half hours for race closing.

Description:
Correr 42 km a más de 4.000 msnm seguramente va a exigir lo máximo de ti, esta distancia está reservada a aquellos que ya han experimentado que se siente correr 42 km pero aun así ni el más experimentado corredor podrá anticiparse a las condiciones que la montaña impondrá durante la carrera, solo quienes logren sobreponerse mentalmente y se hayan preparado físicamente podrán superar esta dura prueba.
Description in English
Running 42 km at more than 4000 masl will surely demand the most from you, this distance is reserved for those who have already experienced what it feels to run 42 km but even the most experienced runner can not anticipate the conditions that the mountain will show during the race, only those who manage to overcome mentally and have been physically prepared will be able to conquer this tough race.
Entry Fee: Fase 1: COP $210.000 (75 USD); Precio final: COP $245.000 (90 USD); Extemporánea: COP $280.000 (100 USD)

Description:
Carrera de Trail Running que se desarrolla en el páramo, en zona amortiguadora del Nevado del Ruiz. Partiendo desde los 3800 msnm, en un circuito que se mantiene alrededor de los 4000 msnm, con un máximo de 4100 msnm y un mínimo de 3500 msnm lo que la convierte en la carrera con la mayor altitud promedio de Colombia, con vistas increíbles de bosques, páramos, arenales y nieve.
Description in English
Trail Running race that takes place in the páramo, in the buffer zone of Nevado del Ruiz. Starting from 3800 masl, in a circuit that is maintained around 4000 masl, with a maximum of 4100 masl and a minimum of 3500 masl which makes it the race with the highest average altitude in Colombia, with incredible views of forests, páramos, sands and snow.
Entry Fee: Fase 1: COP $170.000 (61 USD); Precio Final: COP $200.000 (72 USD); Pago Extemporáneo: COP $230.000 (83 USD)

Au départ de Corte, vous affrontez un premier dénivelé de 1600m le long du Tavignanu, vous plongez vers le lac de Calacuccia, avant de remonter dans le massif du Monte Cintu, à Bocca Crucette, vous rejoignez alors le GR 20 que vous allez suivre sur 40km en passant au pied de la Paglia Orba pour redescendre le Golu, rejoindre le lac de Ninu, remonter vers Bocca Alle Porte, dégringoler vers le lac du Melu dans les gorges de la Restonica, remonter vers le plateau d’Alzu pour rejoindre Corte par les gorges du Tavignanu. Et ce ne sont pas des montagnes russes, mais des montagnes corses.

The Afton Trail Run is one of the most challenging and beautiful trail races anywhere.  The race was established in 1994 and is now one of the oldest, largest and most competitive trail races in the country and routinely draws runners from all 50 states and beyond.  The race takes place entirely within the borders of Afton State Park.  The race(s) consist of a hilly 25K loop (two loops for the 50K), winding through the state parkâs trail system. The race is held 100% off road, primarily on very runnable / not very technical single and double track trail. There are 7 long climbs per loop, rising from the river valley and down again with a good mix of rolling and flat terrain between the hills.   Afton State Park lies on a glacial moraine, scribed with deep ravines running down to the St. Croix River.  The 169 mile St. Croix River was one of the original eight United States rivers to have significant portions placed under protection by the National Wild and Scenic Rivers Act of 1968.  Within the park sandstone outcrops have been exposed in some of the ravines. The vertical drop from the blufftop to the water is 300 feet.  A few patches of remnant prairie survived the decades of farming that took place on the blufftop. Today the former fields are being restored to prairie and oak savanna. The ravines leading down to the riverbank are thickly wooded with oak, aspen, birch, and cherry.  The Afton Trail Run makes significant annual donations to the state park, nearing $60,000.00 as of 2018 and its organizers, volunteers and runners contribute 100âs of volunteer hours to the park annually, maintaining trail and doing invasive species removal / restoration.  The Afton Trail Run is organized by Rocksteady Running and directed by John Storkamp.  The Afton Trail Run would not be possible without its dedicated army of year-to-year volunteers.

The Brisbane Trail Ultra 100 miler is a challenging course, boasting 8040m of vertical climb and descent through the vast National Park on Brisbane’s doorstep. Your start line is in The Gap, a leafy inner Brisbane Suburb only 8km from the Brisbane CBD. Run straight into the D’Aguilar National Park.  Become acquainted with the beautiful gorges, eucalyptus forests and stunning virgin subtropical rainforests of Mount Nebo, Mount Glorious and Mount Coot-Tha.  Be rewarded with extraordinary views following demanding climbs as well as enjoying thrilling sections of descents.Plan to finish like no other.  From forest canopy to the Southbank night lights, your run will transit into the urban heart of Brisbane city. This is the perfect finale to your ultimate heroic adventure.Run your final 8km through Paddington, an historic suburb borne from the foothills of Mount Coot-Tha and renowned for its steep peaks and gullies, then make your way along our iconic Brisbane River. From here, get ready for your hero’s welcome home stretch where you will have large crowds cheering you on towards the finish line at the Maritime Museum, South Bank Parklands.  Congratulations! You have completed our inaugural Brisbane Trail Ultramarathon and now it is time to celebrate your achievement with the BTU festival held just for you.  This race will be tough, this race will be an epic adventure. Join us and let our race help prepare you for any world class event in Australia and around the World.Bring a Support CrewWe have thought about your long suffering support crew. They need places to grab good coffee, eat great food and enjoy some shopping or tourist attractions whilst you are preparing, racing and recovering. We have developed our Off Trail Adventures and Food Safari itineraries for ideas on where to eat, drink, party, enjoy, chill and relax. You will love the Brisbane Trail Ultra and Festival!

Description: This one - even more exciting than the other one!

Do you enjoy both the smoothness of the road and the peaceful atmosphere of a forest trail? Yes? then The Brisbane Trail 30 is for you.  This course covers all the best aspects road and trail running has to offer; from technically challenging single tracks to wide fire trails and footpaths, towering eucalypt woodlands and challenging climbs to historic buildings and long smooth roads. This is the perfect introductory race to whet your appetite for trail running or to combine your love of varying terrains.The first 4km will warm you up along scenic paths tightly hugging Enoggera Creek before hitting the trails. We throw a challenging 1km serpentine climb to test your stamina before leading you through the next 17km of flowing single track and wide fire trail showcasing our amazing Aussie bushlands. If you need to catch your breath, take a stop at the Summit lookout and enjoy the stunning views of Brisbane City at sunset before descending into the leafy and hilly suburban landscapes. Your final section is your chance to get your cadence back on track on the comfort of road as you travel through inner city Paddington and Bardon, suburbs nestled in the valley foothills of Mt Coot-Tha. Try to take in the view as you blast past this historic area along gently sloping terrain towards the urban night lights. Savour the energy of the crowd as you race to the finish line along the beautifully manicured South Bank riverside walkway in the heart of Brisbane.

The Ortler Sky Trails is one of the highest and most spectacular Alpine trail and sky running events and it's located at the world-famous Ortler and Stelvio Pass!The Stelvio Ultra Trail (73km) takes you on the slopes of the Ortler, crosses the spectacular Bärenkopfscharte/Tabarettascharfe, after which you'll climb above the Stelvio Pass to 3000m, before descending back to it. Through the Goldseeweg, you'll rejoin the Sulden valley via Ponte di Stelvio.

Base Price: € 69,- (until 31/5/2019)
Late Turtle: € 83,- (until 15/6/2019)

Primiero, cuore del Parco naturale di Paneveggio – Pale di San Martino, farà da cornice alla Primiero Dolomiti Marathon, l’evento organizzato dall’ U.S. PRIMIERO ASD, capace di coinvolgere gli appassionati della corsa e gli amanti della montagna.Tre percorsi mozzafiato di diversa lunghezza e difficoltà (42K, 26K e 6.5K), accessibili senza particolari  equipaggiamenti tecnici.
Description in English
Primiero, in the hearth of Parco naturale di Paneveggio – Pale di San Martino, will be the theatre for Primiero Dolomiti Marathon, race organized by U.S. PRIMIERO ASD. The event attracts both athletes and mountain lovers.Three breathtaking courses (42K, 26K e 6.5K) througout the Primiero valleys, suitable both for expert runners and newcomers. Primiero Dolomiti Marathon is not only running. Then Primiero Dolomiti Village will host an expo and the Primiero Dolomiti Party where you can eat the typical dolomites specialties.

Description: A race that may be the greatest challenge of your life. The 100 mile (161km) course will take you through the most rugged, remote and beautiful terrain in Alberta's stunning Rocky Mountains. With 6,400m of elevation gain across the course, this race will punish those who are not prepared. Racers have 30 hours to complete the grueling event. The course is split into seven stages, each featuring a geographic and historic highlight of the area. The race's name is inspired by the treacherous Seven Sisters Mountain that looms over much of the course.

Entry Fee:
45 euros early registration
60 euros later on

Sulle orme di Etruschi e Celti nella Valle dell'IdiceIl Console Caio Flaminio costruì l’antica strada romana Flaminia Militare nel 187 a.C. per unire Bologna ad Arezzo.Ma prima di allora?L’area di Monte Bibele rappresenta il più importante complesso archeologico italiano, ed uno dei più importanti in Europa, per quanto attiene la civiltà dei Celti. Il Museo Archeologico di Monterenzio ricostruisce la storia della presenza dell'uomo nell'Appennino bolognese soprattutto nelle valli dell'Idice e dello Zena, dalle prime testimonianze dell'età della pietra fino all'età romana.Percorreremo questi territori, da Monte Bibele a Monterenzio, immersi nella Natura e nella Storia.
Description in English
In the footsteps of Etruscans and Celts in the Idice ValleyThe Consul Caio Flaminio built the ancient Roman road Flaminia Militare in 187 BC. to unite Bologna to Arezzo.But before then?The area of Monte Bibele is the most important Italian archaeological complex, and one of the most important in Europe, as far as the Celts civilization is concerned.The Archaeological Museum of Monterenzio reconstructs the history of the presence of man in the Bolognese Apennines especially in the valleys of the Idice and the Zena, from the earliest evidence of the stone age up to the Roman age.We will travel through these territories, from Monte Bibele to Monterenzio, immersed in nature and history.

The Dodo Trail XTREME starts at the foot of Le Morne Brabant. The finish line is at the Riverland Sports Centre in Tamarin.Le Morne peninsula is known for Le Morne Brabant, the majestic mountain classified as a UNESCO World Heritage site on the basis of its historical and cultural importance.At this time of year, the first hour of the race will take place in the dark. Runners will need to make use of their headlamps. The first 7 km of the race are reasonably flat. The race follows a route along the sea, then through the village of Le Morne – the only section of the race on tarred road – before reaching the private property of Baie du Cap.The participants will then enter a vast deer hunting ground, the first of several private properties they will cross in the southwest. This part of the trail climbs gradually along a 4×4 track with a 10 to 15% incline.Participants will then climb a stile to cross into the second private property, Mont sur Mont. A single track at an altitude of 260 m will lead the participants to the race’s first peak, the Piton de La Prairie, which is 550 m high. The runners will be able to admire the view over the Vallée de Chamarel on one side of the peak and the majestic Morne Brabant on the other.Runners will need to negotiate a technical and uneven single track, covered in roots, slippery grass and stones, on the route up to another two peaks: the 600 m high Piton du Fouge and the 550 m high Montagne la Porte. From there, participants will have a fabulous view of île aux Bénitiers and the crystal-clear lagoon that surrounds it.Beyond this single-track section, the trail follows a wider dirt road before arriving at the first water station at the 12 km mark.Heading west, the track follows easy, even ground, leaving behind Mont sur Mont and crossing into a private property owned by Owen Griffiths. This part of the trail is in the shade, so participants can alternate between running and walking.Afterwards, the track climbs steeply up to Piton Canot. At 550 m high, this peak offers a fantastic panorama over the region. The trail then follows steep and uneven terrain down to Chamarel and the second water station, located at the 16 km mark and at an altitude of 250 m.The next stage of the race is a long, steep ascent towards le Piton de la Rivière Noire, Mauritius’ highest peak at 828 m. From the top of le Piton de la Rivière Noire, runners will enjoy breath-taking views of the island’s luxuriant vegetation, its lagoon and the ocean beyond.A single track then follows the mountain’s edge, which can be very muddy at times, towards Grand Piton, some 700 m further along. It then winds its way to the Black River Gorges before reaching the forest and the third water table at 25 km and an altitude of 100 m.Trailers will follow the track right up to the third water station at Radier, at the 25 km mark (PK 3 on the trail map). A 4×4 track then climbs continuously over the next 5 km to an elevation of 650 m, through Plateau Remousse and Camphrier. Trailers will then reach the flat Macchabée section of the race and will keep left towards Macchabée Kiosk and the 32 km mark, where a fourth water station will be located (PK 4).From this vantage point, the entire west coast of the island is visible. Trailers will need to stay focused as they reach the Zepol track, which descends at an incline of over 30%. The trail then slopes back down to the Black River Gorges.After 200 m, trailers will take the Filwil track, then will follow a rocky and technical path down to a river where runners will climb a stile and enter the Matala hunting ground.Next, participants will follow a 4×4 track for 4 km. This section is dry, with the yellowish grass and stocky, drought-resistant trees typical of the Tamarin region. The track leads to a stream, then to a fence where a property known as Matala awaits, alongside the fifth water station at the 40 km mark.The trail crosses the private estate known as St. Martin up to the race’s final peak: la Tourelle de Tamarin at 548 m of altitude.  The sixth water station is half way up la Tourelle.From the top, the view and scenery are amazing: Black River Bay, Tamarin Bay, le Morne Brabant on one side, and Yemen and the High Grounds on the other!The track down to the finish line is highly technical. It involves a descent of the entire mountain face, through a number of steep, dusty and rocky sections.Once trailers have reached the foot of the mountain once more, they will follow the track through a wooded area, heading towards the Tamarin River, then run along the Tamarin Bridge before crossing the finish line at the Riverland Sports Centre where is the last water station and a lunch is served to each participant.

16-hours after the 100-miler runners have started their Silverheels 100-mile adventure through these mountains, we’re making a Last Call for runner’s looking to take the last dance. Starting at precisely midnight, you’ll have 6 hours to navigate the course in the dark before the lights come on and you’re forced to see who all’s been dancing all night. From there, you’ll have ten more hours to get the deed done (16 hour cut-off math majors!). Will you rally and finish the challenge, or get stuck dancing with someone you really didn’t want to dance with?

Description:
O objetivo dos fundadores da Declive Sublime foi o de apresentar ao crescente número de adeptos do Trail Running, o que de melhor o Parque Natural de Sintra tem para oferecer. Um traçado muito exigente foi desenhado em 2014,  desenvolvido e adaptado posteriormente para esta prova, e inclui passagens por zonas de extraordinária beleza, apenas acessíveis aos participantes do evento. o Conceito “X´treme”, tem que ver com a beleza do percurso e com a sua dificuldade técnica. Não como o nível de risco para os participantes.
Description in English
The goal of the organizing company DECLIVE SUBLIME is to show to the growing Trail Running aficionados the best of what Sintra Natural Park has to offer.A very demanding track created in 2014 has been developed and adapted to this race and includes passages inside outstanding beautiful private properties only accessible to the participants of the event.The X´TREME concept has to do with the beauty of the track with its technical difficulty and the ability to overcome the challenge. Not with the high level of risk for the participants.
Entry Fee:
STE - MONTEPIO SINTRA TRAIL X’TREME / 31KM
22 euros till the 30th of April
26 euros after the 30th of April

STE - MONTEPIO SINTRA TRAIL X’PLORE / 20KM
18 euros till the 30th of April
22 euros after the 30th of April

STE - MONTEPIO SINTRA TRAIL X´PERIENE / 10KM
10 euros till the 30th of April
14 euros after the 30th of April

Description: Trail technique dans le massif des Vosges faisant le tour de la vallĂŠe d'Orbey avec le passage sur les cr^tes vosgiennes et 3 lacs de montagnes.

Чорргор - горное ущелье. Звучит также сурово, каким является. Маршрут проходит через оба перевала и южный и северный. последний является самым высоким в Хибинах - 1010 метров. На этой дистанции встретите всё и крупноглыбовую осыпь и бодрящие броды и грунтовую дорогу. Высокая вероятность познакомиться с лисами, куропатками и различными грызунами. К этой дистанции у нас вместе с местными сотрудниками МЧС будет особое внимание, разместим специальный пункт, чтобы усилить безопасность и оперативность, в случае если понадобится помощь.
Description in English
CHORRGOR - mountain gorge. Sounds as harsh as it is. The route passes through both passes South and North. the latter is the highest in the Khibiny - 1010 meters. At this distance you will find everything and a large stone scree and cold mountain rivers and dirt road. High probability to get acquainted with foxes, partridges and various rodents. We will pay special attention to this distance together with the local EMERCOM staff, we will place a special point to strengthen security and efficiency, in case you need help.

Один из перевалов Петрелиуса. Назван в честь картографа и геодезиста Альфреда Петрелиуса, благодаря работе которого стало возможным активное освоение Хибин. Перевал представляет собой широкую классическую седловину. Северный склон - пологий (до 25°), несколькими наклонными террасами уходит в долину ручья Петрелиуса.
Description in English
One of the passes of Petrelius. Named after the cartographer and surveyor Alfred Petrelius, thanks to which it became possible to actively develop the Khibiny. The pass is a classic wide saddle. North slope - gentle (25°), multi-sloped terraces out to the valley of the brook of Petrelius.

Мурманская область, город Кировск, Хибины. Крупнейший горный массив на Кольском полуострове. Геологический возраст — около 390 миллионов лет. Первые шаги в освоении Хибин человек сделал только в начале XX века. Несколько больших экспедиций дали миру основу для многих научных открытий и месторождения совершенно новых полезных ископаемых. Туристы освоили в первую очередь горнолыжные склоны - сезон открывается в ноябре и закрывается в апреле. Теперь настала очередь освоения Хибин трейлраннерами!КОНЦЕПЦИЯЭто приключение выходного дня, то есть старт организован таким образом, чтобы вы приехали и получили стартовый комплект в субботу, пробежали в воскресенье и к понедельнику успели вернуться к вашим обычным делам. Каждый маршрут не просто цифра, а путь к одной из природных достопримечательностей. Каждый год будут появляться новые треки. У каждого маршрута будет свой уникальный дизайн медали. Все дистанции уже сертифицированы ITRA и опубликованы. Сам старт будет происходить с лыжного стадиона Тирвас и использовать его инфраструктуру. А ещё будет полярный день, то есть про ночь забудьте, всё время светло.Малый Вудъявр - это озеро. Расположено на высоте 360 метров над уровнем моря в долине ручья Поачйок, между хребтами Тахтарвумчорр и Поачвумчорр в южной части Хибин.Неглубокое живописное озеро, окруженное лесом, местные жители считают жемчужиной Хибин. На берегах Малого Вудъявра растут черника, морошка, брусника и другие ягоды. В озере водится рыба, однако, не слишком большая.
Description in English
Murmansk region, city of Kirovsk, the Khibiny mountains. The largest mountain range on the Kola Peninsula. The geological age is about 390 million years. The first steps in the development of Khibiny man made only in the early twentieth century. Several large expeditions gave the world the basis for many scientific discoveries and completely new mineral deposits. Tourists first of all mastered the ski slopes - the season opens in November and closes in April. Now it's the turn to explore the Khibiny on trailrunners!CONCEPTThis is a weekend adventure, that is organized шт such a way that you come and get a starter kit on Saturday, ran on Sunday and Monday had time to return to your usual business and work. Each route is not just a number of kilometers, and the path to one of the natural attractions. Every year there will be new tracks. Each route will have its own unique medal design. All distances are already certified by ITRA and published. The launch will occur with a ski stadium tirvas and use its infrastructure. And there will also be a polar day, so forget about the night, all the time light.Small Wudyavr is the lake. Located at an altitude of 360 meters above sea level in the valley of the brook Paatsjoki between the ranges of Tahtarvumchorr and MT in the southern part of the Khibiny.A shallow picturesque lake surrounded by forest, locals consider the pearl of Khibiny. On the banks of the Small Woodyavr grow blueberries, cloudberries, cranberries and other berries. The lake is the fish, however, is not too big

Trasa TriCity Trail to konsekwencja wielu godzin spędzonych na ścieżkach Trójmiejskiego Parku Krajobrazowego i lasów Nadleśnictwa Gdańsk, poprowadzona w taki sposób, by przez 80 km można było zachwycać się urokami tego miejsca. To okazja, by o własnych siłach przemierzyć trasę z Gdańska do Wejherowa po drodze odwiedzając rejony Gdyni, Sopotu i Rumi i przebiegając m.in. przez malownicze Lasy Oliwskie i Sopockie.
Description in English
Run along forested and hilly area in northern Poland and experience the beauty of Tricity Landscape Park!  You can choose from 3 races: 80k +, Marathon + and Halfmarathon. For children we organize Junior races.

Trasa TriCity Trail Maraton+ to propozycja dla osób, które nie czują się na siłach, by pokonać dystans ponad 80-kilometrów, ale z drugiej strony chcą sprawdzić się na trasie dłuższej niż 21km.Start w maratonie to okazja do poznania pięknych scieżek Trójmiejskiego Parku Krajobrazowego rozciągających się od Gdyni (start biegu odbędzie się na skraju ulicy Apollina w okolicy węzła Gdynia-Chwarzno na obwodnicy Trójmiasta) aż do Wejherowa, gdzie będziesz finiszował w klimatycznym Parku im. Majkowskiego. 
Description in English
Run along forested and hilly area in northern Poland and experience the beauty of Tricity Landscape Park! You probably don't expect a mountainous landscape, but be prepared for numerous hills.Maraton + finish is located in city Wejherowo (one of the town, which belongs to Kashubian Tricity). It is also close to one of the most popular agglomeration in northern Poland – Tricity (Gdynia, Sopot and Gdańsk).

Ultra Trail Del Cañón 2019 presentado por Scarpa México y organizado por Trail Run Hidalgo. Un lugar místico con naturaleza salvaje, senderos de clase mundial y una aventura que te llevará a superar tus límites.
Description in English
Ultra Trail Del Cañón 2018 presented by Scarpa Mexico and organized by Trail Run Hidalgo. A mystical place with wild nature, world class trails and an adventure that will take you beyond your limits.

Description:
Hornindal Rundt - Tougher than the rest! Midt mellom Jotunheimen og Nordsjøen finn du Hornindal. Omringa av dei flottaste og mest spektakulære fjell Norden har å by på, og med ein natur som kun finst i eventyrboka, såg aldri pioneren Amund Sverre Tomasgard seg tilbake. Hornindal skulle skape det ultimate ultra fjell-løp, så mykje tøffare enn det verda tidlegare hadde sett. 20 fjellpostar, 75 kilometer, og 5600 høgdemeter skulle bestigast i eit og same løp. Kjensla du får av å stå på Gulekoppen og skimte Jostedalsbreen i sør, Sunnmørsalpane i nord, og havet i vest, så sliten i beina at kun viljen og råskapen framleis vil holde deg i gang. Den følelsen når du passerer mållinja etter timar med beintøff kamp i naturen, og kan sjå tilbake på at du har fullført eit løp få andre har gjort før deg.
Description in English
Hornindal Rundt - Tougher than the rest!Between the mountains of Jotunheimen and the North Sea you will find Hornindal. Surrounded by the most beautiful and spectacular mountains of the north and with a scenery depicted in the fairy tales, the pioneer Amund Sverre Tomasgard never looked back. Here he set out to create the ultimate ultra-race, tougher than any other. 20 mountains, 75 kilometres and a 5600 climb in one and the same race. That feeling, standing on Gulekoppen watching the Jostedal Glacier to the south, the Alps of Sunnmøre to the north and the ocean to the west, your legs trembling from fatigue relying on your will power to keep you going. That feeling, when you cross the finishing line after hours of fighting yourself and nature and be able to celebrate completing a race that few others have done before you.

Event: Maverick Inov-8 X Peak District Marathon 2019

Description:
Включете се в това приключение, за да се насладите на живописни гледки, невероятна природа, архитектурни забележителности, трасе, което ще Ви заплени. Ще прекосявате гори, полета, уникални места за уникални емоции. Маршрутът на дългата дистанция преминава през сърцето на Балканското културно наследство – архитектурният парк „Боженци”, притегателно място за туристи от цял свят, през красиви горски местности, през еко-парк „Българка”, през три общини и десетки китни селца.
Description in English
Join this adventure to enjoy the scenic views, stunning scenery, architectural landmarks, and a route that will enchant you. You will cross forests, fields and unique places for unique emotions. The route of the long distance runs through the heart of the Balkan cultural heritage – architectural park “Bozhentsi”, an attractive place for tourists from around the world, through beautiful woodlands in eco-park “Bulgarian woman”, through three municipalities and dozens of picturesque villages.
Entry Fee:
Pre-enrollment 02/15/2019 incl. - 60 euro
Early booking – from 02/16. to 05/20/2019 incl. - 60 euro
Standard price – from 05/21/2019 to 06/24/2019 incl. - 90 euro

Description: NEW FOR 2019 AS A ONE-OFF "SPECIAL EDITION', THE WENDOVER WOODS 100 IS A 100 MILE FOOT RACE CONSISTING OF 10 X 10 MILE LOOPS ON FOREST TRAILS, ENTIRELY WITHIN WENDOVER WOODS. THE COURSE MIXES SOME OF THE MOST ENJOYABLE TRAIL RUNNING TO BE FOUND ANYWHERE, WITH WIDE, SOFT TRAILS INCLUDING SMOOTH DESCENTS AND RUNNABLE CLIMBS. THESE SECTIONS ARE CONTRASTED WITH SOME MUCH STEEPER ASCENTS AND DESCENTS SCATTERED THROUGHOUT THE LOOP.

Il tracciato è molto tecnico, visti gli importanti dislivelli, ma su sentieri che non presentano particolari difficoltà. Il passaggio sulle strade asfaltate è ridotto al minimo, solo nei pressi del centro abitato la corsa dovrà passare su vie pubbliche.
Description in English
The race is technical, due to the high altitude range but the routes itdevelopes on are not particularly tricky. Passages on sealed roads are reduced to the minimum possibile: the race will use them just around town where it crosses public streets.

Il tracciato è molto tecnico, visti gli importanti dislivelli, ma su sentieri che non presentano particolari difficoltà. Il passaggio sulle strade asfaltate è ridotto al minimo, solo nei pressi del centro abitato la corsa dovrà passare su vie pubbliche.
Description in English
The race is very technical, due to the high altitude range but the routes it develops on are not particularly tricky. Passages on sealed roads are reduced to the minimum possibile: the race will use them just around town where it crosses public streets.

Il percorso si snoda lungo i sentieri del territorio di Courmayeur, per una lunghezza totale di 30 km circa ed un dislivello positivo di 2000 mt, sviluppandosi prevalentemente lungo la Val Ferret.
Description in English
The race goes through routes in Courmayeur, for a total length of about 30km and an altitude range of 2000mt, mainly going along Val Ferret.

Event: Grand Trail De La Vallée D'ossau 2019
Description:
Le GTVO ou Grand Trail de la Vallée d’Ossau, est le Trail le plus long du Béarn avec ses 74km et 5000m D+. Les concurrents doivent parcourir la vallée d’Ossau en réalisant un tour complet, seul ou en relais de 2, en reliant Marie-Blanque à l’Aubisque, 2 grands noms du Tour de France, par les crêtes et sommets entourant la vallée.Un parcours magnifique, sauvage et authentique, qui serpente sur des sentiers étroits de montagne, à 83% sur sentiers monotraces. Vous passerez du fond de vallée, au milieu des estives, jusqu’aux sommets avoisinants très rapidement. Vous pourrez alors profiter de magnifiques paysages pyrénéens et des panoramas exceptionnels qu’offrent la Vallée d’Ossau.L’arrivée se déroule sur la place du village de Laruns au coeur des terrasses animées. L’aspect festif et convivial de cette course est primordial. Nous souhaitons garder une dimension humaine et accueillir les concurrents dans les meilleurs conditions.Pour les spectateurs la course est facilement accessible et vous pourrez voir les coureurs de nombreuses fois. Bien aidé par le suivi Live pour ne pas stresserNous voulons véhiculer notre passion, notre esprit d’équipe, de solidarité, de simplicité, et aucun concurrent ne reste indifférent à un GTVO 
Description in English
The GTVO or Grand Trail de la Vallée d’Ossau, is the longuest Race of the Bearn with 74kms and 5000mD+Runners will run around the Ossau Valley, alone or by two, from Marie-Blanque to Aubisque, 2 big names of Tour de france, from mountains all around the valley.A beautiful, an authentic and wild race with 83% of trails. You will pass accross the deep valley to the green prairy and top summits very quickly. You will find greatest views on the pyrenees summits that you can only find in Ossau Valley.The arrival is don in the center of Laruns where bars and restaurants are really animated. Very friendly race because we prefer to keep a quantity of racers which can be well managed, in savety conditions.For teamates or family, it's easy to follow up the GTVO many times because some roads meet the race and LiveTrail helps to manage time.We want to transmit our passion, our team spirit, our solidarity, every runners who run GTVO become different

Tappa italiana del prestigioso circuito internazionale K42 Series.Un anello di 44 km e 3500 m di dislivello positivo, con partenza e arrivo da piazza Pian de' Valli a Terminillo e giro di boa nel caratteristico centro storico di Leonessa. Due diverse creste e la chicca finale della risalita del M. Terminillo attraverso la magnifica ed aerea cresta Sassetelli.
Description in English
Italian stage of the prestigious international K42 Series circuit.A ring of 44 km and 3500 mD+, with departure and arrival from Pian de 'Valli square in Terminillo and turning point in the characteristic historical center of Leonessa. Two different ridges and the final gems of the ascent of Mt. Terminillo through the magnificent and aerial Sassetelli ridge.

Corsa in linea di 22,6 km e 1400 mD+ ricalca la prima parte del tracciato della corsa regina. Percorso molto vario e corribile, senza grosse difficoltà tecniche, che permette di transitare in luoghi suggestivi come Passo del Lupo, il confine tra lo Stato Pontificio e il Regno delle Due Sicilie con i cippi ancora perfettamente conservati, la discesa su Leonessa con la Torre Angioina. Gli atleti possono rientrare a Pian de' Valli con il servizio navetta.
Description in English
22,6 km inline race and 1400 mD + follows the first part of the major race track. A very varied and easy to run route, without major technical difficulties, which allows you to pass through suggestive places like Passo del Lupo, the border between the Papal State and the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies with the stones still perfectly preserved, the descent on Leonessa with the Angevin Tower. Athletes can return to Pian de' Valli with the shuttle service.

Breve ed intenso! Per scaldare i motori, il sabato pomeriggio in soli 4,8 km e 510 mD+ si andrà dal Rifugio Sebastiani a Pian de' Valli, passando per la vetta del M. Terminillo a 2217m, l'affilata cresta di Passo del Cavallo, superando il Rifugio Rinaldi per buttarsi infine in discesa lungo quelle che d'inverno sono le piste da sci che riportano a Pian de' Valli.
Description in English
Short and intense! To warm up the engines, on Saturday afternoon in just 4.8 km and 510 mD + you will go from Rifugio Sebastiani to Pian de' Valli, passing the summit of M. Terminillo to 2217 m, the sharp ridge of Passo del Cavallo, passing Rifugio Rinaldi to finally go downhill along the slopes that in winter are the ski slopes that lead to Pian de' Valli.The most daring can run both the KSprint and the K42 Italia and participate in the special classification of the KChallenge.

Laugavegshlaupið er 55 kílómetra langt utanvegahlaup sem haldið verður í 23. sinn þann 13. júlí 2019. Skráning í hlaupið hefst 11.janúar 2019.Laugavegurinn tengir saman Landmannalaugar og Þórsmörk á sunnanverðu hálendi Íslands, tvær náttúruperlur. Staðsetningin gerir það að verkum að Laugavegurinn er einungis þjónustaður í nokkrar vikur á ári.Í hugum margra hlaupara er Laugavegshlaupið skemmtilegasta hlaupið á Íslandi. Á þessari krefjandi leið verða hlauparar vitni að ótrúlegri náttúrufegurð. Göngugarpar eru venjulega 4 daga á leið sinni um Laugaveginn. Undirlendið er fjölbreytt þar sem hlaupið er á sandi og möl, í grasi og snjó, á ís, yfir ár og læki.
Description in English
Laugavegur Ultra Marathon is a 55 km mountain race that will take place for the 23rd time on Saturday, July 13th, 2019. Registration starts on January 11th, 2019.Laugavegur is located in the southern highlands of Iceland and connects the nature reserves Landmannalaugar and Thorsmork. Due to its location, Laugavegur is serviced for only a few weeks a year.For many runners the Laugavegur Ultra Marathon is the most enjoyable race in Iceland. The course takes runners through areas of outstanding natural beauty at the same time as being a challenging course. Hikers normally cover this distance in four days. The course is multi-terrain; sand, gravel, grass, snow, ice, rivers and streams.

Description: Trail running race along Arjuna 3339 masl - Welirang 3156 masl, an active volcano in Pasuruan and Malang, East Java, Indonesia. The event racing 5 category: 15, 35, 55,75 and 116K. The 116K category naming this event with MSC one.one.six. The one.one.six category having a steep elevation gain of 8060 m.The course along and around Arjuna and Welirang offering you a magnificent classical view of tropical volcano in Java island.The race starting from Kaliandra Eco Resort in Prigen-Pasuruan, East Java about 60K from Juanda International airport, Surabaya.The race will be held in 13-14 July 2019.Come and join us.

Nízkotatranská stíhačka (NTS) is a mountain ultramarathon race for individuals in Slovakia with 103 km long race course, which goes through the whole main ridge of Low Tatras mountains, for the most part in alpine terrain with rough trail surface.

An unforgettable 100km along Britain's oldest pathHumans have walked the length of the Ridgeway for over 5,000 years. Now itâs your turn to take on the challenge of following in their footsteps.Voted Best Endurance Event in the UK, Running Awards 2016
A tough trail run around the capital city's beautiful trails that tie the city together.

Event: Trail Du Pic Des Trois Seigneurs 2019

Description:
ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA es una carrera de montaña de 100 kilómetros de ascensión continua por senderos y caminos desde Granada hasta el Pico Veleta y la Estación de Esquí de Pradollano.​La ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA tendrá su Salida a las 00:00 de la noche del Viernes 12 al Sábado 13 de Julio en un entorno espectacular: el centro de la ciudad de Granada a los pies del Conjunto Monumental de la Alhambra y el Generalife. Desde allí el itinerario conducirá a los participantes a la Dehesa del Generalife y, tras continuar por la cuenca del río Darro, llegar a la población de Beas. Desde aquí el itinerario toma dirección a Quentar para a continuación dirigirse a la población de Güejar-Sierra. El curso del Río Genil marca el comienzo del tramo más exigente de la prueba: la subida a Sierra Nevada. 40 kilómetros en los que habrá que superar un desnivel de más de 2.500 metros para alcanzar el techo de la prueba a los pies del Pico Veleta a 3.100 metros de altitud. Desde allí un descenso vertiginoso conducirá a la Meta instalada en la Estación de Esquí de Pradollano, a 2.100 m de altitud.​La ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA tiene un desnivel de 6.060m+ y  4.590 m- . Con carácter de semi-autosuficiencia tiene un tiempo máximo para su realización de 25 horas. El número máximo de dorsales disponibles es de 450.​La ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA es carrera puntuable en el circuito Spain Ultra CUP
Description in English
The ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA is a mountain race of 100 kms of continuous ascent by paths and trails from Granada to ski resort of Pradollano, crowning before the Veleta´s Peak (3100m). ​The ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA has its start line at 00:00 a.m (midnight Friday 12 July to Saturday 13 July) in a spectacular surrounding: the Monumental Complex of the Alhambra and the Generalife. The ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA has an accumulated altitude of 6.060 m+ and 4.590 m-. With semi-autonomy character, the participants have a maximum time of 25 hours to complete the race. Throughout the race, the participants must cross several aid stations and checkpoint where they can replenish their water and food supplies. The maximum bib numbers available are 450.​The ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA is qualifying race for the Spain Ultra Cup.

TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA es la versión mediana de la ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA. Comparte con ésta el itinerario, puntos de control y avituallamientos de los 62 kilómetros que transcurren desde la población de Beas de Granada hasta el primer paso por Pradollano, donde estará instalada la Meta de las tres modalidades.​Está pensada para ofrecer una alternativa con menos exigencia física y un mayor margen horario a todos aquellos corredores que quieran formar parte del ambiente de la ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA.​Los corredores  de la TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA  tienen la Salida a las 5:00 a.m. el Sábado 13 de Julio en la Población de Beas de Granada. Tiene un desnivel de 3.710m+ y 2.650m- . Con carácter de semi-autosuficiencia tiene un tiempo máximo para completar el recorrido de 15 horas. El número máximo de dorsales disponibles es de 450. La TRAL SIERRA NEVADA es carrera puntuable del circuito Spain Ultra Cup M.
Description in English
TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA is the medium version of the ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA. The route, checkpoints and aid stations are the same as the  62 kilómeters from Beas de Granada to Pradollano, where the finish line of the three modalities is installed. ​It is designed to offer an alternative with less physical demanding and a bigger timeframe for those who want to be part of the ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA environment. TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA has the start line at 5:00 a.m. of 13th July at Beas de Granada. TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA has an accumulated altitude of   3.750 m+ and 2650m-. With the character of semi-autonomy the TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA has a maximum time of 15 hours to be completed. The maximum bib numbers available are 450. The ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA is qualifying race for the Spain Ultra Cup M.

MARATÓN SIERRA NEVADA es la versión reducida de la ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA. Comparte con ésta el itinerario, puntos de control y avituallamientos de los 40 kilómetros  que transcurren desde la población de Quéntar hasta el primer paso por Pradollano donde estará instalada la Meta de las tres modalidades. Está pensada para ofrecer una alternativa con menos exigencia física que la TRAIL SIERRA NEVADA y un mayor margen horario a todos aquellos corredores que quieran formar parte del ambiente de la ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA. Los corredores  de la MARATÓN SIERRA NEVADA  tienen la Salida a las 7:00 a.m. el Sábado 13 de Julio en la Población de Quéntar. Tiene un desnivel de 2730 m+ y 1450m-. Con carácter de semi-autosuficiencia tiene un tiempo máximo para completar el recorrido de 10 horas. El número máximo de dorsales disponibles es de 450.
Description in English
MARATÓN SIERRA NEVADA is the reduced version of the ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA. The route, checkpoints and aid stations are the same as the 40 kilómeters from Quéntar to Pradollano, where the finish line of the three modalities is installed. ​It is designed to offer an alternative with less physical demanding and a bigger timeframe for those who want to be part of the ULTRA SIERRA NEVADA environment. MARATÓN SIERRA NEVADA has the start line at 7:00 a.m. of 13th July at Quéntar. MARATÓN SIERRA NEVADA has an accumulated altitude of 2.400 m+ and 1.450m- . With the character of semi-autonomy the MARATÓN SIERRA NEVADA has a maximum time of 10 hours to be completed. The maximum bib numbers available are 450.

Description: Welcome to the Snowdonia Trail Marathon 2019, a stunning Trail Marathon, Ultra Marathon, Half Marathon and 10k, starting and finishing in Wales's outdoor capital, Llanberis.The Snowdonia Trail Marathon is a challenge in every sense of the word. The Ultra encompasses 7000ft of climbing over 60km and visits the beautiful Cwm Tresgl and Cwm Pennant before rejoining the Marathon Route to ascent Snowdon.The incredible route explores the trails, gorgeous panoramic views and tough climbs that make Snowdonia National Park such a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts. Visiting Rhyd Ddu, Beddgelert, Nant Gwynant, Pen y Pass and Snowdon, there surely can't be a more striking trail marathon route in the UK!We're incredibly proud that the On Snowdonia Trail Marathon has been chosen to be the GB Trial race for the World Long Distance Mountain Running Championships on 16 November 2019, Villa La Angostura, Argentina.As well as a fantastic day of racing, there will be masses to see and do to keep spectators entertained. This will include hot and cold food, music, a wide range of activities and loads of kids entertainment too.

Welcome to the Snowdonia Trail Marathon 2019, a stunning Trail Marathon, Ultra Marathon, Half Marathon and 10k, starting and finishing in Wales's outdoor capital, Llanberis.The Snowdonia Trail Marathon is a challenge in every sense of the word. Ascending 1,685 metres over 26 miles of iconic and spectacular trails, this epic race will circumnavigate and eventually climb Wales' highest peak - Snowdon. The incredible route explores the trails, gorgeous panoramic views and tough climbs that make Snowdonia National Park such a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts. Visiting Rhyd Ddu, Beddgelert, Nant Gwynant, Pen y Pass and Snowdon, there surely can't be a more striking trail marathon route in the UK!We're incredibly proud that the On Snowdonia Trail Marathon has been chosen to be the GB Trial race for the World Long Distance Mountain Running Championships on 16 November 2019, Villa La Angostura, Argentina As well as a fantastic day of racing, there will be masses to see and do to keep spectators entertained. This will include hot and cold food, music, a wide range of activities and loads of kids entertainment too.

Welcome to the Snowdonia Trail Marathon 2019, a stunning Trail Marathon, Ultra Marathon, Half Marathon and 10k, starting and finishing in Wales's outdoor capital, Llanberis.The Snowdonia Trail Marathon is a challenge in every sense of the word. The incredible route explores the trails, gorgeous panoramic views and tough climbs that make Snowdonia National Park such a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts. Visiting Rhyd Ddu, Beddgelert, Nant Gwynant, Pen y Pass and Snowdon, there surely can't be a more striking trail marathon route in the UK!The half marathon option takes in many of the fantastic routes and trails as the half marathon but ascends Snowdon via the Snowdon Ranger route, rather than the PyG track. We're incredibly proud that the On Snowdonia Trail Marathon has been chosen to be the GB Trial race for the World Long Distance Mountain Running Championships on 16 November 2019, Villa La Angostura, Argentina As well as a fantastic day of racing, there will be masses to see and do to keep spectators entertained. This will include hot and cold food, music, a wide range of activities and loads of kids entertainment too.

Welcome to the Snowdonia Trail Marathon 2019, a stunning Trail Marathon, Ultra Marathon, Half Marathon and 10k, starting and finishing in Wales's outdoor capital, Llanberis.The Snowdonia Trail Marathon is a challenge in every sense of the word. The incredible route explores the trails, gorgeous panoramic views and tough climbs that make Snowdonia National Park such a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts. Visiting Rhyd Ddu, Beddgelert, Nant Gwynant, Pen y Pass and Snowdon, there surely can't be a more striking trail marathon route in the UK!The 10k skirts the base of Snowdon before returning past Dolbadarn castle and into Padarn country park and the heart of the Dinorwig slate quarries.We're incredibly proud that the On Snowdonia Trail Marathon has been chosen to be the GB Trial race for the World Long Distance Mountain Running Championships on 16 November 2019, Villa La Angostura, Argentina.As well as a fantastic day of racing, there will be masses to see and do to keep spectators entertained. This will include hot and cold food, music, a wide range of activities and loads of kids entertainment too.

Ce trail vous emmènera sur une crête surplombant le Col du Petit Saint Bernard, avec le Mont Blanc en toile de fond. Puis dans le vallon du torrent des Moulins, vous découvrirez après une montée exigeante par le passage de la Louie Blanche, une pure merveille face au Mont- Pourri, le vallon et plateau du Ruitor, berceau de la nature sauvage de Sainte Foy Tarentaise ! Le Lac Noir sera votre récompense après une montée de 500m. La descente sur le Refuge d’ Archeboc testera certains de vos réflexes puis le sentier forestier en balcon dans le vallon de Mercuel vous donnera un peu de jus pour remonter les 700m jusqu’au Lac du Retour. Vous serez transportés en descente par le vallon sauvage du Piche jusqu’à la chapelle Saint- Michel, qui domine la Haute-Tarentaise pour finir par une montée derrière le Chatelard jusqu’au cœur de la station de la Rosière.Ici pas de price money, que des gros mollets ! Parcours très exigeant, entrainement de rigueur !

Le parcours de 22 km, D+1450m est un parcours exigeant en montagne entre 1500m et 2450m d’altitude.Au départ de la Rosière : à l’assaut du Roc Noir, surplombez tel un équilibriste le Col du Petit-Saint-Bernard depuis les crêtes. Saluez le Mont Blanc et les massifs de la Vanoise…Traversez le mystérieux Fort de la Redoute Ruinée avant d’entamer le sentier balcon de la combe du Torrent des Moulins. Après une montée exigeante du passage de la Louie Blanche, plongez vos yeux dans le Lac du Retour à 2400m pour vous rafraichir les idées… avant la descente dans la forêt. Découvrez les villages du Vaz et du Chatelard à 1500m avec leur ambiance authentique. Rejoignez l’arrivée par le montée des Foins dans nos alpages. Vous en prendrez plein les yeux et les jambes sur ces sentiers pour la plupart monotraces !
Description in English
Beautiful alpine races with lakes, moutain single tracks !

Enfin un petit parcours aussi joli et qualitatif qu’un long. 90% sur des singlesLe parcours de 15km, D+800m est un tracé alpin accessible avec chemins en crêtes et aériens avec une vue panoramique ! Belle montée en single sur les crêtes du Roc Noir, vue plongeante sur le Mont Blanc et le Col du Petit Saint Bernard. Traversée du Fort de la Redoute puis sentier en balcon dans le vallon sauvage des Moulins avec torrents, ponts et maisons d’alpages.

Frumoasa poveste a început în 2009, când o mână de munțomani înrăiți au decis că Romania are nevoie de o provocare serioasă. Dacă am fi știut pe vremea aceea că 90 de kilometri nu înseamnă Marathon, acum ar fi avut probabil un alt cuvant înainte de 7500. Ediția a 10-a va reprezenta, probabil, ultima care va măsura 7500m diferență de nivel, dar nu vă faceți griji, numele va ramâne același și pe siglă și în sufletele noastre.
Description in English
The wonderful story began in 2009 when a few hardcore mountain lovers decided that Romania needed a serious challenge. Had we known at the time that 90 km doesn’t mean a marathon, we probably would have had a different word in front of the “7500”.
Entry Fee:
105 / EUR / Team - Early registration
110 / EUR / Team - Normal registration

Description:
Iata ca rebrandingul s-a intamplat. Ceea ce pana acum s-a numit SecČiunea Hobby a primit un nume nou. Nu ne place sa-l numim cel mai greu maraton din tara, ci mai degraba fratele mai mic sau o cursa de acomodare pentru Marathon 7500, o cursa in sine foarte dificila, dar consideram noi foarte frumoasa.
Description in English
The long awaited re-branding just happened. What was up until now the Hobby Section has just gotten a new name. We donât like to call it the toughest marathon race in the country, but rather the little brother or an acquaintance race for Marathon 7500, a very difficult race itself, as well as a very beautiful one.
Entry Fee:
64 EUR / Team - Early registration
75 EUR / Team - Normal registration

Description:
CPNT probabil că știe, însă se pare că nu dorește să organizeze concursuri ușoare. Scopul nostru a fost întotdeauna să facem oamenii să mearga pe munte așa cum ne place și nouă să o facem. Marathon 1600 își propune să vă ofere o minimă senzație din ceea ce înseamnă Marathon 7500: un concurs montan, greu prin diferența de nivel mare raportată la distanța relativ scurtă, alături de un coechipier. Această cursă imită întocmai spiritul 7500, însă doar pe o distanta de 22 de kilometri și vă va duce prin locurile pe unde concurenții de la celelalte probe se luptă cu oboseala, cu somnul și cu timpul pentru a ajunge la aceeași linie de sosire. 
Description in English
CPNT probably knows how to, but it seems it doesn’t want to organize easy races.  Our purpose has always been to encourage people to go out, go hiking just the way we love to hike. Marathon 1600 aims to offer a minimum sensation of what Marathon 7500 means: a tough mountain race, tough because it's huge height gain in respect to the relatively short distance, all these along with a partner. This Marathon 7500 spirit will be lived through on only 22km and will take the competitors through the places where the racers on the longer races fight their fatigue, their sleep and with time to reach the same finish line.
Entry Fee:
75 EUR / Team - Early registration
80 EUR / Team - Normal registration

Description:
DAS SKYRACE...Die Skyrace-Strecke über 33km Länge und über 2380 Höhenmeter im An-/Abstieg ist die absolute Herausforderung für richtige Skyrunner. Nach dem relativ flach ansteigenden Startstück Richtung Pfitscherjoch überschreiten die Läufer die österreichisch/italienische Staatsgrenze und bewegen sich kurzzeitig auf italienischer Seite der Zillertaler Alpen. Weiter laufend auf Teilen der Peter-Habeler-Runde überqueren die Läufer das Unterschrammachkar und den 2900m hohen Riepenkopf - einen der Vorgipfel des 3476m hohen Olperers, bevor es zurück zur bekannten Olpererhütte geht. Hauptschlüsselstelle wird der Aufstieg zur Friesenbergscharte sein, wo auch der höchste Punkt auf 2930m überschritten wird. Nach einem Abstecher über das Petersköpfl mit seinen bekannten „Steinmandln“ führt die Strecke zum Friesenberghaus und zurück zum Ziel auf der Staumauer des Stausees.Die Herausforderung der Strecke ist in erster Linie der sehr lange Streckenverlauf auf über 2500m Seehöhe und die Überschreitungen der Schlüsselpassagen an der 3000er Grenze unterhalb der Bergriesen, wie Olperer und Hoher Riffler. Die sehr technische Strecke, welche in ihren Schlüsselstellen Klettersteigelemente, Seilversicherungen und sehr verblockte Steinpassagen beinhaltet und über weite Teile über sehr steile Trails führt, die sehr anspruchsvoll sind, fordert von den Läufern einiges an Ausdauer und Konzentration. Das Schlegeis 3000 Skyrace ist eine extreme Laufveranstaltung, welche zum Großteil im hochalpinen Gelände stattfindet, jedoch werden die Teilnehmer dafür mit einem einzigartigen Erlebnis in einer eindrucksvollen Kulisse belohnt.Das SKYRACE zählt 2019 zur neu gegründeten nationalen Skyrunning-Serie und wird zugleich als österrreichische SKYRUNNING Staatsmeisterschaft ausgetragen!
Description in English
THE SKYRACE...The SKYRACE route - with a distance of over 33km and a total ascent/descent of 2,380m - is the ultimate challenge for serious sky runners. After a relatively gradual climb at the start in the direction of Pfitscherjoch, runners cross the Austrian-Italian border and run for a short time on the Italian side of the Zilltertal Alps. Continuing on parts of the Peter Habeler Circuit, runners cross the Unterschrammach corrie and the 2,900m Riepenkopf - one of the secondary summits of the 3,476m Olperer, before returning to the famous Olpererhütte. The crux point is the climb up to the Friesenberg wind gap, where the highest point of 2,930m is reached. After a detour over the Petersköpfl peak with its famous "stone almonds", the route continues to the Friesenberghaus and back to the start at the dam on the reservoir.The main challenge of the route is the very long distance at over 2,500m above see level, with key sections close to the 3,000m mark - below giant mountains such as the Olperer and Hoher Riffler.The highly technically challenging route includes crux points with via ferrata elements, steel safety rope and very rocky sections. Much of it is on very steep trails that are extremely demanding, and require stamina and concentration from the runners. The Schlegeis 3000 SKYRACE is an extreme running event, most of which is on high Alpine terrain. Nevertheless, participants will be rewarded by a unique experience in a fantastic setting.The SKYRACE will be part of the newly founded SKYRUNNING AUSTRIA SERIES in 2019 and will also be held as the Austrian SKYRUNNING championship!

BUFF® Epic Trail Vall de Boí: Exigente carrera a pie de 65km y más de 10.000 metros de desnivel acumulado que los participantes deberán efectuar en menos de 17 horas; consiste en un recorrido circular por la zona periférica del Parque Nacional y las montañas que circundan la estación de esquí de Boí Taüll, la más alta de los Pirineos. Una competición de muy alto nivel solamente apta para los y las corredores de montaña más preparados físicamente. 
Description in English
The BUFF® Epic Trail Vall de Boí is a 65km race with an elevation gain of roughly 5,000 m and similar elevation loss; the route passes around the Aigüestortes National Park.

Pour cette 3eme édition,  l’organisation vous propose des parcours différents à 2018 !Le départ de la course se fera à Oz en Oisans,  après vous êtes rendu à Vaujany par un magnifique sentier en balcon, vous partirez pour une première ascension sur le col du Couard (2334m)!Vous terminerez votre première ascension au lever du jour sur les lacs d'altitude du Plan des Cavalles (massif des Grandes Rousses), avec un passage à plus de 2700m d'altitude!Lors de votre descente, vous emprunterez la Combe Charbonnière avant de rejoindre le mythique Col de Sarenne (1999m) qui vous fera basculer dans la magnifique Vallée du Ferrand !Vous remonterez ensuite sur Besse en Oisans et le Plateau d'Emparis pour faire la boucle des Lacs (Lerié et Noir) avant de redescendre sur Mizoën.De Mizoën vous rejoindrez Auris en Oisans pour quitter le  Parc Naturel Régional des Écrins. Là, vous profiterez de chemins roulant en évoluant dans la combe de Sarenne avant d'arriver au dernier point clef de cet ultra, le village station de Villard-Reculas qui vous fera prendre des magnifiques chemins en balcon (des Combe, de la Rompure) avant la descente finale sur Oz en Oisans ou sera jugée l’arrivée.

Pour cette 3eme édition,  l’organisation vous propose un nouveau tracé pour le 30km! C’est l’occasion de découvrir les joies du Trail tout en découvrant ce coin de paradis qui est l'Oisans!Le départ de la course se fera de l'Alpe d'Huez, puis vous partirez vers les chemins roulants évoluant dans la combe de Sarenne ! Peu avant le col du même nom, vous remonterez à la croix de Cassini (2373m), le point culminant du parcours, avant de redescendre à Auris en Oisans ou vous y attend le premier ravitaillement (mi parcours).Après avoir fait le plus gros du dénivelé, vous rejoindrez le village station de Villard-Reculas pour votre deuxième ravitaillement. Ensuite, vous emprunterez des magnifiques chemins en balcons (des Combes) avant d'arriver à Oz en Oisans ou sera jugée l’arrivée.

Le trail 100% nature au cœur des alpes valaisannes, le Trail du Vélan est un événement sportif, au pied des majestueux Mont Vélan et Grand Combin, dans les massifs du Grand-St-Bernard et des Combins. Le grand parcours passant par 3 cabanes de montagne (Cabane de Mille, Cabane du Valsorey, Cabane du Vélan), traversant les communes de Bourg-St-Pierre et Liddes; ce tracé original alpin, avec vue imprenable sur le Mont blanc et les Grandes Jorasses, empruntant le fameux « chemin panoramique », culminera à 3037m, avec 45 km et environ 3600 mètres de dénivelé positif, en semi autonomie.

2019 野性祁连中国祁连山越野跑100公里组
Description in English
TransQILIAN Run 100km 2019

2019 野性祁连 中国祁连山越野跑50公里
Description in English
Trandqilian Run 50km 2019

2019 野性祁连越野跑30公里
Description in English
TRANSQILIAN RUN 30KM 2019

Apres un départ dans le centre du village, vous empruntez un single pour une première partie à majorité montante, de bons raidards sur la fin. Arrivés à la première crête, km 14 et 1er ravitaillement, où avec un peu de chance vous pourrez admirer le lever du soleil sur les Alpes.S’en suit une partie descendante et roulante qui fera du bien aux jambes. La montée suivante est plus courte mais bien raide et technique sur le haut. Vous  voilà au sommet  de la deuxième crête. Ouf ! Une première partie de descente technique et casse-patte et vous êtes maintenant partis pour une succession de petites montées et descentes jusqu’au ravitaillement de la Charce.Un peu de plat jusqu’au village de Sainte Marie et c’est reparti pour 10 km de montée. En haut vous êtes maintenant sur un tapis de feuilles dans une foret de hêtres, le sol est souple, vous êtes à l’ombre et en plus c’est plat (enfin presque). Un mur en descente et voila le ravitaillement du sommet de la Fromagère (50ème km).Suivent 2,5km de montée et quelques passages bien durs  le tout dans un sous bois de sapins et de hêtres. Voila la 3ème crête. La suite est un vrai régal, la vue est splendide, le terrain agréable. Puits la descente qui mène jusque Rémuzat (km 66).Petit passage le long de la rivière et c’est le mur, 500 mètres droit dans la falaise, c’est dur, aérien avec passage d'échelle. Au sommet vous êtes sur la dernière crête. C’est le repère des vautours, selon l’heure vous pourrez en apercevoir.Après le rocher du Caire, on enchaine en sous bois des montées descentes direction Léoux (km 76). Avant dernière ascension sur 1 km environ, chemin large et roulant. Prise seule, ce n'est rien mais après plus de 75 km de course cela fera certainement mal aux jambes. Longue descente ensuite en DFCI avant de bifurquer sur la droite pour se prendre un dernier 100 de D+ dans les jambes pour arriver au dessus du plan d'eau. Descente technique, passage au plan d'eau puis on emprunte un chemin vallonné qui ramène jusque la motte. Petit tour du village et c’est l’arrivée.

Après une première partie ascendante, large et roulante de 3 km environ, on bifurque sur la droite direction le Montrond. La montée se fait en monotrace et en sous bois pour sortir au sommet où on peut profiter d’une vue imprenable sur le rocher du Caire … où il faudra passer un peu plus tard ! On en est alors à environ 5 km de course,On enchaîne sur une partie une partie roulante descendante de 3 km pour attaquer le valon. 1,5 km dans le lit d’une rivière à sec, au frais ! Ce passage nous amène directement en crête pour rejoindre le col de Staton, puis ascension de la montagne des Gavières jusqu’au pas de Pousterle. Vous en serez alors au km 12 et 1300 de D+….A partir de là, c’est parcours commun avec le 86 km jusqu’à l’arrivée à la Motte.

Le parcours de la croix est un véritable concentré de ce que l’on aime dans le trail, parfois technique et parfois roulant.Après un petit tour du village vous partirez dans un petit chemin pour 4 km de montée, principalement en monotrace. On enchaine sur une bonne descente rapide en DFCI et c’est la montée sur la croix. C’est court  et raide.Après avoir admiré le paysage se sera une descente en monotrace ou ceux qui ont les jambes pourront s’emballer.Attention reste encore une montée et voila le dernier single qui redescend jusqu'à la motte. Un dernier petit tour de village et c’est finit.

course en boucle qui se déroule, au coeur des Pyrénées centrales, sur les montagnes de Haute Garonne et d’Ariège.Le départ a lieu dans le joli village d’Arbas. Après le village d’Herran (profitez en le prochain village sera dans 44 km), lieu du premier ravitaillement, vous allez monter plein sud en direction des crêtes de Cornudères. Le col de la croix de Guéret marque le début de la première crête, assez roulante, que vous allez suivre sur 7 km.C’est le moment de souffler et dérouler un peu. C’est aussi le moment de profiter d’un panorama à 360 degrés avec au nord la vue sur la plaine et au sud les montagnes du Couserans. Cette longue crête est un enchaînement de petits pics, dont le pic de Cornudère (1563 m), très agréable à courir, recouvert d’herbes rases.Vous allez quitter cette crête au col des passagers et continuer en direction du sud, vers l’Ariège, pour traverser le col du Portet d’Aspet (bien connu des cyclistes, ou passera, 2 jours plus tard, le Tour de France 2018). Ce sera le kilomètre 17 et aussi le 2nd ravitaillement.Après cette petite pause, vous allez maintenant rentrer dans le parc régional d’Ariège et enchaîner les Pics (Pic du Puech (1669 m), Pic de la Calabasse (2210 m), Pic de Paumaude (2082 m)) pour progressivement monter en altitude. Cette longue crête sauvage de 17 km est un vrai plaisir, un magnifique point de vue sur les Pyrénées et plus particulièrement sur les montagnes du Haut Couserans (Crabère, Maubermé, Valier, …).De là, vous allez entamer une longue descente vers le 3ieme ravitaillement, les villages de Saint Lary (en Couserans) puis en longeant une belle rivière à truites (la Bouigane) vous arriverez à Augirein (4ieme ravitaillement).Vous êtes maintenant au pied de la dernier montée (+900 m), vous traverserez le joli village de Galey pour rejoindre à nouveau les crêtes de Cornudère puis descendrez vers Arbas à travers une forêt de hêtres et de buis..
Entry Fee:
50€ jusqu’au 2 juin 2019
60€ à partir du 3 juin 2019

Description: Relais 1 : Le départ a lieu dans le joli village d’Arbas. vous allez monter plein sud en direction des crêtes de Cornudères et le col des Passagers. Depuis ce col vous descendrez vers le col du Portet d’Aspet, (bien connu des cyclistes et du Tour de France) ou vous attend un ravitaillement bien mérité.Relais 2 : Vous allez maintenant rentrer dans le parc régional d’Ariège et enchaîner les Pics (Pic du Puech (1669 m) et Pic de la Calabasse (2210 m)) pour progressivement monter en altitude. Cette longue crête sauvage de 17 km est un vrai plaisir, un magnifique point de vue sur les Pyrénées et plus particulièrement sur les montagnes du Haut Couserans (Crabère, Maubermé, Valier, …). De là, vous allez entamer une longue descente vers le 2ieme ravitaillement au col de l’Herbe Soulette, puis en longeant une belle rivière à truites (la Bouigane) vous arriverez à Augirein (3ieme ravitaillement).Relais 3 : Vous êtes maintenant au pied de la dernier montée (+1000 m), vous traverserez le joli village de Galey pour rejoindre à nouveau les crêtes de Cornudère puis descendrez vers Herran puis Arbas à travers une forêt de hêtres et de buis.
Entry Fee:
Pour 3 relayeurs
66€ jusqu’au 2 juin 2019
75€ à partir du 3 juin 2019

Description: Après le départ au cœur du village d’Arbas en direction de Planque vous entamerez la première partie de la montée dans le bois de Campas. Vous passerez sous le planot de Loubat, bien connu des parapentistes de la région, pour aller rejoindre le premier ravitaillement situé au parking de la fontaine de l’Ours. Vous aurez déjà parcouru 6km et effectué 800m de dénivelé positif.Vous poursuivrez alors la deuxième partie de la montée en direction de la cabane de RoquePi. A l’approche de celle-ci vous sortirez de la forêt pour atteindre les premières zones de pâturages . A peine le temps de profiter des paysages et  du sentier plus roulant jusqu’au passage devant la cabane il vous faudra donner un dernier coup de collier pour atteindre le Col des Passagers (1470m). Vous pourrez admirer les premiers paysages sur les montagnes Ariégeoises depuis ce nouveau point de passage emprunté par le parcours de cette année.Il vous faudra effectuer la traversé de la magnifique crête de Cornudère par un enchaînement de petits tucs (sommets en occitan) qui vous demanderont encore quelques efforts de relance. Tout d’abord le Tuc de Haurade d’où vous pourrez apercevoir en contre bas la cabane de Roque Pi et sur votre droite le Pic de Cornudère. Vous poursuivrez votre course sur la crête, n’hésitez pas à vous retourner pour observer l’enchaînement des Pics de Paloumergue, du Cagire et du Gar, et bien plus loin le Pic du Midi.  Vous passerez par le tuc du Tucol avant d’atteindre le Pic de Cornudère, d’où vous pourrez apercevoir sur votre gauche le village d’Arbas dans la vallée.Vous attaquerez la descente où il vous faudra rester encore vigilent et prudent sur les premiers 800 m plutôt techniques. Enfin vous pourrez commencer à lâcher les chevaux en sous bois pour atteindre la croix de Guéret (1213 m). Vous enchaînerez un single un peu plus technique mais très plaisant jusqu’au village d’Herran où vous trouverez le deuxième ravitaillement.  Après avoir traversé le village vous emprunterez une nouvelle portion de sentier technique et roulante qui contourne le Montagnat par l’Ouest pour rejoindre Arbas.
Entry Fee:
25€ jusqu’au 2 juin 2019
30€ à partir du 3 juin 2019

Description: C’est une course sur un parcours bucolique qui vous amènera sur le pied mont des Pyrénées. De jolis sentiers en single vous entraîneront à traverser deux villages typiques du Comminges (Fougaron et Herran). Depuis Herran, vous verrez les nombreux parapentistes qui tournoient dans le ciel pour se poser à Arbas.
Entry Fee:
12€ jusqu’au 2 juin 2019
15€ à partir du 3 juin 2019

Description: The High Lonesome 100 is a high flying endurance race in the Sawatch range of the Colorado Rocky Mountains. With 22,500' of vertical gain and reaching an elevation of 13,150', it's a hell of a course. The race runs in a loop through some of the most beautiful single track in the state, and takes runners on the Continental Divide and Colorado Trail, through 2 ghost towns, over 5 alpine passes, through remote basins, and over soaring ridges. It's also run and staffed by experienced and quality individuals, so you'll get to be a part of a wonderful community. If you're looking for a true mountain race, created in the spirit of the classic 100 milers, then look no further.

30ème édition de cette course mythique et première en son genre à l’époque, la 6000D reste un défi pour la plupart des Traileurs. Elle entraîne les coureurs sur le chemin qui a fait sa légende : l’ascension jusqu’au sommet du Glacier de Bellecôte (3250m), avant d’attaquer la descente jusqu’en vallée (670m). Désormais intégré au calendrier du Trail Tour National, la 6000D confirme sa notoriété depuis 2011. Depuis 2013, le passage insolite dans la piste Olympique de Bobsleigh au km10 est intégré dans le parcours. Départ à 6h00 d’Aime le samedi 27 juillet 2019. Nous vous proposons également sur les 3 jours de l’événement : la 6000D en relais à 2, la 6D Lacs (27km), la 6 Découverte (11km), la 6D Verticale (5km), la 6D Bob (montée insolite), la 6D Kid’s et la 6D Aventure. Nouveauté avec des packs coursesPour l’occasion, la télécabine pour accéder au Glacier sera gratuite pour tous, alors n’hésitez pas à monter au Glacier à près de 3000m d’altitude pour encourager les coureurs le samedi 27 juillet 2019.
Description in English
The 6000D, a legendary race and the first of its kind, is still considered a challenge by most trail runners. Climbing from the apple orchards up to the glacier is a real feat!Individual challenge, accessible to all3500m of elevation gain over a 65km course that takes participants from the village of Aime la Plagne in the valley to the top of Bellecôte glacier at 3047m via La Plagne's different altitude villages, then coming back down through the forest to Montchavin and finishing along the Isère river.The atmosphere 6000DThe trail is well marked with 95% of it on regular walking paths. There will be a large, enthusiastic crowd all along the trail to cheer you on you during the 30th edition, on Saturday, July 27th 2019.

La 6000D vous présente la nouveauté 2018 à la 6000D en relais à 2 ...Course mythique et première en son genre à l'époque, la 6000D reste un défi pour la plupart des Traileurs. Ce n'est pas rien que de monter des pommiers au Glacier! Alors pour l'édition 2018 nous vous proposons que l'un ou l'une la monte et l'autre la descende avec un passage de témoin au Glacier de la Plagne, point culminant de la course.Défi à 2, accessible à tousUn dénivelé positif de 3500m pour un parcours total de 65km à COURIR A 2.Un tracé qui emmène les coureurs du village d'Aime en vallée, au sommet du Glacier de Bellecôte à 3047m d'altitude avec un passage dans les stations d'altitude de la Grande Plagne pour redescendre ensuite à travers la forêt à Montchavin et finir le long de l'Isère. Un parcours balisé de haute volée, 95% sur chemins et sentiers.L'ambiance 6000DPour cette 29ème année, un public nombreux et enthousiaste vous encouragera tout au long du parcours de la 6000D,le samedi 28 juillet 2018 avant l'accès au Glacier gratuit pour les accompagnateurs.Afin d'être le plus près possible de l'esprit Trail, il y a uniquement 4 ravitaillements (nourriture et boissons) et 3 points d'eau (boissons uniquement) sur les 65 km. Un camel bag ou un porte gourde est vivement conseillés. Courir en autosuffisance est recommandé.

Sur le parcours de la célèbre 6000D, il sillonne les sentiers jusqu’au sommet de la Roche de Mio à 2700m d’altitude. Une bonne préparation à la 6000D ou une belle alternative, plus accessible que la 6000D sur le même parcours sans monter au Glacier avec un passage sur le haut de la station de Montchavin les Côches. Départ à 8h30 et arrivée à Plagne Bellecôte le samedi 28 juillet 2018.
Description in English
Starting and finishing in Plagne Bellecôte, this 27km trail race has 1600 m of elevation gain and is less demanding than the 6000D.

Course destiné au grand public (débutants, initiés, confirmés, juniors et ados) pour participer au grand week end de la 6000D. Ce parcours vous fera passer dans toutes les stations d’altitude  de la Grande Plagne en empruntant les sentiers piétons. Départ à 9h30 (nouvel horaire) et arrivée à Plagne Centre le vendredi 27 juillet 2018.
Description in English
The 6 Découverte is a race open to all (beginner to expert). The course takes you through La Plagne's altitude villages on walking paths.The race starts and finishes in Plagne Centre, covering 11km and 600 m of elevation gain. It starts on a path up to Plagne Villages, Bellecôte, the Dou du Praz plateau then goes down to Plagne Centre. You then go to the Lac Vert and up to Aime la Plagne. before coming back down to finish Plagne Centre.

La 6D Verticale est une course de côte destinée au grand public (débutants, initiés, confirmés). Cette montée sèche de 5km qui compte 1000m (D+) avec un départ de la Roche à 16h30 (nouvel horaire - village de la piste Olympique de Bobsleigh) jusqu'au sommet de la Grande Rochette (Secteur de Plagne Centre), le vendredi 27 juillet 2018.
Description in English
The 6D Verticale is a hill climb for all levels of runner (beginner, intermediate or experienced) so that everyone can participate in the great 6000D weekend.The 5 km climb with 1000 m vertical rise leaving from La Roche (Village of Olympic Bobsleigh track ) will take you up to the top of the Grande Rochette above Plagne Centre.

Description in English
Gran Trail Orobie is a trail running race of 70 km with 4200 meter of total ascent.Departing from Carona, Val Brembana (BG) and arriving in Bergamo – Città Alta with a time limit of 24 hours Date: 28th, 29th July 2018.

Marathon Trail Orobie è una gara dell'evento Orobie Ultra-Trail con uno sviluppo di 42 km con 2.300 metri di dislivello positivo.Partenza da San Pellegrino Terme, Val Brembana (BG) e arrivo a Bergamo – Città Alta con tempo massimo di percorrenza di 12 ore. Data: Sabato 27 Luglio 2019. 
Description in English
Marathon Trail Orobie is a trail running race of 42 km with 2300 meters of total ascent, part of event Orobie Ultra-Trail®.Departing from San Pellegrino Terme, Val Brembana (BG) and arriving in Bergamo – Città Alta with a time limit of 12 hours Date: Saturday 27th July 2019.

Bergamo Urban Trail è una gara con uno sviluppo di 20 km con 700 metri di dislivello positivo.Partenza da Bergamo, (BG) e arrivo a Bergamo – Città Alta con tempo massimo di percorrenza di 4 ore. 
Description in English
Bergamo Urban Trail is a trail running race of 20 km with 700 meter of total ascent.Departing from Bergamo, (BG) and arriving in Bergamo Città Alta with a time limit of 4 hours.

mundo, tal como hoje é conhecido, tem muito de Português. A sua capacidade de – por perigos e guerras esforçados, passarem além da Taprobana – levou-nos ao encontro de novos mundos. Mundos desconhecidos ao denominado Ocidente.O PT281+ Beira Baixa Portugal tem nos descobrimentos portugueses muita da sua inspiração enquanto desenho de prova. Como Pedro Álvares Cabral, também nós partiremos de Penamacor em busca de aventura e superação, numa epopeia única feita na medida dos tempos modernos. É nessas viagens, no desenvolvimento e invenção de novos caminhos e ferramentas, na coragem, espírito de conquista e capacidade de superação que se fundamentam os princípios do projeto Portugal 281+ Ultramarathon Beira Baixa Portugal.As influênciasOs resultados do atleta português Carlos Sá na Badwater, inspiraram-nos a desenvolver uma prova em condições climatéricas  similares. Em alguns locais da prova, Idanha-a-Nova  por exemplo, as temperaturas sobem muito facilmente acima dos 40º.É, no entanto, em todos aqueles que gostam de se superar que vem a maior das inspirações. A cada edição contamos acrescentar mais alguns ao curto rol de finalistas.
