A new ultra.Perhaps it’s your first ultra, perhaps you’ve done lots of them. Either way, IX Ultra will be your best running experience ever. Our 50-mile course is located in a unique landscape in the western parts of Sweden, and we’re confident when saying it’s the most beautiful ultra-race in the world. You will be running along the coastline, on everything from red-colored granite cliffs to elvish forests. Simply, the best things West Sweden has to offer – compressed into one single race.Come and experience trail running at its best. Welcome to IX Ultra.
Ultra Tour Monte Rosa 4 stage
Ultra Tour 170 km
UTMR 3 passes 100 km

AndrĂŠ Luis

Race Description:The Superior Fall Trail Races 100MI, 50MI & 26.2MI are run point-to-point on rugged, rooty, rocky, 95% single-track trail with near constant climbs and descents.  The race is held on the Superior Hiking Trail in the Sawtooth Mountains paralleling Lake Superior in Northern Minnesota / not far from the Canadian border.  The race located approximately 4 hours North of Minneapolis, Minnesota.   The Superior Fall Trail Races are very difficult / challenging races and are probably not a good choice for your first trail or ultra race (see Registration Info for qualifying requirements and lottery registration procedures). Due to their popularity, registration for the races are held via a lottery registration process which open on January 1st each year.History:The Superior 100 Mile Trail Race was founded in 1991 and is one of ten original 100 mile trail races in the United States – Western States (’74), Old Dominion (’79), Wasatch (’80), Leadville (’83), Angeles Crest (’86), Vermont (’89), Mohican (’90), Arkansas Traveller (’91) and Superior (’91) – currently there are about 160 one hundred mile races held each year in the US alone.  Superior quickly earned it’s reputation of its namesake today – Rugged, Relentless and Remote and is known as one of the tougher 100 mile trail races in the country.  Superior lives on now as one of the “legacy 100 milers” and is considered by many to be one of the most challenging, prestigious and beautiful 100 mile trail races in the country. Shortly after the inception of the 100, the Superior 50 was started and in the early 2000’s the Moose Mountain Marathon was added. None of the history or tradition of this race has been lost and is a great event for those looking for a world-class event with a low-key, old-school 100 miler feel.  The Superior Trail Race is put on by ultrarunners for ultrarunners.About the Area:The North Shore of Lake Superior runs from Duluth, Minnesota at the Southwestern end of the lake, to Thunder Bay and Nipigon, Ontario, Canada, in the North to Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, in the east. The shore is characterized by alternating rocky cliffs and cobblestone beaches, with rolling hills and ridges covered in boreal forest inland from the lake, through which scenic rivers and waterfalls descend as they flow to Lake Superior. The shoreline between the city of Duluth to the international border at Grand Portage as the North Shore.  Lake Superior is considered the largest freshwater lake in the world by surface area. It is the world’s third-largest freshwater lake by volume and the largest by volume in North America.  The Superior Hiking Trail, also known as the SHT, is a 310-mile long distance hiking single-track hiking trail in Northeastern Minnesota that follows the ridgeline overlooking Lake Superior for most of its length. The trail travels through forests of birch, aspen, pine, fir, and cedar. Hikers and runners enjoy views of boreal forests, the Sawtooth Mountains, babbling brooks, rushing waterfalls, and abundant wildlife. The lowest point on the trail is 602 feet above sea level and the highest point is 1,829 feet above sea level.

Description: Dartmoor in a Day Ultramarathon

Starts at old sugar factory surrounded by sugar cane fields, and after traversing the canefields, it leaves the flat plantation and climbs the Lion Mountain on singletrack. After a descent, returning to the factory in a 7km loop, the trail follows a magnificent series of tracks and paths through primary forest and open rolling hills, climbing and descending several times,  crossing streams and rivers to finally return to the start point.

Avec un départ au sommet du Puy-de-Dôme, ce parcours inédit est en majorité sur un profil inédit descendant "casse pâtes" jusqu’au Zénith d'Auvergne. Peu commun sur des trails, cette course présente 1700m de dénivelénégatif, un nouveau challenge pour une majorité des coureurs.Pour la première fois sur le Grand Trail de Clermont-Ferrand et en Auvergne, le départ de ce trail sera donné du Sommet du Puy-de-Dôme. Cette course n’est pas une boucle maisune liaison entre un point A à un point B. Elle traverse les deux sites auvergnats inscrits récemmentau Patrimoine mondial de l’UNESCO : la Chaine des Puys et la Faille de Limagne, ainsi que la zonetampon entre ces deux sites d’exceptions. Le tracé emprunte également les futurs parcours permanentsde trail de Clermont Auvergne Métropole.Un ravitaillement qualitatif attend les participants au château de Saint-Genès-Champanelle, futur centredédié aux sports nature.
Description in English
With a start at the top of the Puy-de-Dôme, this new course present a unique D- profile to the Zenith of Auvergne. Unusual on trails, this race has 1700m of altitude differencenegative, a new challenge for a majority of runners.For the first time on the Grand Trail of Clermont-Ferrand and Auvergne, the start of this trail will be given from the Summit of Puy-de-Dôme. This race is not a loop buta link between point A and point B. It crosses the two recently registered Auvergne sitesUNESCO World Heritage Site: the Chaîne des Puys and the Faille de Limagne,
Entry Fee: 35 € comprenant la prise en charge via navettes et trains à crémaillère du Zénith d'Auvergne (lieu d'arrivée) au Sommet du Puy-de-Dôme (lieu de départ)

Description:
Le Gergo Trail, une distance alternative permettant aux coureurs de faire le tour et l’ascension du plateau deGergovie dominant Clermont-Ferrand et présentant de nombreux points de vue sur la Chaine des Puys et la Faille de LIMAGNE classées au Patrimoine Mondial de l'UNESCO.Une course dense nécessitant un réel engagement physique sur une diversités de sentiers essentiellement techniques.
Description in English
The Gergo Trail, an alternative distance allowing runners to go around and climb the Gergovie plateau dominating Clermont-Ferrand and presenting many points of view on the Chaîne des Puys and Faille de LIMAGNE classified as World Heritage by UNESCO.A dense race requiring a real physical commitment on a variety of essentially technical trails.

Le Mardoux Trail s’adresse aux débutants ou aux traileurs trouvant plus de plaisir dans les petites distances. Il leur permet de découvrir le Puy de Mardoux, ainsi que les coteaux et le Plateau de Gergovie.
Description in English
The Mardoux Trail is for beginners or trail runners finding more pleasure in small distances. It allows them to discover the Puy de Mardoux, as well as the slopes and the Plateau de Gergovie.

Une première édition réussie pour cetrail nocturne en 2018, le GTCF souhaite reconduire ce challenge en 2019.Cette course de nuit emmène les coureurs sur le Plateau de Gergovie et ses coteaux. Elle peut s’effectuer ensolo ou en duo mais obligatoirement muni d’une frontale !
Description in English
A first successful edition for this night trail in 2018, the GTCF wishes to renew this challenge in 2019.This night race takes runners to the Gergovie Plateau and its hillsides. It can be done in solo or duet but necessarily with a frontal!
Entry Fee:
18 € en solo + frais internet
34 € en duo + frais internet

Главное беговое событие года в горах Башкирии. Живописный хребет Южного Урала - Малидак.Неповторимый маршрут, который ежегодно прокладывается заново.Более 40 километров сложности по пересеченной местности, горным тропам, курумнику и диким лесам.Технически сложный рельеф с суммарным набором высоты 1900 метров.
Description in English
he main running event of the year in the mountains of Bashkiria. The picturesque ridge of the Southern Urals - Malidak.Unique route, which is re-laid every year.More than 40 kilometers of difficulty over rough terrain, mountain trails, kurumniku and wild forests.Technically difficult terrain with a total climb of 1900 meters.

Главное беговое событие года в горах Башкирии. Живописный хребет Южного Урала - Малидак.
Description in English
The main running event of the year in the mountains of Bashkiria. The picturesque ridge of the Southern Urals - Malidak.

Дистанция "Short Hard" - забег на гору Малиновая! Забег пройдёт линейно, от стартового лагеря до вершины г.Малиновая. Протяженность маршрута 6 км, набор высоты 580 метров. Для всех, кто хотел попробовать, но не решался! 
Description in English
Distance "Short Hard" - race to the mountain Crimson!The race will be held linearly, from the starting camp to the top of Malinovaya. The length of the route is 6 km, climb 580 meters.For anyone who wanted to try, but did not dare!

Run along the river bed of the magnificent Schaap River as it meanders through a majestic canyon carved by the hands of time.Run where the shy leopard silently roam the weathered canyon walls. Run on jagged trails that guided old copper wagons up Spektakel Pass.  Run the lunar landscapes created in an ancient time when everything was a boiling pot of melted granite.Run the Schaap River Canyon Ultra!

Description:
FRANCIA Y ESPAÑA EN UNA SOLA CARRERA2 Países, 2 Valles, 2 Lenguas y 2 Culturas, en el evento estrella que une los dos valles separados por los Pirineos, pero a los que une la historia.

FRANCE & SPAIN IN A SINGLE RACE2 countries, 2 valleys, 2 cultures, in this race that links the two valleys that are separated by the Pyrenees, but that have always been joined by the history.

26 km recorriendo el fondo del Valle de Benasque y disfrutando de las vistas de los glaciares más meridionales de Europa en pleno Reino del Aneto.
Description in English
For those that would like to initiate themselves in trail running, 26 km in the valley of Benasque while enjoying the views of the glaciers closest to the Equator in Europe.

15 km recorriendo parte del histórico camino que une el Valle de Benasque con el Valle de Bagnères-de-Luchon (Francia) para introducirnos en el trail running con la posibilidad de realizarse en modalidad caminata o corriendo. 
Description in English
Run or Walk 2 Heaven
Ce challenge est réservé aux experts du trail aux ultra trailers à ceux qui peuvent enchaîner 2 épreuves en 2 jours. C'est un challenge engagé qui nécessite endurance, puissance et résistance.

Le parcours qui visite le grand Site des Deux Caps du Nord au Sud, il fait 64 km cette année.Le dernier ravitaillement complet est à Audresselles (salle des fêtes). Il y aura un ravitaillement liquide et une barrière horaire au Cap Gris Nez.Le 62 km est un trail difficile à cause de la variété des terrains, des relances et des petites montées permanentes.Les difficultés habituelles des différents monts et ses vues incroyables restent présentes  !

Le Marathon ...Cette épreuve est exigeante à souhait avec un départ plage de Wissant en direction du Cap Blanc Nez. Puis direction Saint Po pour contourner Wissant. Direction ensuite le Cap Gris Nez par les dunes de Châtelet et le Mont Aux Leux. De nombreuses zones en asphalte ont ainsi été évités, ce qui en fait un trail plus nature encore que lors de la première édition. Le tracé rejoint Audresselles (Ravito complet) après être passé au niveau du bois d'Haringzelles et ses Blockhaus de plus de 30m de haut. Le ravitaillement sera dans la salle des fêtes d'Audresselles. Les organismes de chacun vont se fatiguer avant le retour vers Wissant qui se fera par les falaises du Cap Gris Nez. Un dernier ravitaillement liquide sera proposé plage du Cap Gris Nez au KM 40.
DIFFICULTES​Goulet au Bas du Blanc NezSommet du Blanc Nez​Sommet des Noires Mottes​Sommet du Mont RôtiSommet du Mont de CoupleSommet du Mont de SombreDunes de Châtelet

Le parcours part de la plage de Wissant jusque la plage de Châtelet. Puis Montée du Mont Aux Leux puis partie plane jusqu'aux Blockhaus de Haringzelles. Ensuite direction Audresselles vers les falaises puis vers le Gris Nez. Vous longerez la mer jusqu'au Cap puis descente vers le ravitaillement à l entrée de la plage du Cap Gris Nez. Remontée vers les Falaises, pour un parcours qui vous ramène en final vers les dunes du Châtelet.Le retour se fait par de jolis sentiers tout d'abord puis par de nouvelles dunes jusque la digue de Wissant puis jusque l'arrivée sur la place.

Le top du semi marathon !Le parcours emprunte d'abord la plage puis va au sommet du Cap Blanc Nez en compagnie des trailers du 31 km. Les parcours se séparent aprés la Dover Patrol au Sommet. Vous irez ensuite au Mont Saint Hubert avec son antenne puis vous emprunterez des chemins avec des vues sur la Mer vers Calais et son trafic maritime. Ensuite le tracé vous fera découvrir le coté du Mont de Sombre par le dernier chemin naturel existant. La vue sur la Baie de Wissant est unique mais se mérite.Le ravitaillement sera au KM 14 (Ravitaillement complet)Vous contournerez ensuite Wissant par la colline des Combles et vous finirez par un peu de dunes avant de retrouver la digue de Wissant et l'arrivée...

Un parcours linéaire, authentique et rustique dans les terres sauvages du CanadaUn parcours bien balancé entre vitesse et technicité. Le départ sera donné dans l’arrière-pays sauvage de Charlevoix. Vous croiserez plusieurs lacs et aurez peut-être la chance d’observer la faune canadienne comme le castor, le porc-épic et l’orignal. Vous aurez 4 ascensions : Le mont du Lac-à-l’Empêche, le mont des Morios qui vous donnera une vue imprenable sur la région, La Noyée au profil d’une femme flottant sur l’eau et pour finir la montagne Noire dans des sentiers unique développés par l’équipe Harricana et donnant une vue sur le mont Grand-Fonds.
Description in English
A remote and authentic ultra race deep in the Canadian wildernessThe race is a perfect mix of flowing and technical terrain. The start is right in the heart of Charlevoix’s wild backcountry. Passing several lakes, runners get the chance to encounter Canadian wildlife, including beaver, porcupine or moose. Farther along, they face four ascents: Mount Lac-à-L’Empêche and Mount Morios, with their breathtaking panoramic views of the area; Noyee mountain, with its ridge shaped like a woman floating on water; and lastly, Noire mountain, on trails specially developed by the Harricana team, that provides a beautiful view of Mont Grand-Fonds.

Un parcours linéaire, authentique et rustique dans les terres sauvages du canadaUn parcours balancé entre vitesse et technicité. Le départ sera donné au parc des Hautes-Gorges. Vous croiserez plusieurs lacs et aurez peut-être la chance d’observer la faune canadienne comme l’épervier, le castor, le porc-épic et l’orignal.
Description in English
A remote and true ultra race held on a linear route deep in the Canadian wildernessA perfect mix of flow and technical. The race will get underway at the Hautes-Gorges-de-la-Rivière-Malbaie National Park and end at the Mont Grand-Fonds Ski Center. The course will take you halfway through the famous trail called La Traversée de Charlevoix. Passing several lakes, runners will have the chance to encounter Canadian wildlife, including beaver, porcupine or moose.

Offert tous les deux ans, le 42 km est présenté pour la deuxième fois à l’Ultra-Trail Harricana.Il s’agit d’un parcours balancé et relativement rapide, parfait pour ceux qui souhaitent s’initier aux longues distances. Vous croiserez plusieurs lacs et aurez peut-être la chance d’observer la faune canadienne comme l’épervier, le castor, le porc-épic et l’orignal.
Description in English
Offered every other year, the 42 km will be taking place for a second time at the 2019 Ultra-Trail Harricana. The trail strikes a balance between speed and technicality, a perfect challenge for those who want to try out a long distance for the first time. You will encounter many lakes and will maybe get the chance to cross paths with some of the local Canadian fauna such as the sparrowhawk, the beaver, the porcupine or the moose.

Une vue imprenable sur le fleuve Saint-Laurent attend les coureurs au sommet du mont Grand-Fonds.Un parcours rapide débutant directement avec l’ascension du mont Grand-Fonds, vous passerez ensuite par le sentier de l’Orignac pour vous diriger vers la montagne Noire. Nous vous attendons au chalet pour passer la ligne d’arrivée.
Description in English
A breathtaking view of the St.Lawrence river awaits as runners reach the summit of Mont Grand-Fonds. This event takes place on a fast-paced course starting with the ascent of Mont Grand-Fonds leading onto the Orignac trail toward La Montagne Noire. We’ll be waiting for you at the finish line.

http://www.skyrunning-serbia.com/
Description in English
http://www.skyrunning-serbia.com/en/

173 miles in 7 days on foot in rugged high alpine backcountry with no aid stations and no drop bags. Fully self-supported outside of water, fire, and a spot in a tent. Sound like your kind of fun? We might be your kind of crazy!$15,000 in prize money. $5,000 to the men's winner and $5,000 to the women's winner. With a twist. If a woman wins the overall, we'll add another $1,000 to her pot--she'll take home $6,000! Learn about the geology, history, and past and present culture of this part of the United States' "Old West". We want you to not just appreciate the beautiful views, but also understand a little bit about the ground on which you tread. We are all land stewards on trails, but we can be cultural stewards as well!As soon as the snow melts we will be submitting our course for UTMB points. We are already a member of ITRA.  We don't have country quotas.  Early bird pricing is in effect!

220km â 6 stages+ 8.000m / - 8.000mImagine running through cultural mysteries in unexplored nature. Experience the most undiscovered Balkan country, which was just opened for visitors a few years ago.Start the race in the World Heritage city of Berat and finish in the spectacular amphitheatre in the ancient Greek/Roman city and World Heritage Site of Butrint, which is beautifully located at the Ionian Sea.Enter a challenging race off the beaten tracks with stunning scenery.Immerge in a cultural rich country and interact with the locals.Be part of this breathtaking experience and join the first ever multi-stage race in Albania!

Description:
Il Tor des Géants è la prima ed unica gara che unisce la lunga distanza all'individualità del corridore, non sono imposte dall'organizzazione tappe forzate, vincerà chi metterà meno tempo gestendosi i riposi e le fermate ai ristori.Il Tor des Géants è la prima gara di questo genere che coinvolge una regione intera, lungo i suoi bellissimi sentieri ai piedi dei più importanti 4000 delle Alpi ed attraverso il Parco Nazionale del Gran Paradiso e quello Regionale del Mont Avic.
Description in English
The Tor des Géants is the first and only race to combine long distance with the individual style of runners: the organisation does not impose any compulsory stages, and the winner will be the runner who completes the race in the shortest time, making his or her own decisions on when and how long to stop for rest and refreshment.The Tor des Géants is the first race of this kind to cover an entire region, running along its spectacular paths at the foot of the highest Four-Thousanders in the Alps and through the Gran Paradiso Natural Park and the Mont Avic Regional Park. All of these particular features help make this such a unique, inimitable race.

Il Tot Dret è la  corsa che si affianca al più duro e affascinante trail al mondo: il Tor des Géants®.Un assaggio, e anche piuttosto consistente, degli ambienti magici che attraversa e delle sue atmosfere non replicabili. Un trail di 130 chilometri e 12 mila metri di dislivello positivo che parte da Gressoney e arriva a Courmayeur.
Description in English
The Tot Dret is the race associated with the hardest and most fascinating trail  race in the world: the Tor des Géants®.A considerable taste of the magical environments that it crosses and its inimitable atmosphere.A trail race of 130 kilometers with 12 thousand meters of ascent starting from Gressoney and ending in Courmayeur.

Corsa a piedi in ambiente naturale, con partenza da Saint-Rhémy-en-Bosses ed arrivo a Courmayeur.Percorso di 30 km con dislivello positivo di circa 2300 m.La gara si svolge in una sola tappa, velocità libera, in un tempo limitato, in regime di semi-autosufficienza.
Description in English
A foot race in natural surroundings, starting at Saint-Rhémy-en-Bosses and finishing at Courmayeur.A distance of approximately 30km with a positive altitude difference of around 2300 meters.The race is run in a single, free-speed stage within a limited time, in conditions of semi-self-sufficiency.

Le parcours commencera en empruntant un sentier, à travers bois, muré de pierre. Vous descendrez ainsi jusqu'au départ de la Via ferrata de Grand Bois et remonterai jusqu'à l'arrivée de celle-ci. Au 2.5 Km, vous passerez au travers des ruines du Château de Châtel-Montagne et continuer votre parcours jusqu'à son église mythique. Après une alternance de sous-bois, chemin, sentier vous arriverez, au 6 Km, sur un petit passage technique en sous-bois. km 10, passage à côté des ruines du Château de Montmorillon (commune d'Arfeuilles).  Le parcours continue jusqu'à la cascade de Pisserote et longe le Barbenan pour rejoindre le sommet du parcours: La croix du chat blanc. Alternance de terrains variés, de montée, parfois raide, pour atteindre le somment du parcours: le grand roc (890m). Longeant le ruisseau, Le Coindre, vous profiterez d'une immersion au cœur de la Montagne Bourbonnaise. du kilomètre 34 à 38Km, ancien chemin par lequel circulait le vin de la région. km 39, plateau avec une magnifique vue sur la chaîne des puys. Kilomètre 41, passage technique jusqu'au calvaire du Puy du Roc. Descente, par le chemin de croix, jusqu'à l'arrivée.

Race: Sur Les Pas De La Bête

Description: parcours physique , idéal pour une préparation en vue d'un objectif à court et moyen terme.
Barokomaraton is a trail running event in a picturesque Baroque area north of Pilsen. Fairly hilly single track course includes road, gravel and trail paths. Chip timing.

Le Trail des 36000 se déroule dans les Gorges de l’Ardèche, départ de Vallon-Pont d’Arc, Sud de la France36 000 c’est le nombre d’années qui nous sépare du tout premier chef d’œuvre de l’humanité découvert dans la grotte ornée du Pont d’Arc, dite Grotte Chauvet et inscrite au patrimoine mondial de l’humanité par l’UNESCO.36 000 c’est également la distance qui sépare les participants de la ligne d’arrivée se situant à la Caverne du Pont d’Arc.Le Trail des 36000 c’est aussi le tout premier Trail solidaire de l’Ardèche.Le parcours de ce trail, d’une distance de 36 000 m (environ) est l’épreuve phare de ce trail. Il se déroule sur la communauté de communes des Gorges de l’Ardèche et vous emmène sur les chemins de nos ancêtres en passant à quelques dizaines de mètres de la grotte originale.Le départ sera donné dans les ruelles de Vallon-Pont d’arc à 8 h 30.L’arrivée est jugée sur le lieu de sa réplique : la Caverne du Pont d’Arc, sur les hauteurs du village de Vallon-Pont d’Arc.Un parcours très sauvage et vallonné est proposé aux traileurs – 1100 m D+ et moins de 10 % de route – avec un point exceptionnel et atypique, la traversée de la rivière Ardèche sous le célèbre Pont d’Arc grâce à un pont de canoës spécialement aménagé pour l’occasion, passage unique au monde !Cette course est accessible à partir de la catégorie Espoir, soit pour les personnes nées en 1998 en avant.
Entry Fee:
Le TRAIL DES 36000 – 36 km – D+1330 m  : 32 € jusqu’au 8 juin, 35 € du 9 juin au mercredi 5 septembre
Inscription sur place (dans la limite des places disponibles), droits d’inscription le vendredi 7 après-midi et le samedi 8 matin : 36 €

Description: Le Trail des 36000 se déroule dans les Gorges de l’Ardèche, départ de Vallon-Pont d’Arc, Sud de la FranceLe TRAIL DES 36000 – 20 km – D+700 mLe parcours de ce trail, d’une distance de 20 km, se déroulant sur la communauté de communes des Gorges de l’Ardèche, vous emmène également sur les chemins de nos ancêtres en passant à quelques dizaines de mètres de la grotte originale.Le départ sera donné dans les ruelles de Salavas à 10 h 30.Les 3 premiers kilomètres sont exclusivement réservés à ce parcours. Puis la suite est commune à la fin du 36 km proposé sur l’épreuve phare et l’arrivée est jugée sur le lieu de sa réplique : la Caverne du Pont d’Arc, sur les hauteurs du village de Vallon-Pont d’Arc.Un parcours très sauvage et vallonné est proposé aux traileurs – 700 m de dénivelé et moins de 10 % de route – avec un point exceptionnel et atypique, la traversée de la rivière Ardèche sous le célèbre Pont d’Arc grâce à un pont de canoës spécialement aménagé pour l’occasion, passage unique au monde !Cette course est accessible à partir de la catégorie Espoir, soit pour les personnes nées en 1998 en avant.
Entry Fee:
Le TRAIL DES 36000 – 20 km – D+830 m : 22 € jusqu’au 8 juin, 24 € du 9 juin au mercredi 5 septembre
Inscription sur place (dans la limite des places disponibles), droits d’inscription le vendredi 7 après-midi et le samedi 8 matin : 25 €

Inscription papier ou internet, droits d’inscription jusqu’au mercredi 5 septembre 2018 inclus
Le TRAIL DES 36000 – 11 km – D+410 m : 12 € jusqu’au 8 juin, 14€ du 9 juin au mercredi 5 septembre

Event: Trilhas De Nova Roma Do Sul - Vi Etapa 2019
Race: Trilhas De Nova Roma Do Sul

Description:
57 km:57 km lähtöpaikka sijaitsee Valtimon kunnan puolella Rumon UKK-majalla. Reitin alkumatka on lähes täydellistä polkujuoksua erittäin hyväkulkuisessa mäntykangasmaastossa, jossa reitti kulkee hienon harjujonon päällä. Alkumatka noin 10 km kuljetaan kohtuullisen tasaisessa maastossa, jossa isoimmat nousut muodostuvat lähinnä harjun päälle kiipeämisistä. 10 km jälkeen ylitetään rautatie, jonka jälkeen alkaa reitin ensimmäinen pidempi nousuosuus kohti Maanselän etapin huoltopistettä ja 42 km lähtöpaikkaa. Tällä noin 4,5 km pitkällä yhtäjaksoisella nousuosuudella juoksijat pääsevät nauttimaan monipuolisesta kuusi- ja sekametsästä sekä muutamista kuusimetsän sisällä olevsita hyväkuntoisista pitkospuupätkistä. Nousun jälkeen on noin 1 km loiva laskuosuus Maanselän etappiin. Maanselän etapista lähtien 57 km reitti kulkee 42 km reittiä.
Description in English
57 km: 57 km starting place is located in Rumo UKK-cottage. The route goes on towards Maanselän Etappi via UKK-hiking track. In this part of the track the runner can admire magnificent several kilometers long esker on top of where the track runs. Sometimes spectacular viewpoints on top of ridges and forest hills surprise runners. Especially this part of the Vuokatti Trail Challenge radiates the spirit of wilderness and silence of forests where runner can enjoy clean and green nature. From Maanselän Etappi the route continues via 42 km route (see 42 km route description) towards the legendary 13 Hill´s area called Vuokatinvaara which is the great and extremely hard ending to 57 km track. Sceneries are amazing in this Vuokatinvaara area which will start about 23km before finish.

42 km:42km lähtöpaikka sijaitsee Maanselän etapin läheisyydessä (Valtatie 6:n länsipuolella). Maanselän Etapin jälkeen reitillä ylitetään Lappavaara ja Iso-Kuljun vaara sekä nautitaan erämaamaisemista. Alkuosassa reitillä on pätkiä, joissa polku/reitti on vähän kuljettu ja paikoin umpeen kasvanut, mutta matkan edetessä polku muuttuu paremmaksi ja maisemat yhä kauniimmiksi. Vuonna 2007 tehdyn korjaustyön jäljiltä pitkospuut ja sillat ovat muutamia poikkeuksia lukuun ottamatta vahvassa kunnossa. Välillä polku kulkee vanhassa kuusimetsässä ja tarjoaa vaihtelua juoksuympäristöön. Tällä etapilla voi törmätä myös erämaan eläimiin, kuten metsäkanalintuihin. Talvella täällä nähtiin myös suden ja karhun jälkiä. Reitti kulkee UKK-polkua pitkin Hanhilammen huoltopisteen kautta Teerivaaran kyläkoulun huoltopisteelle, josta matka jatkuu 23 km:n reittiä pitkin (kts. 23 km:n reitin kuvaus).
Description in English
42 km:The start of the Vuokatti Trail Challenge 42 km competition is located at the Maanselän Etappi and the finish is at the hotel Vuokatinhovi. The track follows UKK-hiking path and offers great scenery and beautiful wilderness with old boreal forests. Shortly after the Maanselän Etappi there is a long uphill as the track goes over Lappavaara hill area. After that the track is rather even and there are no big climbs before Teerivaara. The condition of the UKK-hiking path gets better in this part of the track and the duckboards and bridges are generally in good condition. The path is also good and easy to run. Wildlife can be seen throughout the Vuokatti Trail Challenge track for example grouse birds like black grouse and capercaillie. After Teerivaara the competition route is the same as the 22 km route (see 22 km route description) and it will lead the runners towards the legendary 13 Hill´s area called Vuokatinvaara which is the great and very hard ending to 42 km track. Sceneries are amazing in this Vuokatinvaara area which will start about 22km before finish.

22 km:Reitin lähtö on Teerivaaran vanhalta kyläkoululta ja maali Vuokatin Urheiluopistolla. Reitti myötäilee UKK-reittiä ja kulkee yhteensä 13 suuren vaaran yli tarjoten juoksijalle huikeita vaara-, metsä- ja järvimaisemia. Reitti on ensimmäisiä kilometrejä lukuun ottamatta sama kuin aiemmassa 13 Vaaran Maastomaratonissa sekä perinteisessä 20 km:n Vuokatin Vaelluksessa. Reitin nousut ja laskut ovat paikoitellen erittäin jyrkkiä sekä kivikkoisia, mikä tekee kiipeämisestä haasteellista. Varsinkin märällä kelillä ja väsyneillä jaloilla vaarojen rinteillä kannattaa olla varovainen. Korkeuseroiltaan ja kokonaisnousultaan reitti on vaativa ja tarjoaa varmasti itsensä voittamisen elämyksiä! Varsinkin viimeiset 12 km vievät voimat kovimmastakin tossun kuluttajasta, mikäli vauhdin jako ei ole mennyt aivan nappiin… Kova työ kuitenkin palkitaan henkeäsalpaavan komeilla näköaloilla, joita riittää lukuisten vaarojen päältä. Polku on paljon kuljettua ja leveää sekä monipuolista. Reitille mahtuu pitkospuita ja portaita, kivikkoa ja kalliota, lyhyitä pätkiä metsäautotietä sekä viiden tähden polkua. Vaikka reitti on paikoin erittäin tekninen, niin suurimmalta osin se on kuitenkin hyvin juostavaa. Tämä reitti on ehdottomasti Trail Challengen hienoin pätkä niin polun laadulta kuin maisemienkin puolesta.
Description in English
22 km:The start is located at an old school in Teerivaara and the finish is at Vuokatti Sport Institute. The track follows UKK- hiking route and goes over total of 13 large hills or ‘vaara’ as called in Finnish. The track offers outstanding hill, forest and lake sights for runners. Total height difference is about 960 meters and some of the climbs and descends are very steep and rocky, which makes the run very technical and challenging. Runners should be careful on the hill sides especially in wet conditions. As the route is very demanding especially in the last 13 kilometers it is sure to offer unforgettable experiences when overcoming the challenges. However, the hard work is rewarded with superb sights at the top of the numerous hills. The track is very versatile. It’s mostly wide and clean path but there’s also duckboards and stairs, rocks and rocky areas as well as short parts of sand roads. Despite the very technical parts, the track is generally well runnable. This route is by far the most stunning and awe-inspiring part of the Vuokatti Trail Challenge.
English

Маршрут гонки будет проходить по уникальному историческому ландшафту, включающему в себя несколько древних памятников истории Кандалакши.Участникам предстоит покорять гору Крестовую, получившую свое название еще при поморах, после того, как на ней был установлен крест как символ установления христианской религии. Именно с высоты горы Крестовой участникам откроется потрясающая панорама на бухту Кандалакшского залива Белого моря.Основная же часть пути будет пролегать вдоль прибрежной полосы. Эта часть трассы называется «экотропой» и является излюбленным маршрутом для многих туристов и гостей города, так как ведет напрямую к одному из древнейших археологических памятников России – каменному лабиринту «Вавилон», датируемому II тысячелетием до нашей эры. Несмотря на обустроенность, экотропа как и вся дистанция не даст вам расслабиться ни на секунду, переходя из комфортной утоптанной лесной дорожки в наполненную камнями и корнями узкую горную тропку, выводящую вас прямо на скалы к обрыву. Трасса будет наполнена нешуточными подъемами и каменистыми спусками. Тем не менее мы постарались проложить маршрут таким образом, чтобы каждому из участников подарить неизгладимые впечатления не только от спортивной составляющей, но и от созерцания великолепия северной природы.
Description in English
The route of the race will pass through a unique historical landscape, which includes several ancient monuments of Kandalaksha history.The participants will have to conquer Mount Krestovaya, which received its name even under Pomors, after it was crossed as a symbol of the establishment of the Christian religion. It is from the height of Mount Krestovaya that the participants will have a stunning panorama of the bay of the Kandalaksha Gulf of the White Sea. The main part of the road will run along the coastal strip. This part of the route is called "eco-path" and is a favorite route for many tourists and visitors of the city, as it leads directly to one of the oldest archaeological monuments of Russia - the stone labyrinth "Babylon", dated to the II millennium BC. Despite the arrangement, the ecotope, like the whole distance, will not let you relax for a second, passing from a comfortable trampled forest path to a narrow mountain path, which is filled with rocks and roots, which leads you straight to the cliffs to the cliff. The track will be filled with serious jumps and rocky descents. Nevertheless, we tried to lay the route in such a way that each of the participants will give an indelible impression not only on the sports component, but also on the contemplation of the splendor of the northern nature.

La Bocineros-Deiadar Xtreme es una ultra trail en formato 'non stop' de 200 kilómetros de distancia y 22.000 metros de desnivel acumulado (11.000 positivos y 11.000 negativos) que recorre toda Bizkaia uniendo los conocidos como Montes Bocineros (Ganekogorta, Gorbeia, Kolitza, Oiz y Sollube).Organizada por el club Trail 52 Sport Mendi Kluba, esta prueba inédita (es la primera que se disputa en este formato en España sobre 200 kilómetros) con salida y meta en Gernika, a los pies mismos del legendario Árbol de Gernika, hunde sus raíces en la Historia de Bizkaia. Nace como homenaje a la mítica llamada a las Juntas Generales de Bizkaia que se realizaba en la Edad Media mediante el sonar de bocinas naturales (cuernos, caracolas...) desde las cimas de los 5 Montes Bocineros, estratégicamente repartidos a lo largo y ancho del Territorio Histórico de Bizkaia.La Bocineros-Deiadar Xtreme es una oportunidad única de conocer Bizkaia desde una perspectiva singular, corriendo y/o caminando día y noche durante 200 kilómetros en un recorrido que discurre por 32 municipios (casi un tercio de los 112 que integran Bizkaia), 10 sierras y macizos de montaña, 25 cumbres y 2 parque naturales.Además de tener Gernika como punto de inicio y final de la carrera, la prueba tiene 18 puntos de avituallamiento, dos de ellos Bases de Vida: Balmaseda (km. 90) y Urkiola (km. 163). 
Description in English
The Bocineros-Deiadar Xtreme is an ultra trail in a 'non stop' format of 200 kilometers distance and 22,000 meters of cumulative altitude (11,000 positives and 11,000 negatives) that runs throughout Bizkaia joining the well-known Montes Bocineros (Ganekogorta, Gorbeia, Kolitza, Oiz and Sollube).Organized by the Club Trail 52 Sport Mendi Kluba, this unprecedented event (it is the first one that is played in this format in Spain over 200 kilometers) with exit and finish in Gernika, at the very foot of the legendary Gernika Tree, has its roots in the History of Bizkaia. It was born as a tribute to the mythical call to the General Meetings of Biscay that was held in the Middle Ages through the sounding of natural horns (horns, conches ...) from the tops of the 5 Montes Bocineros, strategically distributed far and wide of the Historical Territory of Bizkaia.La Bocineros-Deiadar Xtreme is a unique opportunity to get to know Bizkaia from a singular perspective, running and / or walking day and night for 200 kilometers on a route that runs through 32 municipalities (almost a third of the 112 that make up Bizkaia), 10 mountain ranges and mountain massifs, 25 summits and 2 natural parks.In addition to having Gernika as the starting and finishing point of the race, the test has 18 refreshment points, two of them Bases de Vida: Balmaseda (km 90) and Urkiola (km 163).

La Deiadar Ultra tiene 100 kilómetros de longitud y 5.300 de desnivel positivo. Recorre las comarcas de Busturialdea y Lea-Artibai en el entorno de la Reserva de la Biosfera de Urdaibai (Unesco). Asciende los Montes Bocineros de Sollube y Oiz y discurre por bosques, prados y roquedos con vistas al mar Cantábrico y por el corazón la Reserva de la Biosfera de  Urdaibai (Unesco).
Description in English
379/5000The Deiadar Ultra is 100 kilometers long and has a positive height of 5,300 kilometers. It goes through the regions of Busturialdea and Lea-Artibai in the surroundings of the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve (Unesco). It ascends the Montes Bocineros de Sollube and Oiz and runs through forests, meadows and rocks with views of the Cantabrian Sea and through the heart of the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve (Unesco).

La Deiadar Maratoia recorre la margen izquierda de la Ría de Urdaibai en un recorrido montañero con vistas al mar Cantábrico y a la Reserva de la Biosfera de Urdaibai que asciende, entre otros, el Monte Bocinero de Sollube. Con salida y llegada en Gernika, tiene 42 kilómetros de longitud y un desnivel de 2.200 metros positivos y 2.200 metros negativos.
Description in English
The Deiadar Maratoia runs along the left bank of the Ria de Urdaibai on a mountaineering route with views of the Cantabrian Sea and the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve that ascends, among others, the Monte Bocinero de Sollube. With departure and arrival in Gernika, it has 42 kilometers long and a elevation gain of 2,200 meters positive and elevation loss of 2,200 meters.

The race covers roughly 100 miles, climbing the Rim in four separate locations spending a lot of miles along the Rim, on top of the Rim and the challenging climbs up and down with climbs and descents at 30-45% grades at a some points. Expect to climb a total of approximately 22,000 feet along the way, never below 5,200 feet and never above 8,000 feet in elevation.  While other races are certainly at higher elevations, and/or with more climbing, they certainly do not contain as rugged a terrain that is found on this course.This is a VERY technical course in many areas, specifically the Highline Trail, Donahue and the soon to be revered, Myrtle Trail.  This is one of the most technical 100 milers in North America.  That coupled with the terrain, moderate elevation, and intense Arizona sun, this race will certainly take its toll on each runner.

WELCOME TO THE SURF COAST CENTURY -  A spectacular 50km and 100km ultramarathon along Victoriaâs Surf Coast and wildflower hinterland with beautiful scenery the whole way.This incredible race takes runners on an extraordinary journey below towering sea cliffs, along remote beaches and through the captivating wildflower hinterland on twisting single track where no two footsteps are the same.As well as attracting many of Australiaâs best runners, the Surf Coast Century also has a great reputation as the ideal event for those tackling their first ultra marathon due to the accessible course, terrific support services, easy logistics and the incredible energy around the course generated by all the supporters, other runners and event officials.So set yourself the ultimate challenge and join us for the 2019 Surf Coast Century for an unforgettable experience.

Trail Running  ist der aktuelle Trend im Ausdauersport. Eine vergleichbare Veranstaltung hat es in Ostösterreich, vor den Toren Wiens mit Start und Ziel am Hauptplatz in Purkersdorf, noch nie gegeben. Mit der Raiffeisenbank Wienerwald ist es uns wieder gelungen, einen regionalen Hauptsponsor für unser Trailfestival zu gewinnen. Für 2019 werden wir einige Änderungen vornehmen und Verbesserungen umsetzen. Wir wollen diese Veranstaltung weiter international etablieren, immerhin waren bei der Erstaustragung 20 Nationen am Start.  Es wurden auch wieder Kontakte mit dem Vorstand der „ATRA“ (Austrian Trail  Running  Association) geknüpft und es finden 2019 die österreichischen Meisterschaften im Endurance-Trail statt. Darüber hinaus ist diese Veranstaltung auch Station des österreichischen Trail-Running-Cups 2019.
Description in English
Trail running is the current trend in endurance sports. There has never been a comparable event in Austria before the gates of Vienna with start and finish at the main square in Purkersdorf. With the Raiffeisenbank Wienerwald we have again managed to win a regional main sponsor for our trail festival. For 2019 we will make some changes and implement improvements. We want to further establish this event internationally, after all, 20 nations were at the start in the first edition. Again, contacts were made with the board of the "ATRA" (Austrian Trail Running Association) and 2019 we have the honour to organize the Austrian Championships in Endurance Trail. In addition, this event is also the station of the Austrian Trail Running Cup 2019.
Entry Fee:
Until April 30, 2019 € 120,- (incl. T-Shirt)
Until 31.07.2019 € 140,-
Until 12.09.2019 € 160,- 
Nomination fee before the race € 180,-

2019 arrangeras Risveden Terräng för nionde gången. Loppet betraktas sedan starten 2011 som ett av Västsveriges största, brantaste och mest trivsamma terränglopp. Risveden Terräng är känt för sina backar, sjöar och gåtfulla natur i naturreservaten Risveden och Rammdalen. Loppets alldeles egen vägg, Klevsjöloft, har en stigning på 28,6 procent och tvingar den mest vältränade att ta i lite extra.
Description in English
2019, Risveden Terrain is arranged for the ninth time. Since the start, the race is regarded as one of West Sweden's largest, steepest and most pleasant terrain races. Risveden Terräng is known for its slopes, lakes and enigmatic nature in the nature reserves of Risveden and Rammdalen. The race's very own wall, Klevsjöloft, has a rise of 28.6 percent and forces the most trained to take in a little extra.
Golden Ultra's new 120 km ultramarathon event.

The 100km Gold Ultra route is the ultimate Peak District Challenge, and should be attempted by fit and experienced trekkers or runners who want to see the best that the Peak District has to offer. Youâll visit high points and viewpoints on your way between checkpoints, and there is a lot of climbing involved. The route: Detailed route information is be provided to entrants seven days before the event, but a broad overview of the provisional route is at peak-district-challenge.com.

This is a seriously tough ultra marathon that covers every type of terrain the area has to offer. After running down into the Ban Ho area and along the Nam Cang River you will climb to the My Son village of the small mountain tribe of Xa Pho.  After an extremely challenging climb you will reach the end of the hard 30km loop and join the VMM 70 route. Very soon you will experience sunrise running on the edge of the extremely beautiful and remote rice terraces following a river running from Fansipan mountain, the highest peak of Indochina.After crossing the river the running is less challenging for a while, but at the end of the valley there is a seriously hard and long climb up through rice fields to CP3. New for 2019, you will then continue to ascend on beautiful trail to the new highest point on the course at around 2,300m. In good weather you will have stunning panoramic views of the mountains here. After descending with more amazing views to Ta Phin (CP4) you will head onto more new trail on your way to CP6 where you will meet up with the 21k runners for yet more updated trail with awesome valley and rice paddy views.  After CP7 the infamous Silverstone climb on steep trail awaits, but your reward is one of the best vistas of the course. Then itâs time for the final hard downhill and the race to the finish line and the warm welcome from other mountain runners at Topas Ecolodge, located on a beautiful hilltop. Here you can relax and enjoy the feeling of triumph!

This is an extremely hard ultra-trail marathon covering all types of landscapes of the mountain range. After a flat start you descend in darkness down into a beautiful valley, across a river running from Fansipan, through rice paddies and into a small village and CP1.  At the end of the valley comes a seriously hard and long climb up through rice fields to CP3. New for 2019, you will then continue to climb up on beautiful trail to the new highest point on the course at around 2,300m. In good weather you will have stunning panoramic views of the mountains here. After descending with more amazing views to Ta Phin (CP4) you will head onto more new trail on your way to CP6 where you will meet up with the 21k runners for yet more updated trail with awesome valley and rice paddy views.After CP7 the infamous Silverstone climb on steep trail awaits, but your reward at the top is one of the best vistas of the course. Then itâs time for the final hard downhill and the race to the finish line and the stunning welcome from the other runners at Topas Ecolodge, located on a beautiful hilltop. Here you can relax and enjoy the feeling of triumph together with all the other mountain runners!

This is a very hard but stunning Mountain Marathon for the experienced runner who is looking for a tough challenge. The trails will lead you off the beaten track to areas which are rarely visited by anyone but locals. First you will warm up by running uphill a few kilometers on a remote asphalt road before heading onto a new uphill trail section for 2019. You will pass through some farmland and rose gardens before gaining serious altitude on trails at around 2,300m. In good weather you will have stunning panoramic views of the mountains, including Fansipan. You will also be looking down at Vietnamâs highest road pass way, way beneath you! After descending on trail with amazing rice terrace views to Ta Phin (CP4) you will head onto more new trail on your way to CP6 where you will meet up with the 21k runners. Here you will experience yet more updated trail with incredible valley and rice paddy views.  After CP7 the infamous Silverstone climb on steep trail awaits, but your reward at the top is one of the best vistas of the course. Then itâs time for the final hard downhill and the race to the finish line and the stunning welcome from the other runners at Topas Ecolodge, located on a beautiful hilltop. Here you can relax and enjoy the feeling of triumph together with all the other mountain runners.Expect your will be about double compared to a flat race. Therefore you must bring water and extra energy. If you are still racing at 5:30 PM and do not have a headlamp, you will be cut off

Event: Dalian Xijiao National Forest Park International Trail Running 2019
Description:
大连西郊国家森林公园国际山地越野赛由大连西城国际旅游商务区管委会主办的户外体育赛事。赛事定于2019年9月21日在大连西郊国家森林公园举行，并设置15KM，30KM和50KM三个组别项目。大连西郊国家森林公园位于大连市甘井子区西城国际旅游商务区行政区划内，是2006年国家森林部批准设立的国家森林公园，是一个以生态养生，郊野娱乐，休闲度假和康体运动为主题的城市生态旅游度假区
Description in English
 Xijiao Trail Running will be held in Western Suburbs National forest park,Dalian,China,on september 21 2019.There are 3 race of 15KM ,30KM,50KM for 2019 even

Il Delicious Trail Dolomiti è una gara di trail  che si svolge in uno dei luoghi più belli a livello naturalistico e ricchi di storia di Cortina d'Ampezzo.Il percorso di circa 44 km e 3250 d+ si snoda tra Cortina, Pocol, Croda Da Lago, 5 Torri, Nuvolau, Lagazuoi e Passo Falzarego, e attraversa i musei all'aperto del più esteso museo della Grande Guerra combattuta in alta quota delle Dolomiti. Nello specifico: i musei all'aperto delle 5 Torri e del Lagazuoi e la galleria di mina del Lagazuoi. Su queste montagne infatti fu combattuta una guerra incredibile tra l'esercito italiano e austro-ungarico.
Description in English
The Delicious Trail Dolomiti is a trail race that is due to take place in one of Cortina d’Ampezzo's most beautiful and historically significant nature spots.The roughly 44 km 3250 d+ trail winds around Cortina, Pocol, Croda Da Lago, 5 Torri, Nuvolau, Lagazuoi and the Falzarego Pass, passing through the open air museums of the largest Great War Museum testifying to the combat seen high up in the Dolomites: the 5 Torri and Lagazuoi open-air museums and the Lagazuoi mine tunnel. The war fought in these mountains between the Italian and Austro-Hungarian armies was indeed an incredible event.

La Short Delicious Trail Dolomiti è una corsa a piedi lungo i sentieri delle Dolomiti Patrimonio dell’Umanità, di circa 23 km con 1300 metri di dislivello positivo, con partenza sabato 22 settembre alle ore10.00; tempo massimo: 8 ore
Description in English
The Short Delicious Trail Dolomiti is a running race along the paths of the Dolomites UNESCO Heritage Site of around 23 km. with a positive difference in altitude of 1300 metres; the start is on Saturday 22nd September at 10 a.m., with a time limit of 8 hours.

96km (60 miles) and 3222mt (10,570 ft) of ascent it is one of the toughest races in the UK, certainly in the UK. That said there are views to admire, plus some of the best running terrain you'll find.  The event starts and finishes at Whirlow Farm Hall in Sheffield, where there will be camping available Friday night (at a cost of £5 per tent, must be booked in advance). Toilets and changing facilities are available on site, and there will be food and drink available to purchase. There is plenty of parking available on site.The route will be marked in places but navigation/a good knowledge of the area will be necessary. Sport ident dibbing stations will be in place along the route, each of which must be visited, along with the manned aid stations. There are penalties in place for missing checkpoints – see the main website for details.The Trail Ultra:Peak District 21st September, 2019, Start time: 6am

Odkrijte čudovit alpski svet in raziščite še neodkrite kotičke v okolici Kranjske Gore.Kranjska Gora z okolico ponuja vse tisto, kar trail tek predstavlja – gorske poti, kjer se prepletajo lažji in bolj tekaški tereni, vmes pa nas preseneti tudi kakšen bolj tehničen predel. Med gorami se vijejo mnoge alpske doline, ki jih boste prav tako lahko izkusili na Kranjska Gora trail teku.Za tiste bolj izkušene tekače predstavljamo 30 ali 60-kilometrsko traso, ki vas ne bo pustila ravnodušnih. Včasih boste brez sape ostali zaradi težkega terena, spet drugič zaradi čudovitih razgledov. Vsi tisti, ki se s trail tekom bolj šele spoznavate, pa boste lahko uživali na 10 ali 15-kilometrski trasi, kjer bodo tereni manj tehnično zahtevni, vendar bodo vseeno ponudili nekaj tistega, kar mnoge popelje iz ceste v trail tek.
Description in English
Discover the magnificent world of high mountains in the Alps and explore hidden gems around Kranjska Gora.The city of Kranjska Gora and its surroundings offer everything that trail running stands for – mountain paths, where easy and runnable terrains intertwine and sometimes surprise you with more technical ones. But not only that – you’ll also be able to experience many stunning alpine valleys during your run at Kranjska Gora Trail.We offer 30 and 60 km distances for more experienced runners, which for sure won’t leave you indifferent. Sometimes your breath will be taken due to tough terrain, and another time due to stunning views. All those still getting to know trail running, will be able to enjoy the 10 and 15 km races, where terrains are less difficult, but still offer a pinch of what makes people fall in love with trail running.

Den vestlige del af Thy er et område, der er formet af århundreders sandflugt og rummer i dag store nationale og internationale natur- og landskabsværdier i form af kyst, klitter, klitheder, søer og klitplantager. Området er karaktereiseret af uberørte heder, vindomsuste vidder, store rene søer og  plantagernes stilhed.Cold Hawaii Ultra fremviser noget af den smukkeste og mest unikke natur i Danmark med en helt særlig kulturhistorie tilknyttet det barske landskab. Du vil under hele løbet bevæge dig ad Vestkyststien fra Bulbjerg til Agger, der primært følger den gamle Redningsvej, men som samtidig bringer jer ind på andre småstier i klitterne, ned på stranden, ind i plantagernes bjergfyr og gennem nogle af de små fiskersamfund, hvor kutterne stadig bliver trukket op på stranden.
Description in English
Cold Hawaii Ultra is an exceptional A to B trail running experience exposing some of the most unique and deserted nature experiences in Denmark. The route goes through Denmarks first and oldest national park "Nationalpark Thy" and "Cold Hawaii" - the surfers' paradise.

Description:
Desde el 2014. Se corre en las montañas de Lima, en la provincia de Huarochirí en los distritos de San Pedro de Casta y Huachupampa. El recorrido comprende caminos rurales , caminos pre-hispánicos , restos arqueológicos y la meseta de Marcahuasi. Evento organizado por personas que practican los deportes de montaña por casi 25 años.
Description in English
Since 2014. It runs in the mountains of Lima, in the province of Huarochirí in the districts of San Pedro de Casta and Huachupampa. The route includes rural roads, pre-Hispanic roads, archaeological remains and the plateau of Marcahuasi. Event organized by people who practice mountain sports for almost 25 years.
Entry Fee: Desde 30$ a 60$ depende de la fecha inscripción. / From 30$ to 60$ depends on the registration date.

Description: La carrera sale desde la Plaza de Torla, ya solo iniciar la salida, tendremos la primera rampa de unos 200 metros de desnivel, desde donde ya tendremos a nuestros pies a Torla . Nos dirigiremos hacia el norte por un camino cómodo hasta contactar con el GR-11, que nos llevará por el impresionante valle de Bujaruelo junto al río Ara, pasando por el refugio de Bujaruelo donde tendremos el primer avituallamiento. Empezaremos una larga subida por un sendero cómodo hasta el ibon de Bermatuara, en ese momento cruzaremos la frontera para entrar en Francia. Empezaremos un cómodo descenso hacia Barrage de Ossoue, atravesando bonitos prados y pasando por la cabaña de Lourdes. En Barrage de Ossoue contaremos con el segundo avituallamiento de la carrera, desde ese lugar podremos disfrutar de las vistas del Vignemale. Pasado el avituallamiento iniciaremos un largo ascenso pero muy cómodo hacia la Hourquette d'Ossoue (2730), seguiremos con uno de los senderos mas bonitos de toda la carrera, disfrutando a nuestra izquierda de la cara norte del Vignemale y de sus glaciares, pero también sera un descenso algo técnico contando con bastante bloque de piedra. Terminaremos el descenso en el refugio Oulette de Gaube. Desde donde podremos contemplar la cara norte del Vignemale en su máximo esplendor. Iniciaremos la subida hacia el Puerto de los Mulos una subida corta pero bastante duro, con sendero que terminara en una pedrera. Una vez en el Puerto de los Mulos pasaremos a España donde empezaremos un largo sendero por todo el valle del Ara hasta llegar al tercer avituallamiento y base de vida, Cabaña de Ordiso.Entraremos en un valle precioso llamado “Valle de Ordiso” que iremos remontando hasta llegar a la Peña de Ordiso 2317mts, la primera cima de la carrera. Desde ahí corriendo por la cresta nos dirigiremos hacia el Collado de Ordiso, teniendo a nuestros pies el Valle de Otal. Realizando una travesía por la ladera sur del Valle iremos ganando altura hasta llegar al Collado de Tendeñera, ganando altura por un terreno pedregoso llegaremos al punto mas alto de la carrera 2835mts. Desde ese punto iniciaremos un descenso vertical hacia la Cabaña de las Planas,al norte de Linas de Broto. Un descenso en la primera parte de terreno rocoso, una vez llegados a la cabaña, “avituallamiento 4”, se iniciará la última subida bastante dura y fuera de sendero por praderas, hasta llegar a la cima de Tozal de Comas 2319mts y siguiendo por su loma llegaremos a la última cima de la carrera, Mondeniero 2295mts e iniciando un largo descenso cómodo, los corredores llegarán a Torla pasando a 4km de meta por el último avituallamiento.

La carrera sale desde la Plaza de Torla, ya solo iniciar la salida, tendremos la primera rampa de unos 200 metros de desnivel, desde donde ya tendremos a nuestros pies a Torla y al fondo podremos disfrutar de las Murallas de Ordesa, encabezadas por el impresionante pico Mondarruego. Nos dirigiremos hacia el norte por un camino cómodo hasta contactar con el GR-11, que nos llevará por el impresionante valle de Bujaruelo junto al río Ara, pasando por el refugio de Bujaruelo hasta llegar al primer avituallamiento de la carrera “Cabaña de Ordiso” km 15,6. Hasta este punto habremos tenido una carrera rápida, con pistas y senderos sin apenas desnivel. Es en este momento cuando la carrera dará un giro y pasará a ser una carrera muy montañera, entraremos en un valle precioso llamado “Valle de Ordiso” que iremos remontando hasta llegar a la Peña de Ordiso 2317mts, la primera cima de la carrera. Desde ahí corriendo por la cresta nos dirigiremos hacia el Collado de Ordiso, teniendo a nuestros pies el Valle de Otal. Realizando una travesía por la ladera sur del Valle iremos ganando altura hasta llegar al Collado de Tendeñera, ganando altura por un terreno pedregoso llegaremos al punto mas alto de la carrera 2835mts. Desde ese punto iniciaremos un descenso vertical hacia la Cabaña de las Planas,al norte de Linas de Broto. Un descenso en la primera parte de terreno rocoso, una vez llegados a la cabaña, “avituallamiento 2”, se iniciará la última subida bastante dura y fuera de sendero por praderas, hasta llegar a la cima de Tozal de Comas 2319mts y siguiendo por su loma llegaremos a la última cima de la carrera, Mondeniero 2295mts e iniciando un largo descenso cómodo, los corredores llegarán a Torla pasando a 4km de meta por el último avituallamiento.

Preciosa carrera de 22km, con un desnivel que asusta de verdad.La salida tendrá lugar en la Plaza Aragón de Torla-Ordesa, nada mas empezar la carrera, empezaremos a subir 200mts de desnivel hasta llegar a un alto desde donde podremos gozar de una preciosa vista de Torla-Ordesa. Posteriormente y durante 6km, la carrera tendrá un carácter mas corredor, luego empezará una larga subida por dentro de un impresionante bosque, superando el Collado del Cebollar hasta llegar a las antenas del valle, cota 1900mts y primer avituallamiento. Lasubida continuará hasta llegar al Tozal de Comas, con una altura de mas de 2300mts y desde donde gozar de una de las mejores vistas del Pirineo, Monte Perdido, Macizo del Vignemale, Tendeñera…seguiremos corriendo por la aristahasta llegar al Pico de Mondiciero, donde empezará una larga bajada hasta Torla-Ordesa pasando por el último avituallamiento a 5km de meta. Entraremos por la parte lta de Torla-Ordesa recorriendo sus empinadas y estrechas calles hasta situarnos de  nuevo en la Plaza Aragon, lugar de salida/meta de todas las carreras de la  OS FORATOS DE LOMENÁS.

Ova utrka je ograničena na 10 sati. Staza kreće iz stare jezgre grada i prolazi pored svih kulturno-historijskih znamenitosti zbog kojih Sarajevo krasi atribut Europskog Jerusalema. Po izlasku iz grada, krivudajući sarajevskim sokacima i mahalama izlazi na čuveni vidikovac koji oduzima dah, Zmajevac. Ovdje staza ulazi u prelijepa bosanskabrda i planine, gdje se sreće sa draguljem jugoistočne Europe. Jedinstvenim Skakavacem.
Description in English
This race starts from the centre of the city and passes through cultural and historicalmonuments, thanks to which Sarajevo is considered the “European Jerusalem”. After passing the streetsof Sarajevo, the track continues across Zmajevac, the breathtaking viewpoint. In the protectedmonument of nature “Skakavac”, named after the 98 metre high gem of south-eastern Europe, all trackscome together in one and continue towards the Finish line that is situated in the beautiful naturalenvironment.

Na ovoj stazi osjetit ćete prave čari i iskušenja trail trčanja. Start utrke je na prelijepom sarajevskom izletištu Čavljak na 1250 metara nadmorske visine. Ovaj vidikovac se nalazi na 9 kilometara od Baščaršije, odakle mami jedinstveni pogled na Šeher. Preko sarajevskog Ozrena, Crepoljskog i Bukovika staza ulazi u zaštićeno prirodno područje, a cijelim svojim putem prolazi kroz predjele koji plijene svojom ljepotom. Na ovoj dionici sasvim je normalno da se i sredinom ljeta u malom vremenskom razmaku izmijene sva četiri godišnja doba. Dolaskom na Uževicu spaja se sa drugom stazom i prolazi pored vodopada Skakavac.
Description in English
On this course you will feel real charms and temptations of trail running. The start is at the beautiful Sarajevo resort of Čavljak at 1250 meters above sea level. This viewpoint is located at 9 kilometers from Baščaršija, with enticing unique view of Šeher. Over the Sarajevo Ozren, Crepoljsko and Bukovik peaks, trail course enters the protected natural area, and all along the way passing through the areas of eye-catching beauty. On this part of the course, it is quite normal, in mid-summer, to have all four seasons exchange in a very short period of time. Upon arrival at Uževica, it joins the other course and follows the path near waterfall Skakavac.

Start ove utrke je na Uževici, kod planinske kolibe “Promaja”. Staza prolazi kroz zaštićeno područje spomenika prirode. Nakon što prođe pored ljepotana silazi u Perački potok, odakle se penje u jedno od rijetkih staništa bosanskog mede, na vrh planine Motka, te preko Crnog vrha ide prema cilju koji je u Gornjoj Jošanici. Staza nije za podcjeniti, ali je u svakom slučaju odmor za oči i dušu.
Description in English
The trail course passes through the protected area of natural monuments. After passing the waterfall, the course descends to Perački creek. From there it goes up in one of the few habitats of Bosnian bear, to the mountain top Motka, and over the top of Crni vrh to the finish line, which is in Gornja Jošanica. The course should not be underestimated, but in any case, it represents a rest for the eyes and soul.
Stupa to Stupa 54 km
Stupa to Stupa 34 km

Il Trail delle Grigne Sud, quest’anno alla sua terza edizione, porterà i runners alla scoperta della maestosità del versante meridionale delle Grigne.È sorta così nel 2017 una rete organizzativa che ha coinvolto diverse realtà locali, la Polisportiva di Mandello del Lario, il CAI Grigne, ilGruppo Amici di Luzzeno, a cui si è aggiunto il supporto del Consorzio dell’Alpe di Era, la Protezione Civile, l’Antincendio e l’ANA, oltre a tutti gli sponsor e i main sponsor Affari&Sport e Pro-meet, e il 30 settembre2018 il Trail Grigne Sud ha svolto la sua prima edizione.A una prima occhiata sulla carta, i 41 chilometri del TGS Extreme potrebbero essere sottovalutati, sollecitando l’idea di un percorso abbastanza veloce. I 3800 metri di dislivello positivo, però, fanno la differenza e collocano la gara tra i percorsi in puro spirito trail alpino: ore e ore sulle gambe su e giù tra i monti. L’allenamento non basta, fondamentale è saper gestire le proprie risorse per tutta la lunghezza della gara.Il percorso nel dettaglio.Il TGS EXTREME si snoda quasi interamente su sentieri di montagna per una lunghezza di 41 chilometri e ben 3800 metri di dislivello. Dopo aver lasciato la piazza di Mandello del Lario (225 m) e aver proseguito verso la frazione di Somana, il percorso si arrampica subito nel bosco per la prima importante salita fino allo Zucco Sileggio (1304 m – 7,5 km). Da qui, un po' scendendo, ma soprattutto ancora salendo, si prosegue fino a raggiungere la cima del Monte Pilastro, e la quota massima del percorso (1786 m), e si scende alla Bocchetta di Prada. Un traverso in costa, tutto da correre, porta al rifugio Bietti-Buzzi (1700 m – 15 km). Da qui, una discesa nel bosco di faggi conduce dritti all'Alpe Calivazzo, quindi a Era Bassa (872 m – 20 km), dov'è situato il primo cancello orario a 5 ore e mezza dalla partenza. Incomincia la seconda salita che, progressivamente, porta al Rifugio Elisa (1500 m – 25 km). Si scende fino in Gardata (1064 m) e si traversa per raggiungere la località di Versarico (793 m – 30 km), dov'è fissato il secondo cancello orario a 9 ore. Qui inizia la salita l'ultima verso la vetta: lo Zucco di Manavello (1144 m – 32,5 km). La discesa finale, ripida nella prima parte e più corribile dopo, chiude l'arco fino a Mandello del Lario.Tempo massimo: 11 ore.La prima edizione si è svolta il 30 settembre 2017. Al TGS Extreme hanno partecipato 178 atleti, mentre al TGS Sprint 200. Sono stati premiati i primi 5 classificati uomini e donne. Ha dominato il campione tedesco Stephan Hugenschmidt con il tempo di 4 ore e 27 minuti. Mattia Gianola ha concluso in seconda posizione con 4 ore e 42 minuti, seguito da Riccardo Faverio (4 ore e 46).Cecilia Pedroni ha imposto il ritmo femminile per tutta la mattina, tagliando il traguardo in 5 ore e 44 minuti. Secondo posto per Elena Lanfranconi con 6 ore e 25 minuti e terza posizione per Martina Brambilla (6 ore e 27).Ottime prestazioni anche sul percorso lungo che presentava qualche modifica rispetto al 2017, su tutte l’aggiunta del monte Pilastro, che, con la sua quota di 1800 metri, aumentava di 200 metri il dislivello totale. Si riconferma regina del TGS Extreme Cecilia Pedroni, guadagnando il traguardo in 5 ore e 58 minuti, mentre Danilo Brambilla migliora la sua prestazione presentandosi al traguardo dopo 5 ore dalla partenza, fresco e sorridente.Il riscontro generale è positivo: gli atleti concludono la loro avventura sul versante delle Grigne appagati e soddisfatti, il percorso, complice anche la splendida giornata di sole ripagano lo sforzo profuso.L’edizione 2019 si allunga di un po’ più di un kilometro rispetto alle due edizioni precedenti per la collocazione di arrivo e partenza nel centro storico di Mandello, in riva al lago aggiungendo alla gara un tocco di spettacolarità in più.

TGS - TRAIL DELLE GRIGNE SUD “SPRINT” - 21 km / 1.850m D+.Gara di corsa in montagna meno faticosa rispetto all’EXTREME ma ugualmente da non sottovalutare, 21Km di lunghezza con 1.800 di dislivello positivo; 3 salite, le prime 2 moderate, la terza in comune con il TGS ’EXTREME, impegnativa ma molto appagante: splendida vista sul lago fino a Bellagio e sulle Alpi.
Parcours superbe dans le Val Lamartinien, proche de Mâcon, en Bourgogne du sud dans cette région de vin et culture.

El Trail más antiguo de Extremadura en el suroeste de España en Torrejoncillo '' Pueblo de los Artesanos ''.Duro,  salvaje que se corre en condiciones de calor extremo al final del verano. Trail Ultra familiar a escala humana, diseñado por y para los corredores. Si te gusta la dureza y el calor, ven y disfruta.Trail Ultra Artesanos: ¡La montaña o tú!
Description in English
Oldest trail of Extremadura in the southwest of Spain in Torrejoncillo '' Pueblo de los Artesanos''.Hard, wild trail that runs in extreme heat conditions at the end of the summer. Human-scale family trail, designed by and for runners. If you like hardness and heat, come and enjoy.Trail Ultra Artesanos: The mountain or you!

Evento sportivo internazionale di TRAIL RUNNING  attraverso le magnifiche colline di LANGHE - ITALIA - PATRIMONIO MONDIALE DELL'UNESCO grazie all'eccezionale valore della cultura del vino Moscato, Barolo e Barbaresco, che nel corso dei secoli ha plasmato la terra. Vino, tartufi e paesaggi favolosi attendono gli atleti e gli escursionisti di tutto il mondo per abbinare gli sport all'aria aperta alla scoperta del territorio, dei paesaggi  della cultura del cibo e del vino . Si tratta di una corsa podistica di Trail Running interamente su sterrato tra le colline del Moscato, dei sentieri di Pavese, dei vigneti e dei boschi nei comuni di S. Stefano Belbo e Castiglione Tinella - ITALIA  - Si svolgerà il 29 SETTEMBRE - con tre Gare competitive : 54 Km " Lavorare Stanca "- 3000 mt di altitudine positiva / inizio alle 07:30 - 96% di sconto su strada - 21 Km "Paesi Tuoi" - 1100 mt di dislivello positivo / partenza 09.30 - 96% fuoristrada - 10 Km "Sali Scendi" - 650 mt altitudine positiva / partenza ore 10.00 con 80% sterrato e 20% asfalto .L'evento prevede anche altre tre proposte: - NORDIC WALKING (10 km -21 km) - inizio alle 10.15 - CAMMINATA ENOGASTRONOMICA con partenza alle 10.30 tra colline e agriturismi per degustare vino, tartufi e prodotti locali. - KIDS FUN RUN - Gara 2 km per bambini fino a 13 anni LA gara "TRAIL DEL MOSCATO" di 54 KM è sulla lista delle gare di qualificazione per  "Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc®" 2020.  e fa parte del  Grand Prix IUTA Ultratrail 2019
Description in English
International sports event RUNNING OUTDOOR through the magnificent hills of LANGHE - ITALY - UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITE thanks to the exceptional value of the culture of wine Moscato, Barolo and Barbaresco, which over the centuries has shaped the land. Wine, Truffles and fabulous scenery are waiting athletes and walkers from all over the world to match the outdoor sports to the discovery of the territory, landscapes and culture of gourmet food and wine . It is a running race of Trail Running entirely on dirt road through the hills of Moscato, Pavese’s paths, vineyards and woods in the municipalities of S. Stefano Belbo and Castiglione Tinella – ITALY - - September 29-  3 competitive RACES – - 54 Km “Lavorare Stanca” - 3000 mt positive altitude / start at 07.30 am - 96% off road - 21 Km “ Paesi Tuoi” - 1100 mt positive altitude / start at 09.30 am - 96% off road - 10 Km “Sali Scendi” - 650 mt positive altitude / start at 10.00 am- offroad e asphalt The event also provides other three proposals: - NORDIC WALKING - (10 km -21 km) – start at 10.15 - WALK WINE TOURISM - start at 10.30 through hills and farmhouses in order to taste wine, truffles and local products. - KIDS FUN RUN - Race 2 km for children till 13 years THE “TRAIL del MOSCATO” of 54 KM is on the list of Qualifying races for entry to “Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc®” 2020. Is a race of Grand Prix IUTA Ultratrail 2019

Description:
E’ Santo Stefano Belbo (paese natale di Cesare Pavese) Cossano Belbo, Castiglione Tinella e Mango in provincia di Cuneo che si corre  il 23 settembre la 7° edizione del TRAIL DEL MOSCATO. Una manifestazione internazionale organizzata dall’A.S.D. Dynamic Center VB con il Patrocinio della regione Piemonte, legata alla disciplina sportiva del Trail Running che si svolge attraverso le meravigliose e aspre colline dichiarate dall’UNESCO Patrimonio Mondiale dell’Umanità. L’intento è valorizzare questi territori (narrati da Cesare Pavese nei suoi libri) anche dal punto di vista sportivo. Le Colline delle Langhe rappresentano uno dei luoghi più' belli, caratteristici e suggestivi di tutta Italia per il loro paesaggio vitivinicolo e boschivo. Un connubio di paesaggi mozzafiato, con aspre colline che degradano verso pendii più dolci, completamente ricoperti da vigneti.  Dalle sommità dei rilievi la vista spazia fino alla Catena Alpina sin oltre il massiccio del Monte Rosa, tanto che nelle giornate terse le distanze sembrano annullate e pare di essere immersi in un unico stupendo e incredibile paesaggio. Il territorio poi offre ottimi prodotti enogastronomici e decine di agriturismi nei quali assaggiare e bere il cibo e il vino locale (Moscato, Barolo, Barbaresco, tartufi.  Un territorio “ancor selvaggio seppur dall’uomo trasformato” con dislivelli ottimali per questo tipo di competizioni sportive. Sul Tracciato di gara troverete sentieri, carrarecce, sterrati vigneti, boschi e piccoli borghi con una natura rigogliosa.Il percorso è impegnativo duro e muscolare ma corribile senza tratti esposti, adatto a chiunque sia ben allenato. Un Evento cresciuto in quattro anni che ha portato gli iscritti da 150 per il primo anno a 1500 nella sesta edizione e circa 8500 partecipanti dal 2012 ad oggi.Sono previste tre gare che prendono il nome dai romanzi di Cesare Pavese e partono tutte dalla piazza Umberto I° di S. Stefano Belbo1.	Una chiamata "LAVORARE STANCA" di 54 km  e 2800 m D+  con partenza ore 7.30 (Il 96 % del percorso è su sterrato e sentieri). Gara qualificante per il “ Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc®” – Gara del Grand Prix IUTA ULTRATRAIL 2019 – Gara del Corto circuito solidale ( cicuito “I run for find the Cure”)2.	Una chiamata "PAESI TUOI" di 21 Km 1100 m D+ con partenza ore 9.30  (Il 96 % del percorso è su sterrato e sentieri) 3.	Una chiamata "SALI SCENDI " di 10 km 550 m D+ NON competitiva. Con partenza ore 10.00 Sullo stesso percorso sono previste anche:- due camminate di NORDIC WALKING 21 km e 10 km   partenza ore 10.15- Il Territorio e i Comuni tengono particolarmente anche alla CAMMINATA ENOGASTRONOMICA organizzata in 6 tappe attraverso vigneti e agriturismi per consentire a chi desidera parteciparvi, di gustare i prodotti locali abbinati ad un ottimo vino con partenza ore 10.30.- Alle ore 11.00 sempre sulla Piazza di Santo Stefano Belbo è prevista la manifestazione “KIDS FUN RUN” corsa di 2 km attraverso il centro storico dove potranno partecipare tutti i bambini e ragazzi fino a 13 anni.Sito: www.dynamic-center.it/eventi/L’ A.S.D. Dynamic Center che organizza l’evento desidera, attraverso lo sport unito alla solidarietà, convogliare in una direzione ben precisa questa competizione. La manifestazione infatti è inserita nel C.C.S. (corto circuito solidale) 30 gare di trail e non solo, i cui organizzatori si sono impegnati a versare parte del ricavato per una azione solidale che per il 2018 è contribuire alla costruzione di una maternità in Mali. iscrizioni www.wedosport.net
Description in English
International sports event RUNNING OUTDOOR  through the magnificent  hills  of  LANGHE - ITALY   -  UNESCO  WORLD HERITAGE SITE  thanks  to the exceptional  value of the culture of wine Moscato, Barolo and Barbaresco,  which  over  the centuries  has  shaped the  land.Wine, Truffles and fabulous scenery are waiting athletes and walkers from all over the world to match the outdoor sports to the discovery of the territory, landscapes and culture of gourmet food and wine .It is a running race of Trail Running  entirely on dirt road through the hills of Moscato, Pavese’s paths, vineyards and woods in the municipalities of  S. LE TRAIL DES GORGES DU CHAMBON et du montbronnais EST UN TRAIL TRACE EN MILIEU NATUREL NE COMPORTANT QUE 10 % DE ROUTES BITUMES (PARTIES RURALES) ET 90% DE PASSAGES PRIVES ET PUBLIQUES OUVERTS EXCLUSIVEMENT POUR L’EVENEMENT70% DU PARCOURS EST SITUE EN ZONE NATURA 2000 ET 5 % PASSE SUR UNE RESERVE NATURELLE REGIONALE AVEC AUTORISATION EXCEPTIONNELLE UNIQUE CE TERRITOIRE DE CHARENTE LIMOUSINE ET PERIGOURDINE PEUT ETRE DE NATURE GRANITIQUE ,GNEISS, SABLE ET ARGILECE SONT LES PREMIERES TERRES DU MASSIF CENTRAL ET LE TERRITOIRE EST TRES ACCIDENTESITUE AU MILIEU DE LA VALLEE DE LA TARDOIRE RIVIERE QUI COULE AU FOND D’ UNE GORGE ASSEZ MARQUEEDE SA POSITION ELEVEE ON PEUT VOIR LES CAMPAGNES ANGOUMOISINES ET PERIGOURDINES 3 DEPARTEMENTS SONT VISIBLES : LA CHARENTE ,LA DORDOGNE ET LA HAUTE VIENNELES HABITANTS DU MONTBRONNAIS APPELLENT CET ENDROIT   ’LA PETITE SUISSE CHARENTAISE’

Description: El CEMO – Club d’Esports de Muntanya i Escalada d’Olocau y el Ayuntamiento de Olocau organizan por sexto año la Cursa de Muntanya d’Olocau dentro de su término municipal. Como en pasadas ediciones pretende ser una carrera totalmente SOLIDARIA, RESPETUOSA con el medio ambiente y siguiendo un carácter de eco-sostenibilidad. Los organizadores, sensibilizados con la necesidad de ayudar al colectivo de personas afectadas de parálisis cerebral y a sus familiares, toman la iniciativa de embarcarse otro año más en un gran proyecto junto al Club AVAPACE CORRE. Nos avalan 5 años de éxitos y con objetivos ampliamente cumplidos. Año tras año la Cursa se ha convertido en un referente. Desde el primer año la implicación de los participantes, de los voluntarios y de toda la gente en general ha sido multitudinaria. Creemos que además ha servido para dinamizar el término municipal. La Cursa de Muntanya d’Olocau es, por eso, un hito indispensable para la localidad. Junto a los organizadorres tendremos como colaboradores de La Cursa Muntanya Olocau a AVAPACE-CORRE, así como muchos voluntarios y empresas que nos prestarán su ayuda para tareas concretas entre las que destacamos CORREMON y LEONIA.

What started as an informal training run for the Javelina Jundred has evolved into one of our flagship races in the Insomniac Night Trail Run Series. Come experience the beauty of desert trail running at night under the near full moon! The Javelina Jangover Night Runs is the 6th race in the Insomniac Night Trail Run Series. You can complete one race in the series or do all eight! All Javelina Jangover Night Runs are staged out of the Pemberton Trailhead at McDowell Mountain Regional Park near Fountain Hills, Arizona. Take to the trails all night to complete 7 kilometers, 15 kilometers (New!), 25 kilometers,50 kilometers, or 75 kilometers of trails.
